Los negocios que las integrantes llevan adelante son variados: costura, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta, venta de artefactos, venta de ladrillos, venta de fruta, venta de jugos, venta de juguetes.

La señora María, tesorera de la banca comunal, indica que forma parte de la B.C. “Alborada”   13 ciclos, aproximadamente seis años y medio.  Actualmente separada, madre de dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de fruta.  La señora  María comenta que desde niña vendió fruta, primero con su madre y luego sola.  Su primer crédito fue de $us100 (Bs700) el que está solicitando en esta oportunidad es de Bs2000, en ambos casos está destinado a ser invertido en la compra de fruta.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta todo.
texts.en: The Alborada group is starting its seventeenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltacion central office. The group is made up of eight members. The community bank is directed by a board: a president, treasurer and a secretary. The members' businesses are varied: sewing, a grocery store, fruit sales, appliance sales, brick sales, fruit sales, games sales and toys sales. Maria, the community bank treasurer, says that she has been part of the Alborada group for 13 cycles, approximately six and a half years. She is currently separated. She is a mother of two children and her business is fruit sales. Maria says that she has sold fruit since she was a child, first with her mother and later alone. Her first loan was $100 US (700 bs). The loan that she is currently requesting is 2000 Bs. Both loans were to be invested in the purchase of fruit. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes everything.

loans.use: the purchase of fruit

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de  La Paz, tiene dos  hijos, el señor es artesano -carpintero, con el  ingreso que obtiene se mantienen, en anterior crédito realizó la refaccionar dos habitaciones. 

El crédito será utilizado en la compra de una máquina de coser recta, para facilitar su trabajo de costuras.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz.  He has two children.  He is a craftsman-carpenter.  He supports himself with the income that he gets.  He refurbished two rooms with his previous loan.

He will use the loan to buy an upright sewing machine to facilitate his sewing.  His previous history qualifies him for a new loan.  He is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for his craftsman's trade

loans.name: Emiline

texts.en: Emiline, 50 years old, has been selling food to earn a living for twelve years. She hopes to develop her business into a hotel in the future. Emiline believes that with the help of Faulu Kenya, she will manage to improve her business. With her first loan of 50,000 KES, she will buy rice, beans and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and cooking fat

loans.name: Kenneth Joy

texts.en:
Kenneth Joy M. is from the town of Banga.  She is 22 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old child. To make a living, Kenneth Joy plants and harvests rice for sale. She works hard to save for her child's future.

Kenneth Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizers to prepare her next harvest.

loans.use: To buy  seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy M. M. is widowed with two children, aged 3 and 6.  

He supplies bread to earn a living. He has been running the business for six years and has employed two people.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business. He has requested 40,000 KES to open another business, employ two people and obtain a business license.

He aspires to become an international businessman in the future.

loans.use: To open another business, employ two people and obtain a business license

loans.name: Raquel Sebastiana

texts.es: Raquel tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Pomalco en la parte rural de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Realiza esta actividad en un terreno situado cerca de su domicilio. Cría los animales y una vez que ellos alcancen un buen tamaño y peso los vende en el mercado local. Cuentan con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para realizar arreglos en su corral. Raquel cuenta con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales. Es muy trabajadora y encargada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio para poder seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old, widowed, and has 2 children.  She lives in her own home in Pomalco district, in the rural part of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For three years, Raquel has been raising and selling animals.  She carries out this business activity on a plot of land near her home.  She raises the animals until they reach a good size and weight, then she sells them in the local market.  She has an established customer base in the area.  Raquel learned this business from her father which means that she knows the work perfectly.  She has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to make some repairs to her pen.

Raquel has very good work and personal references.  She is very hard-working woman and committed to her family.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing her business so that she can get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her animal pen

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 51 años, es una mujer tierna y delicada. Vive en su casa hereda por su madre, con Raúl de 58, su esposo, su madre y sus 2 hijos, de los 5 que tiene en total.  

Desde hace 7 años Rosa, se dedica a la venta de pantalones y otras prendas casuales. Asimismo, a pedido de su hija que está en el extranjero, hace coser polos deportivos en los emporios comerciales de (Gamarra - Lima). Y, se los envía a su hija, quien los vende a todos los migrantes en ese país; en dólares y, parte de las ganancias le envía a Rosa, entre otras ropas americanas como pantalones, que también los vende en dólares a sus amistades; quines le pagan sin reclamo alguno. Por eso, se siente feliz de realizar, su negocio en común con su hija, de lo ambas ganan bien. Pero, en esta oportunidad, le urge abastecerse de prendas  casuales, para las celebridades del día de la madre, y posteriormente comprar telas y mandar confeccionar más polos. Está convencido, que trabajando arduamente en adelante, logrará instalar su tienda en su casa, por lo que muchas de sus amistades le reconocen.

Está agradecida por renovar su 26avo crédito con MFP, y promete continuar siendo puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo señala, que está feliz de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, en donde todas son responsables y se apoyan. 

De acceder el crédito que solicita, comprará ropas para damas, para las celebridades del día de la madre.
texts.en: Rosa is a 51-year-old tender and delicate woman. She lives in her mother's house along with her 58-year-old husband Raúl, their two children and her mother, so five people in all. For the past seven years Rosa has made a living selling pants and other casual garments. Also, at the request of her daughter who is living abroad, Rosa sews sports jerseys at the Gamarra-Lima commercial center. She then sends the items to her daughter, who sells them to other migrants in dollars, part of which she sends back to Rosa along with American clothes such as pants. Rosa's daughter also sells the pants to friends, who buy them without protest. Rosa feels happy about doing this work, a family business she has in common with her daughter, and it's going well on both sides. However, at this point, she has the urgent need to stock up on casual garments in advance of Mother's Day, and later to purchase fabrics to make more jerseys to send. Rosa is convinced that if she keeps working arduously she will be able to set up a store in her home that can attract many more of her friends and acquaintances. She is grateful to renew her 26th loan with Kiva partner MFP and promises to continue making her payments on time. She also says she is happy to belong to her community bank, where all the members are responsible and support her. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase women's clothing in preparation for Mother's Day.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing in preparation for Mother's Day

loans.name: Cristo Campesino Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO CAMPESINO”; Este banco está ubicado en el pueblo D. Huaccaytaqui, en la provincia D. Quispicanchis, departamento D. Cusco.

La Sra. Vicentina, es separada y tiene 40 años D. edad, ella tiene 2 hijos; la socia tiene una tienda pequeña D. abarrotes, ella venD. productos D. primera necesidad como azúcar. Arroz. Leche, entre otros, también venD. cuadernos, borradores y todo lo referente a útiles escolares. La socia tiene su tienda en el barrio D. San Sebastián ella tiene su negocio en la ciudad del Cusco desD. hace 6 años. La socia viaja constantemente a su tierra natal Huaccaytaqui, y deja su negocio con sus hijos para su atención mientras ella está D. viaje, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad y D. este modo abastecer su tienda abarrotes.

Los otros socios del banco comunal se dedican a la docencia, crianza D. animales menores, agricultura, ganadería, venta D. panes, venta D. caramelos, atención en una tintorería, lavandería, crianza D. animales para el engorD. y venta final.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en: The "Cristo Campesino" community bank is located in the village of Huacaytaqui, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, Peru. One of the members is Vicentina, a 40-year-old divorced mother of two children. She runs a small general store, selling primary-need products such as sugar, rice, milk and other items. She also sells notebooks, erasers and all kinds of school supplies. Her store has been in the San Sebastián neighborhood in the city of Cusco for the past six years. Vicentina travels constantly to her native Huacaytaqui and leaves her children in charge of the store when she is away. She is requesting the loan to purchase primary-need products and in this way stock her store. The other members of the community bank make a living in teaching, raising small animals, farming, raising livestock, selling bread, selling candy, providing dry-cleaning and laundry service, and raising animals to fatten and then sell. The members value and are grateful for the loan and promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase primary-need items to stock store

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 35 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Joselin de 15 y Nicol de 17 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El salón de belleza de Diana es uno de los visitados en su barrio Villa Estela, ella tiene un talento natural para cortarle el cabello a sus clientes, pero su fama principal y el motivo por el cual las buscan sus clientes, es por los novedosos cambios de peinados que realiza y es que tiene un muy buen ojo para sacar la belleza de la gente a relucir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuales son los estilos que están de moda, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el fuerte olor que despiden  los químicos con los que trabaja, aun así espera sacar adelante su salón de belleza y convertirla en la mejor de su barrio. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza para realizar un mejor trabajo en sus clientes.
texts.en:
Diana, age 35, is a very humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with husband Julio, age 35, and her two beloved children -- 15-year-old Joselin and 17-year-old Nicol, to whom Diana would like to bring a better quality of life. 

Diana's beauty salon is one of the most visited in her neighborhood of Villa Estela. She has a natural talent for haircuts, but the main reason that the customers seek out her services is because of her ability to make fresh changes to a client's hairstyle and because she has a good eye that allows her to bring forth a person's beauty and make it shine. 

What Diana likes best about her job is to advise her clients on what hairstyles are currently in fashion; she has been in this line of work for five years and finds that the most challenging aspect of her job is to be able to tolerate the smell that is given off by all the hairstyling products that she uses in her work. Diana would like to keep moving her business forward and to develop it into the best beauty salon in the neighborhood.

This is Diana's third loan with MFP, and she is committed to repaying it in a timely manner because she feels a sense of responsibility before her fellow members of the communal bank, where Diana is respected for the discipline she brings to the meetings. She plans to use the loan of 1500 soles to purchase beauty care products that will allow her to bring a better service to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase beauty care products

loans.name: Bendu Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “B.” group, from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, to make more sales and consequently to improve on their living conditions. 

Wurie B. is the leader of this group. This 40-year-old is married to a trader and they have 1 child. Wurie has been a businessman for 11 years now. He sells cotton clothes.  With his share of this loan, he will buy bales of cotton clothes for resale.  

(Included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy bales of cotton clothes for resale.

loans.name: Violeta Parra Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Violeta Parra” y está conformado por 19 integrantes, pertenecientes a la comuna de Estación Central ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre éstos se encuentran la venta de abarrotes, frutas, verduras y costuras, en diferentes puestos ubicados en la feria.
Ana quien en la foto aparece en el primer lugar del lado izquierdo, además viste una polera color fucsia y buzo gris. Se dedica a vender comida rápida, específicamente completos, empanadas y desayunos para los trabajadores y clientes de la feria libre en la cual instala su puesto. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 1 año, los días jueves, sábados y domingos, de las 6ºº am hasta las 16ºº horas pm. Su mercadería e ingredientes los compra generalmente en la vega de Lo Valledor, ésta es una feria de frutas, verduras y abarrotes, preferentemente para comerciantes. 
Por ahora Ana no se encuentra trabajando, ya que está embarazada y su estado de salud es delicado, por lo que debe mantener reposo en cama. Su edad de gestación es de 6 meses. De esta manera retomará sus actividades cuando se encuentre mejor.
El crédito lo utilizará para comprar mercadería y una cocina.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido en su misma casa, para vender sus comidas, además Ana tiene conocimientos de calidad y manipulación de alimentos y sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son debido a sus hijos, ya que de ésta manera los podría cuidar con mayor facilidad y flexibilidad horaria.
Ana vive junto a su suegra, su tío, su marido y su hija de 8 años de edad. Sus sueños son obtener el subsidio habitacional, para optar a su casa propia y así brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, por la oportunidad que le ha brindado para invertir en su negocio. Además le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, debido a la solidaridad y organización existente al interior del grupo de emprendedores. 
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
The Violeta Parra Community Bank has nineteen members and is located in the neighbourhood of Estación Central in Santiago. The women all have different stalls in the market selling groceries, fruit, vegetables, or sewing.

Ana (on the left of the photo wearing a fuschia-coloured top and grey sweatshirt) sells fast food such as completos (sandwiches), empanadas, and lunches to the workers and customers in the market where she has her stall. She’s been doing this for a year now, on Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays, from 6am to 4pm. She usually buys her supplies and ingredients in Lo Valledor market where she can buy fruit, vegetables, and groceries at preferential rates for merchants.

At this time Ana is not working as she is 6-months pregnant and not in good health so she has to have bed rest. She will begin work again when she feels better.

She plans to use the loan to buy supplies and a stove. Her goal is to have a permanent place in her house where she can sell meals. She is knowledgeable about food quality and how it should be handled. Ana is keen to continue with this work because of her children whom she will be able to care for more easily with a flexible work schedule.

Ana lives with her mother-on-law, her uncle, husband, and 8-year old daughter. Her dream is to obtain a housing subsidy so she can have her own house and provide her family with a better standard of living.

She is very grateful to Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza for this opportunity to invest in her business. As well she really enjoys participating in the meetings because of the commitment and organizational skills of the group.

Estación Central is a district with a plaza in the central area of Santiago (capital of Chile) which owes its name to the Central Train Station built in 1887 and declared a National Monument in 1983. At the beginning, this station and the Mapoche station were the entry points to the city on the Valparaíso-Santiago route as well as from the south part of the country.

loans.use: Para comprar mercadería y una cocina.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en:
Jim is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Jim has a shop that sells used clothing. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of used clothing or "ukay-ukay." 

Jim is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jim hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Nasibsho

texts.en:
Nasibsho is married and the father of five children. He is a singer and plays with a music keyboard. He works at national traditional wedding parties and other events in his region. He has many orders for different events. Each music depends on different occasions and keeps good memories. That’s why he tries to make happy his clients for a minute in order to give them good memories for many years. For this purpose Nasibsho has requested a loan of 3000$ USD for the purchase of a musical instrument KORG PA1XPRO (clavier/keyboard). 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument KORG PA1XPRO (keyboard).

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia es socia del banco comunal Manos Maravillosas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad y dos hijos.

Lleva siete años trabajando de esta manera y Manuela Ramos ha estado brindándole los préstamos que ha requerido en cada ciclo.  Gracias a su experiencia invierte cada préstamo adecuadamente.  Empezó con un poco de mercadería y ahora ya tiene buena cantidad de cajas de bebidas surtidas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 17 cajas de cerveza, 6 paquetes de gaseosa, 2 paquetes de agua mineral, 2 jabas de gaseosa oro.
La venta de sus bebidas las realiza por cajas y para llevar a sus casas, de esa manera evita tener que atender hasta muy tarde, ya que el trabajo doméstico también demanda esfuerzo.
"Ofelia nos comenta que... Manuela Ramos nos brinda la ayuda necesaria para poder iniciar nuestros propios negocios y no debemos desaprovecharla".
texts.en:
Ofelia is a member of the 'Manos Maravillosas' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 47 years old and has two children.

Ofelia has been working in her business for seven years and Manuela Ramos have been providing her with the loans that she has needed each loan cycle.  Thanks to her experience, she invests each loan properly.  She started out with just a little merchandise and now she has a good quantity of crates of drink in stock.

With this new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles, Ofelia will buy 17 crates of beer, 6 packets of soda, 2 packets of mineral water and two crates of Oro soda.  She sells her drinks by the box for people to take home with them.  In this way, she avoids having to remain serving in her business until very late as her housework also requires effort.

Ofelia tells us "Manuela Ramos provide us with the help we need to start our own businesses and we must not fail to make the most of the opportunity".

loans.use: to buy drinks (soda and beer)

loans.name: Renulfo

texts.es:
Renulfo es un señor casado, de 60 años de edad, que vive en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La calidad de vida de Renulfo no es la adecuada pues su casa no cuenta con los servicios básicos de saneamiento.

Renulfo es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un espacio acondicionado al interior de su sala. Además, cría aves de corral para venderlas y trabaja como peón agrícola. Su esposa lo apoya en las actividades que realiza, creando así una buena relación familiar.

Renullfo tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y desea invertir en su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan cumplir su objetivo.

Renulfo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería para surtir su bodega. Estas ventas le permitirán hacer mejoras en su domicilio y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Renulfo, 60, is married and lives in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura District.  Renulfo’s quality of life isn’t adequate because his house does not have basic sanitary services.

Renulfo is a hard working man who sells basic need items in a space equipped to do so in his house.  In addition, he raises barnyard fowl to sell and works as a field hand.  His wife supports his efforts and they form a good family relationship.

Renulfo very much wants to improve his quality of life and wants to invest in the business to obtain more profits that will allow him to reach his objective.

Renulfo is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy merchandise to stock his store.  Sales will make it possible for him to make home improvements and to grow in business.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 9 children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish (boneless danguit) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Margarita is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, fruits and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of green vegetables, fruits and tomatoes.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Après un deuxième échec au Baccalauréat, l'emprunteuse s'est mariée et a ouvert un télécentre à son domicile conjugal.L'arrivée massive des téléphones portables sur le marché l'obligera à fermer et à se lancer dans l'aviculture qui s'est avérée très rentable. Malheureusement, c'est à ce moment que sa fille unique, qui venait de décrocher avec brio le BAC,décéde, noyée dans une piscine olympique.Traumatisée, elle n'arrive plus à s'occuper de ses affaires et pire, elle se fracture elle meme une cheville.Le malheur ne venant jamais seul, son fils sera amputé d'une jambe à cause d'une tumeure chronique.le poulailler tombé en faillite, son mari lui vient en aide et lui ouvre dans leur maison, une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires.Aujourd'hui, elle commence à se relever et sa boutique génére des revenus qu'elle utilise pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite 400000F afin d'acheter du riz, de l'huile, du sucre, du lait et d'autres divers produits. Son ambition est de devenir le grossiste de la zone.
texts.en:
After failing to earn her high school diploma for a second time, this borrower got married and opened a “telecenter” in her home. Mobile phones have inundated the market, and this compelled her to close up her business and start off in poultry farming, which proved to be very profitable. 

Unfortunately her only daughter, who just brilliantly clinched her high school diploma, has died having drowned in an Olympic swimming pool. Traumatized, she is no longer able to take care of things; worse, she fractured her ankle. Misfortune never travels alone; her son will have his leg amputated due to a chronic tumor. And her poultry business has failed. 

Her husband is helping out and has opened a store in their house for selling grocery items. Today, she is starting to pick herself up, and her shop generates the revenues she uses to meet her needs and those of her children. 

To increase her working capital, she is requesting 400,000 francs to buy some rice, oil, sugar, milk, and various other goods. Her ambition is to become a wholesale merchant in her area.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, and various other goods

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is married and is spending ample time caring for her baby. Josephina is 22 years old and lives in Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home, offering most basic commodities and a few of other items, like school and office supplies, and accessories like hairpins, clips and headbands, etc. She has been running the business for over three years. Each month, she earns about PHP 6,800 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. 

Josephina is a current member of GDMPC. This is her second loan amount drawn out from the cooperative. In the future, Josephina hopes to improve and expand her business array to gain more income, thereby improving the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is married with 2 children. Anabel is 35 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Anabel sells Dried Fish to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3,000.00 to buy dried fish for her retail business.
Anabel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Anabel hope to become a supplier of dried fish in the whole Jimenez town.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: St. Mathew Development Group

texts.en: 26-year-old Mariam lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her two children. She sells shoes, a business she has run for one year. Her challenge is limited funds to meet the demands of her customers, and her dream is to trade on a wholesale basis plus to build commercial houses. Mariam wants a loan to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, dedicado a la producción de frijoles y maíz, además tiene ganado en sus tierras, su grupo familiar está compuesto por su esposa y tres hijos, él aprendió de pequeño todo el trabajo, pues siempre acompaño a su padre para poder conocer  y dedicarse a esta actividad.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono y herbicidas, pues está sembrando maíz y frijol, la compra de estos materiales le ayudara para proteger y fortalecer la siembra.
El quiere con el préstamo mejorar la producción en sus cultivos, para que al momento de sacar los frutos pueda vender para generar ganancias, colaborando con el progreso de su hogar.
texts.en:
José, a farmer, grows beans and corn.  He also has cattle on his land.  His family consists of his wife and three children.  He learned the job when he was a little boy, since he always went with his father to be able to learn and dedicate himself to this work.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and herbicides, since he is growing corn and beans.  The purchase of these materials will help him protect and strengthen the harvest.

With the loan he wants to improve his crop production.  When the crops are ready he can sell to generate earnings, contributing to the progress of his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Jonathan Nestor

texts.es:
Jonathan Nestor tiene 23 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Jonathan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar los abonos, insumos y  semillas sin ningún tipo de problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, las plagas de langosta en el maíz. El sueño es que nunca le falte el trabajo para poder dar el estudio al hijo.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
23 year old Jonathan Nestor lives with his common law wife and one son  in the Ventanas canton in the Ríos province.
The community bank LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO can be found in Recinto Caimato II, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This is an area of agricultural laborers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.
Jonathan Nestor is a farmer who sows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He does his buying and selling in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition.
The loan will help him greatly because he will be able to buy fertilizers and seeds without any problem.
The challenges that he faces frequently are: competition and crop pests, particularly locusts in the corn. His dream is that he will never be out of work so that his son can study. 
In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like urea, fertilizer, and weedkiller.

loans.name: Leonidez

texts.en:
Leonidez is from Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Leonidez has owned and operated a business selling goods in the local community for over 2 years, earning approximately 2,800 PHP a month.

Leonidez is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used  to purchase additional product goods such as shampoo, sardines and etc. 

In 2010, Leonidez joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to buy a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional product goods such as shampoo, sardines and etc

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLANQNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Milagros; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y también trabaja en una pastelería desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo y este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the “WARMICUNA LLANQNCHIS” communal bank, located in the Anta district, within the Anta province and Cusco department.

Milagros is 23 years old and the single mother of one son.  She sells beauty products and also works at a pastry bakery from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She moves her son ahead through these jobs.  She would like to expand her beauty products sales business and is asking for this loan in order to buy lipstick, creams, and perfumes in quantity.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel tiene 40 años,  es una persona muy trabajadora que con lo poco ingresos que genera su trabajo ha podido adquirir su vivienda donde habita con sus 4 hijos que actualmente habitan con ella. Reyna Isabel necesidad mejorar su vivienda lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento para poder realizar su sueño que es de tener bien acondicionada su casa lo cual con este crédito compraría lo que son los materiales para poder iniciar la construcción como son: cemento, bloque, arena, entre otros materiales que se requieren.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel, 40, is a very hardworking person who has managed to acquire her house with the little income her work generates where she lives with her four children .  Reyna Isabel needs to do some home improvements and this is why she’s asking for a loan to reach her dream of having her house well apportioned.  With this loan she will buy the materials to start construction.  She will buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among other required materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks, among others.

loans.name: Vanessa Gissell

texts.es:
Vanessa Gissell, de 26 años de edad, casada desde hace un año, vive en Chivana  Omoa Cortes.
Su esposo también se dedica al comercio.
Vanessa, hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, vende camisetas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas,  faldas, blusas y también zapatos para damas. Ella inicio este negocio con la ayuda de un hermano, así fue incrementando el inventario. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante de acuerdo a pedidos, ya tiene muchos clientes en la comunidad donde vive.
Este préstamo es el primero que solicita y es para invertir en  ropa como vestidos, blusas, pantalones, camisetas, camisas y faldas, para la venta  aprovechando  la temporada de navidad.
Esta muy emocionada con este negocio y quiere verlo surtido para incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Vanessa Gissell, 26, has been married for a year.  She lives in Chivana Omoa, Cortes.  Her husband is also a merchant.

Vanessa has been selling used clothes for a year.  She sells t-shirts, dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, blouses and also women’s shoes.  She started the business with her brother’s help and gradually has increased inventory.  Her sales take place at home and also in an itinerant manner based on prior orders; she has many customers in the community where she lives.

This is the first loan she’s asked for and it’s to invest in clothes like dresses, blouses, pants, t-shirts, shirts and skirts to sell taking advantage of the Christmas season.  She is very excited with the business and wants to see it well-stocked to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get treated by a dentist

loans.name: Bokk Jomm Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues de la même localité. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Coumba est une femme marié âgée de 44 ans et mère de 7 enfants . Elle est membre du BV depuis le premier cycle et fait parti du groupe de solidarité Bokk jomm. Elle EST  debout à l extrême gauche de la photo.

Coumba pratique le commerce de céréales une activité qu elle maitrise bien pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter du mil des arachides pour renforcer son activité.

Son objectif est de venir en aide à ses enfants dans la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire mais également  renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du BV.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 15 women who come from the same village. They got together based on personal affinities and neighborhood. Their main business is retailing.

Mrs. Coumba, age 44, is married and the mother of seven children. She's been a member of the Banc Villageois since her first loan, and is part of Bokk Jomm Group. She's standing on the far left in the photograph.

Coumba sells cereals, a business she masters due to the fact that she's been running it for a long time. Her new loan will enable her to buy millet and peanuts, in order to bolster her business.

Her goal is to help her children in taking care of the school and healthcare expenses, but also to bolster her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy millet and peanuts

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Blas” se encuentra en el octavo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 18 integrantes. Todas ellas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, distinto del que a ellas tocó vivir, por eso se esfuerzan para poder proveerles a sus familias el pan de cada día, la educación y formación.
Una de las miembros es Blanca, quien vende Leche por todo su vecindario. Ella comenta que ya tiene una clientela fiel formada, que siempre compran de ella el producto que vende. Empieza su jornada de trabajo desde muy temprano, pues la leche debe estar en las mesas de sus clientes para el desayuno. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado, dice, pero le gusta, pues es digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, y de esa forma tener un buen stock para cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The San Blas committee is now in its eighth cycle of the Enterprising Women of the Paraguay Foundation program and is made up of 18 members. All of them dream of a better future for their children than what they have lived through, which is why they make the effort to provide their family with daily meals, education and a good upbringing. 

Blanca is one of the group members. She sells milk all throughout her neighbourhood and tells us that she has steady and loyal customers who always buy their milk from her. Blanca starts her working day very early as the milk has to be on her customers' tables by breakfast time. She tells us that her job requires a great sacrifice, but she likes it because it is decent and honest work. 

Blanca is applying for a loan to buy enough milk to meet customer demand. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale

loans.name: Rosa  Alba

texts.es: Rosa Alba tiene 37 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería que la tiene  ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes y les ofrece variedad de productos y una excelente atención. Esta emprendedora tiene cinco hijos con la ayuda de su esposo han sacado adelante a su familia brindándole lo mejor. Esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería como granos básicos,  jabón, detergentes, huevos, pan, entre otros productos que más le demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa Alba is 37 years old.  She runs a small grocery store for a living, which is located in her home, where she serves her customers and offers them a variety of products and excellent customer service.  This enterprising woman has five children and, with the help of her husband, they have gotten their family ahead, offering them the best.  This enterprising woman is asking for financing to buy products for the grocery store like staple grains, soap, detergents, eggs, and bread, among other products that her customers ask for most.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soap, detergents, eggs, and bread, among other products her customers ask for most

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en: Kolab, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for more than four years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who earns about USD 4 per day. One of her children is a tourist guide who earns about USD 12 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Kolab is requesting a loan of USD 1400 to purchase more groceries for resale. This money will allow her to expand her grocery store and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Niyingabiye Group

texts.fr:
Daniel  fait partie du groupe  Niyingabiye  et   habite à Gitega. Il a 63  ans et est marié  à Angèle, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  bière de banane  depuis  27 ans. 

Il est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de bière de banane   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, il parvient à payer les frais scolaires des ses enfants, les soins de santé et à acheter les habits.En plus,Il a déjà acheté une parcelle pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the Niyingabiye group and lives in Gitega. He is 63 years old and is married to Angèle, a farmer. Together, they have three children, who all go to school. 

Daniel has been selling banana beer for 27 years. He is on his 11th loan with Turame. With this loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer to resell, and earn more. 

With the earnings from this business, he manages to pay his children's school fees, their healthcare needs, and buy clothes. In addition, he already has bought a piece of land for his children.

loans.use: to buy many cans of banana beer to resell

loans.name: Jennifer Alexandra

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha realizado esta actividad toda su vida y le ha resultado siempre muy productiva.  Trabaja sola todo el día haciendo sus recorridos para comercializar su mercadería.  No es casada pero tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Desea en un futuro cercano, poder incrementar su negocio grandemente para tener varios artículos surtidos.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de equipos, interiores y sostenes para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería (ropa)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 62-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with four adult children.

She and her husband reared their children for the past 15 years by operating their hog raising business, and also through fishing. This is quite difficult because raising hogs takes a few months before it will turn into cash. 

Because of that, Rosario is requesting a loan to buy piglets and feed as well. In the future, she dreams to expand her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Monique Gbénami

texts.en:
Born on May 2, 1968 in Lomé, Mrs. Monique Gbénamiest A. is a single woman with one child and three (3) brothers and sisters in her care. Abandoned and left to herself by her husband, she had to face life’s difficulties alone; this obliged her to run small business activities to pay for the education of her brothers and sisters, themselves abandoned by very poor parents. She benefitted then from a $400 loan to open a small shop selling general food supplies, liquor, and religious items. This business grew very quickly and Mrs. Monique is unable to respond to the demand of her clientele, which grows daily, because her financial means are very inadequate.

Today, despite a very low level of education, she strictly and efficiently manages her business and aims to enlarge her store. This is why she is asking for a new loan of $1200 to build up a supply of general food products and to respond to the demands of her customers. Thus, she will be able to increase her revenue and improve her standard of living and her family’s.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 2 Mai 1968 à Lomé, Madame A. Monique Gbénamiest une femme célibataire avec un enfant et trois (03) frères et sœurs à charge. Abandonnée et laissée à elle-même par son mari, elle dût faire face seule aux difficultés de la vie ; ce qui l’a obligée à mener des petites activités commerciales pour payer les frais scolaires de ses frères et sœurs abandonnés eux aussi par les parents très pauvres. Elle bénéficia alors d’un prêt $400 pour ouvrir une petite boutique d’alimentation générale et de vente de liqueurs et articles religieux. Cette activité a pris de l’ampleur très vite et Madame Monique est incapable de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui croît au jour le jour, car ses moyens financiers sont très insuffisants. Aujourd’hui, malgré son niveau d’instruction très moyen, elle gère avec efficacité et rigueur son commerce et compte agrandir sa boutique. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1200 pour s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale et répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To build up a supply of general food products

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: My name is Jorge C. and I have been selling dairy products for 3 years. I have a great clientele who loves the taste of my product. My goal is to increase my inventory to improve my sales. With the profits I will be able to feed my family and help my grandson who is about to start school.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese, butter, cream cheese, cottage cheese, curd cheese, etc.

loans.name: Soeut

texts.en: Soeut S. is married for more than 10 years and has five children--two daughters and three sons. Three of the children are in school and the other two are still very young. Mrs. S. learned to weave from her neighbor when she was 17 years old. She has two looms, one for herself and another one for her daughters and her husband to use. Mrs. S. trained her husband to weave, which every day while his daughters are in school. The children assist their parents at home with small tasks related to silk production. In addition, the family also employs a few young people in the village in embroidering and preparing the thread on the loom for weaving. The family believes this business will help their children gain real skills for the future. After having only one loom for years, a loan from MAXIMA helped Soeut build another loom for her husband. She would like a loan of $600 to buy silk materials and sewing thread. The business is doing well and they are confident they will be able to quickly repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim S. is a 33 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province.  She lives with her mother and her two children. Mrs. Sim works in a garment factory and also sells dessert on the roadside.  Her work gives her a total daily income of $5/day.  This loan will be used for her to purchase more tools, a fruit blender, and utensils for her business.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: To purchase a fruit blender and more utensils for her business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Luisa A. was born in the province of Inhambane, she is a single mother of 6 children. The father of her children has a wife of his own. Luisa has always cares and provided her children on her own. She joined the FDM in 2006. Her first loan was of 125$ which she repaid in 3 months. Luisa is in the 4th cycle of the program, she is requesting a loan of 225$ to buy more goats to resell.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa A. natural da Provincia de Inhambane,e solteira, mas tem 6 filhos. O pai dos filhos vive com a sua propria esposa. Luisa foi quem sempre cuidou dos filhos sozinha. Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006. O primeiro emprestimo que tomou foi de $125 a serem pagos num prazo de 3 meses para a compra de cabritos para a revenda.Como o negocio esta-lhe a correr bem ela ja esta no quarto ciclo e pretende tomar agora $225 para aumentar o numero de cabritos a comprar, pois que a procura de cabritos aumentou e ela precisa de satisfazer a demanda em termos de procura destes animais, quer para consumo, quer para criacao por parte dos seus clientes.

loans.use: Buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sra. Sara belongs to the "Las Azucenas" (The Lillies) community bank in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 41 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is an electrician but his earnings weren't covering the family's expenses so Sara decided to start a clothes-selling business, bartering goods in exchange for products like animals, grain and platanos.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,500 (1,500 Peruvian soles or about US$500), to be repaid in 4 months, Sara will buy a dozen blouses for S/.150, a dozen pairs of pants for S/.400, two dozen towels for S/.300, a dozen mosquito nets and two dozen pairs of sandals.

Sara is pleased that the hard work she does is for the good of her family even though she often has to leave them to keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Azucenas”, su vivienda está ubicada en el A.H. Unión de Damnificados MZ.182 LT.8 del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 3 hijos. Su esposo es Técnico Electricista y lo poco que ingresaba al hogar no alcanzaba para los gastos familiares, por lo que ella decidió viajar y dedicarse a la venta de ropa por zonas aledañas el río, haciendo trueque con sus productos (cambio de producto por animales, granos y plátano).

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500.00 (US$ 500.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una docena de blusas a S/. 150 soles, una docena de pantalones a S/.400.00 , dos docenas de toallas a S/. 300.00, una docena de mosquiteros y dos docenas de sandalias.

Sara se siente contenta y satisfecha porque sabe que el esfuerzo que hace es por el bienestar de la familia, aunque tenga que dejarlos por varios días, mientras el esposo se hace cargo del hogar

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis is 45 years old, married and the father of 2 children. His entire family depends on his business located in the Laureles Norte neighborhood where he sells a variety of basic food products. Luis would like to purchase foodstuffs and perishable goods to be able to offer them to his clients and thus expand his business a little.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

El Señor Luis tiene 45 años, casado, con 2 hijos. Toda la familia subsiste por medio del negocio en el cual vende productos varios de consumo diario, ubicado en el barrio Laureles Norte. Don Luis desea comprar productos alimenticios y perecederos para odertarles a sus clientes y así poder expandir un poco el negocio.

loans.use:
Purchase of foodstuffs and perishable items for sale.

Comprar productos alimenticios y perecederos para su venta

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. S. Man, age 25, and his wife have been married since 2002 and have one daughter. They are in the business of selling beef in a market at Kampong Cham province, about fifty kilometers away from their house. Man buys cows from his village and his wife sells the beef in the market. They started their business of selling beef at the beginning of 2007. Man and his family are living at National Road 6, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Man is requesting his second loan for $1000. He will use this loan to expand his beef selling business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Reyna's Group

texts.en:
Alberta and Reyna have been members of the “Aleli” community bank for seven years. In that time, they have learned the importance of saving, punctuality, and responsibility.

Alberta is 42 years old. She lives with her partner and two young children. Alberta has a business selling small items, such as candies, stickers, and cigarettes, from a cart at various locations in the city. Alberta has been running this business for ten years.

Reyna is 45 years old. She also lives with her partner and two children. Reyna raises animals, such as cows and sheep, and sells them from her house. She has had this business for five years.

Alberta and Reyna each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in candies, gum, cookies, juice, animal feed, and baby animals.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Alberta and Reyna plan to use their savings to pay for unexpected expenses, to make their homes nicer, and to buy more land. Their dream is to continue moving forward in life.

loans.use: Alberta and Reyna each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in candies, gum, cookies, juice, animal feed, and baby animals.

loans.name: Nezia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Nezia L.. She is single and has 7 children.

In 2002 Nezia established a clothing business. Nezia now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing

loans.name: Fatuma Nasur`s Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 28, is the leader of this group.  Fatuma is married with four children. They are aged 13, 11, 8 and 1.7 years old. The three oldest children are in school.
Fatuma has just taken a loan for Shillings 800,000/=. She will use the loan to increase her stock of clothes and shoes. She hopes the increased profits will add to her savings so she can rent a shop in Kampala City Center.

The community she lives in is semi-urban.  The challenges she faces are the long distances she has to travel to get to her different distribution points, fatigue, staying away from home for most of the week and carrying her baby with her. 

Her children are able to go to boarding schools because of MCDT loans. She is also able to get the basic needs met for her family. Fatuma has also contributed to the procurement of a plot of land outside Kampala and has bought a motorcycle for public hire. She plans to rent a shop in Kampala City Center in order to reduce on the number of days that she stays away from home.  Fatuma has paid over ten loans back successfully to MCDT.

loans.use: To purchase new and secondhand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Lynda

texts.en: Mrs. Lynda E. is 34 years of age and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 3 children and she sells general provisions and foodstuffs in a business that she learnt for 3 months and then started in 2003.  She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more inventory and thereby improve her business.  She has been in LAPO for 3 years as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Felicien

texts.fr:
Felicien D. is 30 years old, married, and the father of two. To earn money, he operates a food market in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With his second (loan) from FECECAV, he hopes to buy beverages, sandalettes (flip-flops), canned foods, and other various goods to increase the capacity of his shop. This will enable him to better meet the demands of his customers and to support his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Felicien D. est âgé de 30ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent il opère un marché alimentaire à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son deuxième de FECECAV, il espère acheter les boissons, les sandalettes, les boites de conserves et les autres produits variés pour augmenter la capacité de sa boutique ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase his shop's capacity

loans.name: Luasefulutasi

texts.en:
Luasefulutasi F., 26, is single with no children.

She has three years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the public three days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~$125 USD).

SPBD loans are Luasefulutasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used for the business and for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase a canoe, fishing net and more things needed for fishing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Señora Lucía is 41 years old. She completed 5th grade. She's married and has 2 children ( a boy and a girl) who currently depend on her financially.

She's a member of the communal bank called "Primero de Agosto" in the district of Zepita in the state of Chucuito-Juli in the region of Puno. She became a member because she needed to increase her merchandise in her butcher shop called "Emporio La Rueda" which is located in the local supermarket in Zepita. With her first loan, she bought 2 sheep to process the meat.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase 4 lambs to process meat. She's very happy since every day she's able to increase her inventory and her bottom line.

Her future goal is to one day own a bakery shop and that her kids will finish school and become professionals.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucía tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es casada y madre de 2 hijos (01 mujer y un varón), quienes aún depende de ella. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto, del distrito de Zepita, provincia de Chucuito – Juli y Región Puno. Se asoció al Banco por falta de capital para incrementar más mercadería en su tienda de Carnecería Emporio La Rueda, que está ubicada en el mercado de abastos de Zepita tienda Nº 4. En el cual, su primer crédito fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, con ese dinero compró 2 ovejas mejorados para carnear. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 4 corderos para carnear. Ella esta feliz ya que cada día está incrementando su mercadería y capital, asimismo está obteniendo un poco más de ganancia de su negocio. Su visión es instalar una tienda de plastequería en la ciudad de Desaguadero y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase lambs to process the meat

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Amelia, socia del Banco Comunal “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, menestras y carne de aves en su puesto de venta que ella tiene en el mercado nuevo de la ciudad de sisa. Generar ingresos diarios y las ganas de salir adelante, la motivaron a iniciarse en el negocio, además le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes. 

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará diversos productos como jabón de diferentes marcas y tamaños (marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.), papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar en sacos, lejía, detergente, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, gallinas, maní, papa y diferentes tipos de menestras para ofertar a sus clientes.

Maria Amelia tiene 55 años, 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son independientes, cada uno con su familia. Ahora vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aún está a su cargo y está estudiando, ambos la apoyan en el negocio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas, desea en el futuro ampliar y surtir más el negocio,  quiere vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Amelia, member of the Community Bank "Doradinas en Acción," lives in the state of San Martín, province of El Dorado, district of San José de Sisa. She has a small store where she sells groceries, dried beans and grains and chicken from her stand in the city of Sisa's new market. Earning a daily salary and getting ahead in life were motivation to start the business, as well as liking the contact with friends and clients. With the $350 loan, to be paid in four months, she will buy a wide variety of products to offer her clients, such as soap of different brands and sizes (Marsella, Bolívar, Jumbo, etc.), packs of toilet paper, canned fish, oil by the liter, rice, sacks of sugar, bleach, detergent, different brands and sizes of milk, hens, peanuts, potatoes and different dried beans and grains. María Amelia is 55 years old with three children, two of which are independent and have their own families. She lives with her husband and her one child that still goes to school. They both help her out with the business. She is a hard-working woman and responsible with the work she takes on. For the future she wants to make her business larger both in size and in amount of products stocked, and she wants to sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products for her store: soap, toilet paper, canned fish, oil, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S. lives in Boeng Krum Leu Village in Kandal Province. She is a breeder who raises 14 pigs. Because her pigs now are bigger and bigger, she cannot afford to buy pig food; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food to feed her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Soeng Ravoeurn, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Seng S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. One child is attending the local school, and the younger one is four years old and thus too young to work or study. Mrs. Seng S.’s husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pig food to feed her pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 22 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị Liên là chăn nuôi và lương thợ xây của chồng. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Liên đã ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  12.000.000đ, một phần chị sử dụng để mua thêm 1 con bò về nuôi, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua máy gặt lúa về  phục vụ bà con địa phương để phát triển kinh tế gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 22 years old, has been participating in the Fund since joining in 2002. Currently her family's main source of income is raising livestock and her husband's construction work. With and income of 3,500,000 VND per month, the family's finances are becoming more stable day by day and is also improving. In this round of funding, she would like to receive a loan of 12,000,000 VND; a portion of this will be used to buy one cow to raise, and the remaining amount to invest in a wheat harvesting machine to provide a service for the local people, with both aims to develop the family's finances.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new wheat harvesting machine

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna has been running her small enterprise for about three years. Low income and desire to survive in Vinogradovo, which is a small town in Western Ukraine, motivated her to launch this venture and start selling textiles and fancy goods in a local mall. Ganna doesn’t face high competition which definitely benefits her sales. Presently, she has 45,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her monthly income is about 4,000 Grivnas.

Ganna’s business has benefited a lot from additional financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. Moreover, the favorable location of her small outlet only added to success of her trade. Ganna is very determined and hard-working. She is single and can devote much time to her enterprise. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional stock. She is hoping to repay this short-term express loan in a month.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sr. Reyna tiene 32 años de edad, habita en  un barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Laureles Norte, casada su esposo es técnico de electrónica, tiene un niña 4 años de edad, los planes para su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa, acondicionándola y ofrecerle un patrimonio a su hija para un futuro. Doña  Reyna se desempeña como profesora en tres colegios y tres horarios diferentes de la capital con cinco años de experiencia de enseñar pues trabaja en tres turnos para obtener más ingresos, Sus objetivos en el ámbito laboral es seguir ofreciendo su servicio de profesora en otras arias de la educación. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y ladrillo, ofreciéndole para hacer su casa de concreto ya que es de zinc, y desea tener una casa digna y segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is 32 years old, lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua called Laureles Norte, is married to an electrical technician and has a 4-year-old daughter. Her future plans for her family include finishing the construction of their home, fixing it up, and they hope to be able to save some money so that their daughter can have a future. Reyna works as a teacher is three schools and three different schedules in the capital. She has five years of experience but works three jobs in order to have more income. Her career objective is to continue providing her services as a teacher in other areas of the education field. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she will be able to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, cement block, and brick, allowing her to make her house concrete instead of the current material which is zinc. She hopes to have a dignified and safe home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to construct her home of concrete.

loans.name: Saidmahmadhuja

texts.ru: Темурхуджаев Саидмахмадхуджа житель района Шахринау. Женат и имеет очень большую семью. У него шестеро детей и всех их он обеспечивает сам, так как жена является домохозяйкой . Обеспечивает семью путем занятия бизнесом. Работает  на рынке где торгует продуктами питания. Кроме того он привозит уголь  из отдаленных горных селений и реализует у себя в кишлаке. Уголь используется для отапливания жилых помещений. Кредит планирует использовать для магазина ппродуктов питания , где хочет закупить холодильник , а так же увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saidmahmadhuja T. is a resident of Shahrinav region. He is married and has a very large family. He has six children and provides for them all himself since his spouse is a housewife. He has a business that supports his family. Saidmahmadhuja works at the market, where he sells food products. In addition, he trucks in coal from remote mountain villages and sells it at his shop in town. The coal is used to heat residences. Saidmahmadhuja plans to use the loan for his grocery store. He wants to buy a refrigerator, as well as increase turnover. He will repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Lidio Luis

texts.es: LIDIO TIENE 56 AÑOS Y SU ESPOSA TIENE 49 AÑOS, AMBOS SON CASADOS, TIENEN UN HIJO QUE VIVE CON ELLOS Y QUE ACTUALMENTE ESTUDIA. VIVEN EN UNA VIVIENDA PROPIA, HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO, EN LA CUAL HA HECHO VARIAS MEJORAS, LUGAR DONDE HAN PUESTO UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA, SU ESPOSA TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO DE LA COMIDAS. LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA POR ESO TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA, ADEMAS  QUE ESTA EN BUENA UBICACION, NO HAY OTRO NEGOCIO POR ESTA ZONA, TAMBIEN EL TITULAR DEL CREDITO ES EMPLEADO EN EL INGENIO DE LA LOCALIDAD, DONDE TRABAJA HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN MEJORAS EN SU INMUEBLE, ESTE CREDITO ES SU QUINTA OPERACION, HA TENIDO UN BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO EN AGROCAPITAL, PRESENTA DEUDAS EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS QUE SE PAGAN CON NORMALIDAD.
texts.en:
Lidio, 56, and his wife, 49, have a son who lives with them and is currently a student. They have made various improvements to their home, where they have lived for a long time, including the addtion of a business selling food. His wife has experience in food sales. There is not a lot of competition because the work is demanding. Additionally, it is a good location and there is not another business in this area. Also, the borrower is employed in the local mill, where he has been working for some time. The loan will be invested in building improvements. This is his fifth loan and he has had good credit with Agrocapital; he has debts with other financial institutions that he pays regularly.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building improvements

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng K., 60, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province with her only child. To earn a living, she sells traditional medicine and makes US$4 per day. She is also supported by her child who works in the garment factory. Seng K. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase more traditional medicine to sell. She believes this opportunity will enable her to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for resale

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Боймуродов Файзали проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 24 года. Женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет среднее образование. Работает в сфере производства. Производит национальные сундуки. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 8 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет ему иметь в запасе подручный материал.Погасить кредит планирует в течение шести месяцев.
texts.en:
Faizali B. lives in the Gissar area. He is 24 years old, is married and has three children. He has a high school education. Faizali works in manufacturing. He makes traditional chests. Faizali has been in this business for 8 years now. He plans to take out a loan in order to purchase materials. This will help him to have needed materials in stock. He plans to pay back his loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Safura

texts.en: Safura M. is a 42-year-old woman who raises calves and brings up her two children. Safura started this business five years ago to increase income in her family and cover her children's basic needs. Safura has applied for 1500 USD loan to purchase three calves and fodder. She is dreaming of providing her children an excellent education. Safura and her family count on your help.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Meua Group

texts.en:
Meua is the leader of Meua group. They are four members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to progress their business and make it enormous.

Meua wants to take a loan for her husband's stationary shop. Gul Stan wants to take a loan to expand a general store. Now Gul wants to take a loan for her husband's fruit and greenery shop. Zaker wants to take a loan to expand a tailoring business. They are requesting a loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of eight months. They are all very thankful for FAS and Kiva lenders for supporting all poor people.

loans.use: To expand her husband's stationary shop.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif K. has dedicated himself to raising sheep since 2000. He is a married father who supports his one daughter. His wife also helps him with the business. Akif is faced with the need to purchase more sheep. The animals Akif raises are sold to farmers. To acquire the animals, Akif has come to AqroInvest to obtain the necessary credit so he can continue to maintain his dear home.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sheep.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience K. is sixty-three years old and is widowed. She lost her husband barely one month ago and is still in the period of mourning - hence, her dark-colored clothes. She has six children to cater for: three sons and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Patience works very hard to provide for the family. She is a trader and trades in vegetables. She buys her goods such as peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc. from surrounding farming communities. She sells in a kiosk in the market square and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Patience has been in business for ten years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Sarah Kabagaya‘S Group

texts.en:
Sarah is the leader of a four-member group. She is 42 years old and divorced, with one child aged nine years who goes to school. Sarah resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she lives with two people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity and no piped water at her home but the family gets three meals a day.

Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She has a stall in Kamwokya Market and so she doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week and her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both accommodation and business, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Sarah has been with MCDT for over three years and is servicing her seventh loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. Sarah is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises and home.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Muhammad Shafeq Group

texts.en: M. Shafeq is the leader of M. Shafeq group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for expanding their businesses. M. Shafeq is a mechanic and wants a loan for his shop in which he repairs cars. Afeza wants a loan for her husband who has a fruits and vegetables shop. Maeruam wants a loan for her tailoring business. Abdul K. wants a loan for his truck. They are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani, and they are very happy about this loan process that is available in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supply her store

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La señora Eva es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hijo, ella pudo estudiar la educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio de Lacaya.
