Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de compra de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar ganado menor para engorde, para luego venderlos en las ferias de la región.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando y educar a sus hijos en primer lugar.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y los encuentros de Bancos Comunales.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y con 4 hijos, ella estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en el Centro poblado de Churo Maquera.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, este capital  ella lo invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino, su negocio es una vez por semana en las ferias de los domingos en Ilave.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros ya las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the town of López in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 32 years old, married with four children. She has elementary school education and lives in the town of Churo Maquera. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for six months. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase sheep. She is now requesting an additional loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of sheep to be sold in the Sunday weekly town fair in Llave. Her greatest wish is to continue working. She enjoys the savings and the loan meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Sella

texts.en: Sella A. is a 29-year-old married mother of four school-going children. She lives with her family in Manyatta, Kisumu, Kenya. Since 2003 she has been buying and selling second-hand clothes at Kibuye market. She currently needs a loan of 20,000 KES to improve her stock levels, which have decreased.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana María R. desde hace 16 años se ha dedicado a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras en su establecimiento ubicado en el mercado Ivan Montenegro del departamento de Managua.

Ha decidido solicitar un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los perecederos como son frutas y verduras y de esta manera mejorar su situación ya que aumentarán sus ventas de frutas y verduras.

loans.use: Compra de frutas y verduras

loans.name: Philly's Group

texts.en:
Philly L. is 27 years old and the leader of his group in Lugazi. He has been running his shop for 10 years and uses all the profits generated from the business to pay the school fees of his brothers and sisters (he has 4 sisters and 1 brother). At his shop one can find a variety of items, including, but not limited to, soap, biscuits, cola and shoe polish.

Recently the prices of goods have gone up, so Philly has had to raise the prices in his store. This is affecting business adversely, but Philly is confident that sales will soon recover. In the meantime, he would like to use the loan to maintain his inventory. "The competition is tough," Philly says; in order to retain his customer base he has to offer incentives, like a free sweet with a purchase larger than 5,000 USH. Philly is incredibly hardworking and hopes that he will be able to continue supporting the education of his siblings, even at the university level.

loans.use: increasing inventory

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 27 years old and she is married to Felix O.. The couple has been blessed with three children: Angelica - 12 years old who is in 1st year high school; Cristine Joy - 10 years old who is now a grade-IV pupil; and Felix Jr. - 6 years old.

Arlyn sells fruit and at the same time she also manages their passenger motorcycle. She is busy vending some fruit while her husband is busy cultivating their rice fields.

According to Arlyn, she would like to have a better living but she said that she couldn’t make it because she doesn’t have enough capital for her business. For this reason she would like to borrow capital of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. This amount will really help her in fulfilling her dreams in life so she hopes that her request will be granted.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for business development

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is thirty-two years old. She is married and has six children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Joyce is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She buys the goods from nearby communities. Joyce has been in business for two years and requests a loan to procure bags of flour and other bread baking ingredients in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is Fatmata S.. She is 40 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has three children: one boy and two girls - two in secondary school and one in primary school.

Fatmata has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Fatmata sells wrapping (a type of Sierra Leonean cloth) from her house in Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by increasing her inventory of cloth. With her new loan she hopes to increase her business again by buying more of the same goods.

loans.use: To buy more wrapping

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth E. is married. Elizabeth sells phone cards and accessories at Asikyano near Methodist at Abura, a suburb in Cape Coast, work which she has been doing for some time now. Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more phones and accessories for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to invest into her business.

loans.use: purchase more phones and accessories for sale

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: This young lady is married and has one child. She was born in 1983. Dunyamaliyev lives in Fuzuli region. She has been in this business for two years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy chickens and ducks to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Concepcion's Group

texts.en:
Concepcion C. is 44 years old with four school-aged children who lives in the village of Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Concepcion owns and operates her own general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Concepcion joined ASKI to gain access to their financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI which she used to buy additional products to sell, this will be the fourth loan taken out by Concepcion from ASKI. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use all of her profits to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Madame Penda D.  mariée et mère de 5 enfants  est membre U-IMCEC Diourbel  depuis 2 mois. Elle vend des produits céréaliers tel que le niébé (haricots), arachide, fleurs de bissap,...etc depuis 10 ans dans son quartier  Ndayane à Diourbel. C’est de par sa grand-mère qu’elle embrassa ce métier. Cependant, elle a préféré vendre devant chez elle pour mieux attirer ses clients et, dit-elle, même la nuit les clients viennent acheter  des produits chez elle. Pour mieux faire face à la demande, elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 FCFA  destinée à s’approvisionner en produits cerealiers auprès de ses fournisseurs.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 5 children, Madam Penda D. is a member of U-IMCEC Diourbel for 2 months. She's been selling grain products such as niébé ( beans) peanuts, bissap flowers,... for 10 years in her neighborhood in Ndayane in Diourbel. It is through her grand mother that she embraced this trade. Meanwhile, she prefered to sell infront of her house to better attract her customers and according to her, customers come even in the night to buy products from her home. In order to better meet their requests, she is requesting a loan of 50 000FCFA for supplies of grain products from her suppliers.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain products

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Adriana A. es propietaria de su propio negocio de ferretería donde ofrece todo tipo de artículos ferreteros y es muy visitada por los clientes por lo que siempre está buscando como lograr su satisfacción para que continúen comprándole los productos.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra útiles escolares para comercializarlos en la ferretería ya que al haberse acercado la época de estudio, ella desea que los clientes que le visitan para comprar los artículos ferreteros también puedan comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adriana A. has a hardware store in Managua's Mayoreo market where she offers all kinds of hardware merchandise; she is visited often by customers who are looking to satisfy their needs buying her products. She will use the funds to buy school supplies to sell in the hardware store because, as the new school term approaches, she wants the customers who come to buy hardware to also be able to buy school supplies for their children at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: June

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old single mother of two who has been selling second-hand clothes for the last five years. She is a former employee of Kenya Bereau Limited (KBL).

Jane appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her with three loans which have improved her business, hence earning more profit. She wants a loan of Kes 40,000 to add to her stock of clothes. She hopes to increase her sales so as to improve her income.

In ten years time, Jane wants to be in her own permanent shop. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Adjowoa

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerçait le métier de la couture dans son propre atelier. Plus tard elle a trouvé goût à un autre commerce qui est celui de commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a alors abandonné la couture au profit de la vente de produits d’alimentation générale qui lui réussit bien, voulant agrandir son commerce elle sollicite un prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale ainsi elle réalisera de grosses recettes.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de Lomé appelé  Hedzranawoé, avec son revenu elle participe aux dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Adjowoa used to be a seamstress with her own shop. Later she found she liked selling general food products. She thus stopped her work as a seamstress and began to sell food products. She has been successful and now wants to grow her business. For this purpose she is requesting a loan to purchase general food products and thus bring in a lot of money. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in the Hedzranawoé neighborhood of Lomé. With her income she is able to contribute to paying the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general food products

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand Otoole S. is forty-four years old, married and has three children. His business is located at Magongo Estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the white Indian Ocean beaches. He has been selling such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks and other items for the last ten years to the local people.

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business in the area and so customers have many choices. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more general items to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in future. He is a very hard-working man.

loans.use: buy general items to expend retail business

loans.name: 18.06.50 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Huong N. T. is 28 and lives in Thanh Hoa.  She is the group leader of a 3-member group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 50-Quang Hung (180650-Quang Hung).


Huong is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, she owns & operates a furniture making business; she makes and sells bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members.  Huong has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huong repaid her previous loan of 3253800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she used to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 3079800 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be her 3rd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Thanh is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.


2.  Lê Thị Cầu is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huong N. T. (2) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Huong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 50-Quang Hung (180650-Quang Hung).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang T.ết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huong kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2009, Huong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huong đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua dụng cụ & T.ết bị khác để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Thanh (6) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị Cầu (3) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: El Retoño 2009 Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: RETOÑO 2009  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Palmira, ubicado en la avenida Las Ameritas , el B.E. esta en su 2do  ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, Se fundo el  17 de  Noviembre  del 2009, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras, 

Como PRESIDENTA tenemos a la Señora Yina , TESORERA la  Sr. Yorgina y SECRETARIA la Sra. Mónica, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican en  mayoría en la  venta de cosméticos ,ropa ,comida ,abarrote , costurera, transportista, y otros. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días miércoles   a horas 14:00 PM en la casa de la señora Yina. Los nuevos clientes que hemos captados ,están conforme de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitación del  B.E. RETOÑO 2009  ,se les estableció una proyección de sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

La Sra. YINA (Presidenta) vende de cosméticos  de manera ambulante, también desarrolla otro tipo actividad económica, como la venta de joyas por catalogo, también de manera ambulante en la zona en donde vive y  de   en diferentes mercados populares. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona  se  siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño de la señora  Yina  es tener   una vitrina  para la exposición de sus joyas y cosméticos y  progresar en la vida con su negocio.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Retoño 2009 Communal Bank is located on Avenida Las Ameritas in the neighborhood of Palmira. The communal bank is in its second loan cycle, and is made up of 10 individuals. The bank was founded by a group of women on November 17, 2009. The communal bank’s president is Yina, the treasurer is Yorgina, and the secretary is Mónica. Most of the women in the group make a living selling cosmetics, clothing, food, or groceries; working as seamstresses; providing transportation; or in other activities. The group meets at 2:00 PM on Tuesdays at Yina’s house. The new members who have joined are happy to work with Emprender, since they learned during the Retoño 2009 Communal Bank’s training about the projected savings at the end of the loan cycle. As they work with the communal bank they will learn to save and to share with their friends every 14 days. Yina (the president) sells cosmetics as a street vendor. She is also developing other types of economic activities, such as selling jewelry from a catalog, which she also does as a street vendor in the area where she lives and in various popular markets. During her time with the communal bank she has learned to save and to love and value herself as a person, and she feels that she learned useful skills during the training. Yina’s dream is to have a shop window where she can display her jewelry and cosmetics, and to make progress in life through her business. All of the members are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Bertille

texts.fr: Née le 05 Novembre 1979 au Benin, A. Bertille est une veuve. Bertille est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, et a un autre enfant à sa charge. Bertille vit ensemble avec ses enfants au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Bertille a fait les cours primaires. Bertille exerce comme activité depuis neuf ans environs la vente de tissus et de tenues. De façon secondaire, Bertille vend des ustensiles de cuisine, et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Bertille s’approvisionne au grand marché international du Bénin Dantokpa, et à Lomé (au Togo), un pays voisin du Bénin. Bertille vend également ses produits à Dantokpa. Bertille a déjà bénéficié d’un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement et vient solliciter un second prêt, pour renforcer son activité. Bertille ambitionne devenir grossiste dans la vente de ses produits.
texts.en:
Born 5 November 1979 in Benin, Bertille A. is a widow. She is the mother of three children, all attending (or having attended) school, and takes care of another child. Bertille lives with her children in the Fidjrossé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Bertille attended primary school. For the past nine years she has been running a business selling clothing fabric and ready-made clothes. As a side business, she also sells kitchen utensils, and phone cards for mobiles, which enables her to meet her children’s needs. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and from Lomé, in neighbouring Togo. She also sells her products in Dantokpa. Bertille has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was duly reimbursed. She is now requesting a second loan to bolster her business. She has the ambition of becoming a wholesaler for the products she sells.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing fabric and ready-made clothes

loans.name: Coralia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Coralia de los Ángeles P. es una mujer trabajadora esforzada y decidida quien se dedica a la costura de cotonas, maxi, vestidos entre otros productos. Ella inicio este negocio hace catorce años con la realización de una docena de ropa en la actulidad tiene un pequeño taller donde tiene tres colaboradores.

Ella invertirá el crédito en telas e hilos para seguir progresando y lograr su sueño que es tener una mejor instalación en su taller y prosperar. Además ella está muy contenta por las oportunidades que Adim le brinda tanto en crédito como las capacitaciones que le han ayudado a administrar y empoderar su negocio.
texts.en:
Coralia de los Ángeles P. is a hardworking and determined woman who sews shirts, blankets, and dresses, among other products. She started this business 14 years ago with a dozen items of clothing. Currently she has a small shop where she works with three collaborators. She will invest the loan in fabric and thread to continue building her business and achieve her dream, which is to have a better system in her shop and prosper. Furthermore, she's very happy about the opportunities that ADIM has given her in the form of loans and training, which have helped her manage and build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and thread

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Rebecca F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'United We Stand'. She is 31 years old, married and has two children,  9 and 12 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 10 years, she has been selling cologne, shampoo, hair grease and mosquito spray in Pipeline Market, Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cologne, shampoo, hair grease and mosquito spray. She describes herself as a determined woman. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cologne, shampoo, hair grease and mosquito spray

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon M. is from the village of Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 34 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Sharon owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Sharon has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Sharon joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Sharon is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cocepcion

texts.en: Concepcion Torres is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 49 years old and is married with three adult children. Concepcion owns and operates a business raising and selling pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 2,900 PHP a month. In 2006, Concepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 12 people who live in Tuol Pongro village in Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Sophea P. as the village bank president. The group members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sophea P. is a congee and Khmer cake seller in the local village, and she earns decent income to support her famiL.. She is also a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Ork Sam, is a farmer who owns a two-point-eight hectare plot of land and cultivates rice to support his famiL.. Her husband’s rice field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Sophea P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers. She is a mother of two children, both of whom attend school and help their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Auxilium

texts.en:
Auxilium Z. is from the village of Luz Banson, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old and single. To make a living, Auxilium buys and sells bananas. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Auxilium joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional bananas to sell and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Auxilium from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is from the village of Pelaez, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Elena is separated from her spouse and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional bananas to sell. 

Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4h loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alice Wanja

texts.en:
Alice, 35, has been rearing chicken in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is married to Dominic Michuki, and they have two children.

Alice was introduced to KADET  LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more chicks to rear and sell.

Alice is planning to buy her own incubator in the near future so she can hatch her own eggs and start selling the chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Upkeep of Vehicle

loans.name: Gloria Beatriz

texts.es:
Gloria Beatriz M. A. tiene 30 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 4 hijos.

Gloria pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura  siembra maíz y papa, además ayuda en las tierras de los padres que se dedican a la misma actividad,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar tierras para seguir sembrando, comprar carro.
Le gusta visitar a ala familia, pasear con los hijos, festejar las fiestas de Guanujo y Carnaval.
texts.en:
Gloria Beatriz M. A. is 30 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has 4 children.

Gloria belongs to the Guantucoto solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in crop farming and livestock farming, especially the sowing of corn and potatoes in the mountain region and rice in the coastal region.  This solidarity group has 25 members.

Gloria farms corn and potatoes.  She also helps on her parents' land as they also farm.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes.  The support of this loan will help her to fulfil her family's financial needs.  They face challenges such as pests and diseases in their crops.  Her dream is to buy land to continue farming and to buy a car.

She likes to visit her family, spend time with her children and celebrate the fiestas of Guanujo and Carnaval.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Memuna S..  She is single and has 1 child, aged 20. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her because of schooling, they help her in business and one of them is her mother.  In 1995, Memuna S. established her business selling plastic footwear, blouses, cosmetics, perfumes, etc. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,400,000SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 4,500,000SLL. Memuna S. has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to add business stock in order to increase her profit margin. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 700,000SLL.  In the future, Memuna

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a cafe business for the past year which she operates from home. Her potential customers are school children, neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a hotel in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a sack of rice and a bundle of maize flour.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of rice and one bundle of maize flour.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 54 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dolores de 47 años y sus 2 menores hijos Bertha de 20 y Cristian de 10 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la provincia de La Mar - Ayacucho, se encuentran las chacras de Julio, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda las ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender los granos de café, el cacao y la hoja de coca a la ciudad de San Francisco, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en: Julio is 54 years old and is a very friendly and hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his wife Dolores, 47, and their two children, Bertha, 20, and Christian, 10, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Julio's farmland is located in the province of La Mar-Ayacucho, Peru. His lands are expansive and the care he provides has made them one of the best crops in the area. It's for this reason that when he goes to sell his coffee, cocoa and cocoa leaves in the city of San Francisco he obtains very good prices due to the quality of the products. What he enjoys most about his work is sowing his lands and making them fertile. He has been doing this activity of 32 years and considers the most difficult task to be keeping his crops safe from plagues. With time, he wants to purchase more lands in other areas so he can increase his products and add more variety of products. This is his 16th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that he has to pay on time if he wants to be granted more loans in the future. He is a very responsible member of his community bank and is always aware of the agreements the group reaches. With the 1,000 soles he is requesting, he plans to purchase more manure and fertilizers to improve his land.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach S. is 45 years old, married and devoted to her six children, all of whom are single. Two of them are employed as workers at the garment industry, and have a regular salary every month. Lach S. is married to 49-year-old Sak Sat, who helps support the family by running a motor taxi. Lach S. stays at home to manage the family housework. In addition, Lach S. has built a space behind her house where she raises a few cows for income. Because the cow-raising business is a very profitable one for Lach S. and her family, Lach S. has requested a loan of US$500 in order to buy additional cows to raise for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional cows to raise for sale.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Esteban; el tiene 68 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne y también se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el socia atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de carne y tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y comprar carne al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Torrechayoc communal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr Esteban. He is 68, married, and has 4 children. He divides his time between his daily chores and his meat sales business, as well as his grocery store. He works in his grocery store from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. Through these businesses, he gets his children ahead. He wants to expand and improve his meat business and his grocery store. He is requesting this loan to buy products for his grocery store and to buy wholesale meat.

He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to purchase products for his grocery store, and to buy meat wholesale.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio María Auxiliadora de la Cía. Cabañas de  Caacupé.
La presidenta, la Sra. María Estela C., vive con su marido y sus dos hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de plantas, que es su especialidad.
Ella, al igual que sus compañeras, está muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias al crédito que se le otorga, puede invertir en su negocio, y de ese modo generar mayores ingresos, ayudar a su marido al sustento de su hogar y a darle mejor futuro a sus dos hijos pequeños.
texts.en: The women of this group are from the María Auxiliadora neighborhood in Caacupé. The president, María Estela C., lives with her husband and two children. She is a very hard-working woman who makes a living selling plants, which is her specialty. María, just like her fellow group members, is very grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya because thanks to the loan she can invest in her business and in this way earn more income, help her husband with the household finances and provide a better future for her two young children.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, planters, fertilizer, fumigation items, plants, etc.

loans.name: Cheick Ahamed Tidiane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheick Ahamed Tidiane T. est âgé de 28 ans,  marié et père de 3 enfants. Il  vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec ses enfants et son épouse au quartier Missira, près de la Medersa de Saada Touré,  dans la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) et dans le souci de s’insérer dans le tissu économique, il  devient apprenti dans un atelier de froid auprès d’un grand frigoriste de Ségou. Après 5 ans d’apprentissage auprès de ce dernier et riche de cette expérience,  il décide d’évoluer seul pour mener le métier de frigoriste. Parallèlement à cette activité, il vend des congélateurs et réfrigérateurs d’occasions et neufs.    
A l’approche  de cette période de chaleur, où il y a de plus de demandes de congélateurs, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 1er prêt  qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 congélateurs. Il s’approvisionne à Gao. 
Monsieur Cheick Ahamed Tidiane T.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à  payer une partie de ses charges de fonctionnement. Son ambition est de développer son secteur d’activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheick Ahamed Tidiana T. is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in a nuclear family with his children and wife in the Missira area, close to the Medersa de Saada Tourè in the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Having abandoned his studies during the 9th year of basic classes (in the Malian education system), and with the goal of being part of the local economic community, he became an apprentice in a refrigeration systems workshop run by one of Ségou's biggest refrigeration engineers. After 5 years of training with this expert and having been enriched by this experience, he decided to start his own business as a refrigeration engineer. Along with this business, he sells freezers and refrigerators, both new and second-hand.
With the approach of the hot season, during which there is greater demand for freezers, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners). He is on his first loan, which he intends to use to buy 2 freezers. He gets his supplies in Gao.
Mr. Cheick Ahamed Tidiane T. sells his goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.
He intends to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will serve to repay his loan and to pay a portion of his daily expenses. His goal is to further develop his business.

loans.use: To buy freezers

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye C. est un homme marié de 26 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant chez son père, à Bougouni dans le quartier Massablacoura.
Ayant vite abandonné l’école, il décida d’apprendre le métier de tailleur auprès de son oncle.
De nos jours, Abdoulaye a 12 années d’expérience dans le domaine qu’il maîtrise bien et dans lequel il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Pour renforcer ses activités, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à sa première expérience.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter des tissus pour les coudre et les vendre à des particuliers et aux commerçants.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 35 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il compte améliorer son atelier afin d’attirer plus de clients et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye C. is 26, married and the father of one child.  He lives with his wife and child at his father’s house in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni.
Having left school early, he decided to learn to be a tailor from his uncle. 
At present, Abdoulaye has 12 years of experience with this kind of work which he has mastered well, and he is much in demand. 
To strengthen his business, he decided to take advantage of the credit program through Soro Yiriwaso for the first time. With this loan he plans to buy fabric to sew and sell to individuals and to merchants. 
He gets his supplies from wholesalers.  He plans to earn a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA.  With these earnings, he plans to make improvements to his workshop in order to attract more clients and to contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en: Feliza A. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old and is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living Feliza owns and operates an agricultural business, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Feliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Feliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and labor for farm maintenance. This loan will be the second taken out by Feliza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and labor for farm maintenance

loans.name: José Amado

texts.es:
El señor José Amado P. tiene ya mas más de 30 años dedicándose a la venta de partes y reparación de vehículos. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para el y sus esposa la señora Juana Sosa, ya que todos sus hijos tiene ya su propia familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar una vehiculo que le esta haciendo falta para realizar trabajos a domicilió. Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. José Amado P. has been selling car parts and repairing cars for more than 30 years. This business helps him maintain himself and his wife, Juana Sosa, since most of their children already have families of their own.

He is requesting this loan to buy a car to carry out door-to door services. He plans on paying back the loan with profits he makes from his business.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for his business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina B. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 36 años. Ella tiene una pulpería desde 1990 la cual comenzó con 400 córdobas vendiendo pan y chiverías es su casa. En sus inicio tenía todo revuelto la venta con su casa en la actualidad ha logrado independizar su pulpería construyendo un lugar propio para ella y su última inversión fue en la compra de una mantenedora.
B. invertirá el crédito en mercadería como granos básicos, gaseosa, chiverías…etc. y meta principal es tener una miscelánea  lo cual poco a poco va lograr.
Ella ha participado en las capacitaciones de Adim en los Programa de Desarrollo Empresarial, Programa de Desarrollo de la Autonomía Personal, Programa de Intercambio Empresarial y Programa de Articulación de Actores Económicos. El que más le ha gustado es el de la autoestima de la mujer lo cual puesto en práctica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Marina B. is a hardworking woman, a strong and enterprising 36 year old. She has had a small grocery store which she started with 400 cordobas selling bread and dairy products from her home. At the beginning everything was combined, her store and her house, but now she has been able to separate them by constructing a separate place for the store. Her last investment was the purchase of a refrigerator. 

Mrs. B. will invest this loan in merchandise such as basic grains, sodas, dairy products, etc. Her main goal is to have a general store, which she will achieve little by little. 

She has participated in Adim trainings on Business Development, Personal Autonomy, Business Exchange and Articulation of Economic Actors. She most enjoyed the one about women's self-esteem, which she has put into practice.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like basic grains, sodas, dairy products, etc, with the goal of slowing achieving a general store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina C. Obando  
Operación 2011-93
500000 colones

Marina C. Obando  tiene 59 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto año de primaria, actualmente vive con su esposo en la zona de Los Chiles, Frontera Norte de Costa Rica donde están formando su taller de Ebanisteria, ya que en la zona de Heredia, lugar donde residía, el espacio es muy reducido para la maquinaria que poseen, además en la zona cuentan con un lugar más amplio y han tenido pedidos importantes por lo que se establecieron allí. Los hijos de doña Marina todos son mayores de edad, por lo que no viven con ellos. 
Con este crédito se pretende comprar materia prima para la elaboración de muebles, además de continuar con la venta de frutas y verduras, la cual es una actividad complementaria. Las labores diarias de la pareja tienen que ver con los oficios de la casa en la mañana, y durante el resto del día se elaboran los pedidos de sus clientes, la maquinaria fue adquirida por un hijo de ellos que vive en Estados Unidos, con este nuevo negocio desean crecer y salir adelante en un nuevo lugar.
Desean mejorar sus ingresos y salir del estancamiento económico que han vivido en los últimos dos años, trasladándose a un área rural, en donde se da un ambiente mas propicio que en el área urbana.
El impacto del crédito es de suma importancia, ya que les da la oportunidad de comprar materia prima para dar a conocer la calidad de su trabajo en esta zona. Doña Marina tiene una trayectoria de más de 15 años como clienta de Fundación Mujer y ha presentado una muy buena conducta de pago y pretende mejorar su negocio aumentando su nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Marina C. Obando is 59 years old.  She studied until sixth grade, and currently lives with her husband in the Los Chiles zone on the northern border of Costa Rica.  There, they are setting up their cabinetmaker’s workshop since in Heredia, the area where they used to live, they didn’t have enough room for their machinery.  In addition, in this area they now have larger space and have had important orders, which is why they established themselves there.  Marina’s children are all grown and no longer live with her.

With this loan, she hopes to buy raw materials to make furniture, as well as continue selling fruits and vegetables, which is a concurrent activity of hers.  The couple’s daily tasks involve caring for the home in the mornings, and fulfilling customer orders the remainder of the day.  The machinery was acquired by one of their sons who lives in the United States.  With this business, they want to grow and get ahead in a new place.  

They want to improve their income and get out of the economic stagnation they’ve lived under the last few years, and move to a more rural area where there is a more propitious environment than in urban areas.  

The impact of the loan is of great importance, as it gives them the opportunity to buy raw materials to showcase the quality of their work in this zone.  Marina has a history of more than 15 years with Fundación Mujer, and has conducted her payments well and expects to grow her business and increase sales.

loans.use: buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un cliente de 38 años de edad, vive en casa de familiares junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija. Ellos viven en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz – Chiclayo. Esta es una comunidad urbana en vías de crecimiento.

Francisco se dedica a los servicios de transporte público, él  posee una mototaxi (moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros) que le permite obtener ingresos diarios.

Adicionalmente Francisco se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cocinas de arcilla. Él vende sus productos de manera ambulatoria y cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en este rubro. La esposa de Francisco lo ayuda a administrar  su negocio y esta unión ha permitido que el negocio de Francisco crezca. 

Francisco solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en el mantenimiento de su moto así como la regularización de los documentos de esta. Otra parte del crédito será destinada al a compra de materiales para preparar sus cocinas de barro.

Francisco es un hombre trabajador con muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 38-year-old client. He lives with his wife and young daughter in the home of relatives. They reside in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz – Chiclayo, an urban community that is in the growth process.

Francisco provides public transportation services. He owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin in the rear for transporting passengers) that helps him generate a daily income.

In addition, Francisco makes and sells clay stoves. He sells these products as a street vendor and has eight years of experience in this trade. His wife helps manage their business and their partnership has enabled Francisco’s transportation business to grow.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. The funds will be invested in the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi and the renewal of his vehicle papers. Part of the loan will also be used to buy materials for making clay stoves.

Francisco is a hardworking gentleman who has tremendous desire to succeed.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi, update his vehicle papers, and purchase materials for making clay stoves.

loans.name: Maria Estella

texts.es: María vive en el Municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 20 años, con los que sueña ver prósperos y progresando como persona, miembro de familia y sean ejemplo para sus hijos.  Ella tiene un negocio llamado “Miscelánea MEB” donde vende chancletas, sandalias, productos de papelería y accesorios en general. Este negocio fue impulsado por su deseo de apoyar la generación de ingreso familiar y con ellos lograr mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. María inició su negocio con un pequeño capital de trabajo que invertía en unas pocas mercancías que vendía a crédito en cortos plazos entre sus familiares, amigos y conocidos. Gradualmente cuando fue creciendo logró ahorros para comprar sus vitrinas y ubicar en un local un punto comercial, que le ha dado buenos resultados, especialmente porque ella le agrega valor a todo lo relacionado con la oferta que hace a los clientes. Para Maria cada época es una oportunidad para exhibir en su negocio  mercancías alusivas a la temporada, así lo hace si es carnaval, navidad, año nuevo, Halloween,  día de las madres, o día del padre,  que es la temporada que se acerca y ya está preparándose con su mercancía para esa época.  Este es justamente la justificación de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  mercancía en la línea masculina como perfumes, ropa, calzado, para responder la demanda que se avecina por motivo de esta celebración de carácter familiar. El sueño de Maria es ampliar su negocio y adquirir el local donde en la actualidad funciona, pues allí tiene su mercado y está posicionada.
texts.en: Maria lives in Soledad City with her husband and three children ages 3 to 20. She hopes her children are prosperous and develop as good people, good family members and good examples for their children. Maria has a business called “Miscellaneous MEB”. She sells flip-flops, sandals, paper products and general accessories. She began this business in order to earn an income for her family and improve their quality of life. Maria began this business with a little working capital, which she used to buy a small amount of merchandise that she sold on short-term credit to her family members, friends and people she knows. Gradually, as she grew her business, she had savings that she used to buy showcases and a shop location in a commercial center. This has worked out well as she is able to offer her customers more products. Each season provides the opportunity to offer merchandise pertaining to that season, such as products for Carnival, Christmas, New Years, Halloween, Mother’s Day or Father’s Day. Father’s Day is approaching and she is preparing merchandise for this season. This justifies her request for a loan from credikiva, which is her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use this loan to buy masculine type merchandise such as colognes, clothes and shoes in order to meet the demand for this family celebration. Maria would like to expand her business.  She would move to a larger place in the same area. This location is where she has her customer base.

loans.use: to buy "male themed" merchandise such as colognes, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 30 years old. She has a one year old child and her husband is a driver. Flora has been selling food stuffs for two years. This business has been so useful to her family because it has enabled her to meet her needs and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy food stuffs such as beans. With the profits she plans to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. Harriet has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. She has no other income and sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Harriet has requested for  a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. The main business challenge for Harriet is transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ulda Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ulda es socia del banco comunal Miraflores del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos.
Lleva más de 12 años trabajando con los préstamo de Manuela Ramos se dedica al servicio de alquiler de habitaciones, tiene cuartos pequeños en alquiler por los cuales cobra mensualmente.
Con este nuevo prétamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: un ciento de madera machimbrada, 2 kilos de clavo, 1 ventana de madera, 4 bisagras, 1 chapa para puerta.
Con éste crédito podrá construir un cuarto más, el mismo que también dará en alquiler.  Su casa queda en el centro de la ciudad.  Este negocio le permite generar los ingresos que necesita para poder mantener a sus hijos y darle lo necesario para que puedan estudiar.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos porque tenía la idea pero no contaba con el dinero.  Está muy agradecida por todo lo que hasta este momento ha construido para mejorar la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ulda is a member of the Miraflores community bank in the Yarinacocha District in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 49 years old, and is a widow with two children.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for more than 12 years.  Her business is a service that rents rooms; she has small rooms for rent for which she charges monthly.

With this new loan of 1000 New Soles, she will buy: a hundred tongue-and-groove wooden planks, 2 kilos of nails, 1 wooden window, 4 hinges, and 1 door.

With this loan she will be able to build another room which she will be able to offer for rent.  Her house is in the center of the city. This business allows her to generate the income needed to provide for her children and give them what they need to be able to study.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has been able to help her children move forward in life, as she had an idea but had no money.  She is very grateful for everything that she has built to this point to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy hinges, wood, nails and other items.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La señora  Inés  se dedica a la venta de pollos, ella tiene veintisiete años de edad, desde hace cinco años se ha dedicado a la venta de pollos ya que le deja  muy buenas ganancias, es una señora muy trabajadora a parte de vender pollos se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.
También le ayuda a su hermana a atender su tienda de abarrotes para ganarse un dinero extra, le gusta mucho superarse,  para ofrecerle una mejor vida a su hija Luisa de ocho años de edad .
Esta muy contenta con el apoyo que le ha dado fundación realidad para salir adelante y  engrandecer su negocio.
Ella estudio hasta la primaria terminada, le gustaría que sus hijos  terminen de estudiar  y puedan tener su propio negocio y ver sus ganancias.
Esta agradecida con Fundación Realidad y a KIVA por todo el apoyo brindado cuando mas lo necesitaba
texts.en:
Mrs. Inés, 27, has been selling chicken for five years and has earned a considerable profit.  She is a hard worker, and also sells shoes by catalogue.  And she helps out at her sister's grocery store to earn a little extra money.  She enjoys making every effort to provide a better lifestyle for her 8-year-old daughter, Luisa.

Inés is content with the support from the foundation which has helped her get ahead and expand her business.  She has an elementary level education, so she wants her children to finish their education and have their own businesses and profits.

She is grateful to the Fundación Realidad and KIVA for all the support she received when it was needed most.

loans.use: To buy and sell chicken.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra (pictured here) is 45 years old and her husband, Han is 50 years old. They have been married for almost thirty years and have four children--two sons and two daughters. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Ra is a farmer, while her husband is a motor remoque taxi driver. Remoque is a motorbike connected to a trailer at the back. Ra’s husband hopes to drive in Phnom Penh, but driving a remoque is not legal in Phnom Penh.

Therefore, Ra is asking for a loan of $1,000 to assist her husband to buy a "Tuk Tuk". The "Tuk Tuk" is not forbidden.

loans.use: To assist her husband to purchase a "Tuk-Tuk" (motorcycle taxi).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase barbed wire for constructing zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Buvumu Development Group

texts.en:
Talk about being highly productive, 41 year-old Robert personifies that. Robert's resolve and prolificacy has been part and parcel of his success the last four years as he plys his charcoal sales trade in Kampala.

The affable father of three is also a teacher by profession.

Like many of his contemporaries, his involvement in an auxiliary business is, by and large, brought to pass by the low remuneration which teachers in Uganda have to contend with.  Many teachers have to supply the deficiencies in their salaries with side businesses. The earnings from his charcoal sales trade are invaluable in elevating his overall income.  Weekly this business's gross sales returns are to the tune of Uganda shillings 100,000.

Robert's group is on their second loan cycle. The repayment record has been good.

Robert says this Kiva loan will render him help in the purchase of more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 40 years old and married with four children between 17 and 9 years old. She lives in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been in the produce business for six years. She has the challenge of price fluctuations, which affect her business profits and her dream is to own a food store. Beatrice needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell .

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 41-years-old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 16-years-old. 

Erna is in the business of raising hogs. She earns about 6000 PHP from this business. Erna also runs a small sari-sari store business. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods to the people in her community. Erna has requested this loan to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. She hopes for her business to progress. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past year, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale and will help Margret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
Amigas es un grupo solidario compuesto por 7 mujeres muy inteligentes, trabajadoras, y que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas escogieron ese nombre para su grupo porque todas son muy amigas y siempre se han llevado muy bien. Sus reuniones estan ubicadas en el municipio General Escobedo, N.L.

Ma Concepción es una mujer muy responsable, tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 28, 26 ,23 años de edad, 2 de ellos estan casados y uno esta soltero y trabaja. Actualmente, habíta en la ciudad General Escobedo, N.L., y se dedíca con mucho empeño a la venta de calzado y ropa desde hace aproximádamente 2 años; debído a las necesidad económica por la que estaba pasando comenzó a invertir en mercancía para así comenzar a ayudar a su marido con los gastos en el hogar. Ella como integrante del grupo conoce a todas sus compañeras y sabe que son personas muy confiables y honestas.

Para Ma Concepción uno de los mayores sueños que desea cumplir es seguir vendiendo calzado y ropa para salir adelante y superarse y así en un futuro con mucho esfuerzo hacerse de un puesto de comidas en el mercado y tener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Amigas is a group that is formed by 7 very intelligent, hardworking women who struggle to move forward and to help their families. They chose this name for the group because they are all close friends and they have always gotten along very well. Their meetings are held in a municipality called General Escobedo, N.L.

Maria Concepcion is a very responsible woman. She is 53 years old, married, and she has 3 children. They are aged 28, 26, and 23 years old, and two of them are married. One of single and he works. She currently lives in the city of General Escobedo, N.L. and she has dedicated herself with a great deal of diligence in selling shoes and clothing for the past two years. Given the financial need that she was facing she started to invest in the purchase of merchandise to help her husband with the household expenses. As a member of the group she knows each of her colleagues and she knows they are very trustworthy and honest people.

For Maria Concepcion on of her greatest dreams that she wants to accomplish is to keep selling shoes and clothing to move forward and to improve herself. In the future and through a great deal of effort she plans on setting up a food stall in the market to have more clients.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothing inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make renovations to the business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George offers houses for rent to earn an income. He used his previous loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his rental houses. This made the houses attractive and he obtained more tenants. 

To earn an additional income, George makes and sells furniture. He has requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kenya shillings to expand his furniture workshop. He desires to expand his business and to involve his children in running his business.

loans.use: to expand his furniture workshop

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, de 48 años, es una hombre bueno, honesto y trabajador, convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 23, 13 y 3 años, viven en una casa propia a lado de ellos. Él trabaja mucho a diario para así poder brindarles lo mejor a su familia ya que su objetivo es sobresalir con ellos y darles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de José, consiste en prestar sus servicios a los mototaxistas como mecánico, además tiene conocimientos y brinda el servicio de soldadura, vulcanizador y tiene una venta de repuestos, todos estos negocios los realiza en su casa en donde acondicionó un lugar para poder poner su negocio. Se inicio con este negocio desde hace recién 2 años aproximadamente, pero siempre trabajo como mecánico desde muy joven y poco a poco fue creciendo e implementando sus demás cosas. Tiene la ayuda de dos personas a quienes él contrata para que le puedan ayudar, le gusta mucho trabajar así porque es lo que sabe y siempre lo hizo.
Al principio se lleno de duda y mucho miedo que se fuero disipando de a poco y ahora es una gran emprendedor en vías de desarrollarse cada día mas y mas, tiene como planes mas adelante agrandar su taller además de implementar su taller con un torno para empezar a hacer rectificaciones y mas a sus clientes. Este será el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendra un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de seguir avanzando con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a seguir siendo el socio puntual y responsable como demostró serlo hasta ahora y seguir trabajando de beuna manera junto a sus demás compañeros de banco que son buenos y muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará repuestos para su venta de piezas de mototaxi, además necesita algunos materiales para el vulcanizador y así brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José, 48, is a good, honest, hardworking man.   He lives with his spouse; they have three children who are 23, 13 and 3 years old and live together in their own house.  He works hard every day to provide the best for his family since his goal is to get ahead with them and provide a better quality of life.

José’s work consists in providing mechanical service for mototaxi drivers, he also knows how to solder, repair tires and he sells spare parts.  All of these businesses are home-based; he equipped part of his house to set up his business.

He started out in business about two years ago but has worked as a mechanic since he was very young and gradually grew and added the other things.  He has hired two employees to help him.  He likes to work like this very much because it’s what he knows and it’s what he’s always done.

At the beginning he had many doubts and fears which gradually dissipated; now he’s a great entrepreneur on the road to developing more each day.  His plans for later on is to enlarge his workshop as well as to install a lathe to start to do realignments and more for his customers.

This will be his second MFP loan.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support because he’ll feel sure to continue advancing with his business this way.  On the other hand, he commits to continue to be punctual and responsible like he’s been to date and to continue to work in harmony with his fellow bank members who are good and very responsible.

He will use the requested 1500 soles to buy mototaxi spare parts and he also needs some supplies for the tire repairs in order to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a moto taxi and supplies for a tire repair shop.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Hilda;  La socia tiene 41 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos,  La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de confecciones,ella confecciona ternos,faldas y blusas para varones y mujeres y niños,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de confecciones .  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar botones,cierres,broches e hilos para la confeccion de ternos,blusas y faldas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda is 41 years old, married, and has four children.  She continues working in her dressmaking business.  She makes suits, skirts and blouses for men, women and children.  Hilda works from 8.00am to 9.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her children.  Hilda would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy buttons, fasteners, clasps and threads for making suits, blouses and skirts.

Hilda is grateful for, and values, this loan.  She pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy buttons, fasteners, clasps and threads for making suits, blouses and skirts

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 19 años, es una joven mujer, amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja y hasta el momento no tiene hijos. Juntos habitan en casa de su madre. Ella junto a su familia trabajan mucho para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Luz consiste en la venta de abarrotes, para ello cuenta con una tienda,ubicada en una calle muy concurrida y así ella recibe a diario la visita de sus clientes quienes van de manera segura sabiendo que ahí encontraran todo lo que buscan. Además de tener este trabajo, ella también labora como enfermera en una posta de salud cerca de su casa, y por las noches vende comida a lado de su pareja y así puede tener tres ingresos para el bienestar y tranquilidad de su familia. Lleva realizando sus actividades desde hace dos años ella sola, ya que antes lo hacia su madre pero ahora el negocio lo lleva ella, aunque tiene la ayuda de su madre. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener estas tres actividades y no descuidar sus estudios. Agradece mucho que le vaya tan bien y espera poder seguir creciendo y agrandar su negocio para tener mayor ingreso. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes, además algunos ingredientes e insumos necesarios para su venta de comida.
texts.en:
Luz, 19, is a young, kind, hard-working woman.  She lives with her common-law husband in her mother's home and they have no children yet.  Luz and her family work hard to have a better quality of life.
