She runs a grocery store that is located on a very busy street where she receives the daily visit of customers who shop at her store knowing they can find everything they need.  Besides this job, she also works as a nurse at a health center near her house.  At night she and her husband sell food, so they have three sources of income for the family's well-being and security.  

She has been handling her own businesses alone since before it was her mother who did it.  Now she works alone although her mother helps, too.  What she enjoys about her work is that she is able to be involved in three activities while also studying.  She is grateful for her success and hopes to grow and expand her business to obtain more income.  

This is her third loan through MFP.  She is content knowing that she can count on financial support since this gives her more security in advancing in her work.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with previous loans.  She enjoys her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supprotive.

She plans to use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy merchandise for the store and the necessary ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.use: To buy products for her store and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 44 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 22, 20, 17, 14, 11 y 9 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, yuca, plátano, etc.
Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos, semillas, con la ayuda del crédito ha podido mejorar el estilo de vida y mejorar los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder tener más terreno para poder sembrar más y poder cultivar aún más.

El desafío que tiene y piensa cumplir es que los hijos culminen los estudios y sean profesionales que puedan trabajar.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 44 years old, married and has six children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 22, 20, 17, 14, 11 and 9 years old in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The “Señor de la Salud” communal bank is located in Recinto Soloma belonging to Echeandía Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, rice, manioc, banana, etc. farming.

Segundo is a corn and rice farmer.  He is requesting the loan to buy farm supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure and seeds.  With support from the loan he has been able to improve his standard of living and his crops.

His sales and purchases take place in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to have more land to plant more and cultivate still more.  The challenge he faces and plans to overcome is that his children finish their schooling and become professionals that are able to work.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel vive en la localidad de la Guardia perteneciente al municipio de el Torno, desde hace mas de 20 años, el cual vive con su esposa Faustina quien es profesora que enseña en una escuela de la zona. El señor Miguel se dedica a la venta de madera  aproximadamente desde  hace 12 años. El señor Miguel  quiere el préstamo para la compra de madera. El esta agradecido con el préstamo que emprender le esta brindando ya que con el dinero comprar madera por cantidad y después poder venderla a distintas carpinterías ya que tiene pedidos que entregar el Sr. Miguel es una persona muy amable que se esfuerza para salir adelante por el bienestar de toda su familia.
texts.en: Señor Miguel has lived in the town of La Guardia, belonging to the El Torno municipality, for over 20 years. He lives with his wife, Faustina, who works as a teacher at one of the local schools. Miguel has sold wood for about 12 years. He would like to have this loan for the purchase of wood. He is grateful to have this loan from Emprender, since he will use it to buy a large quantity of wood and sell it to various carpenters; he has orders to fill. Miguel is a very kind person who works hard to succeed for the well-being of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edith, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene tres hijos de 10, 14 y 16 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de las tortillas desde hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas con este negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  quintales de maíz, leña y gas, estos materiales son los principales para elaborar las tortillas, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, fortalecerlo con materiales para tenerlos a la mano y pueda así mejorar la producción.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios, con su apoyo,  además quiere salir bien con el prestamo para tener la oportunidad de solicitar nuevamente.
texts.en:
Edith sells tortillas.  She has three children who are 10, 14 and 16 years old.  She’s sold tortillas for ten years and works every day from 6am until 4pm; to date she’s had no problems with the business.

She’s asking for a loan to buy quintals of corn, firewood and gas which are the main supplies she needs to make tortillas.  The loan will help her to improve the business strengthening is with supplies on hand thus improving production.  Her hopes are that her children finish their schooling with her support and she also wants to pay back her loan on time so that she is eligible for another one.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and to buy firewood and gas.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is 27 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Keneth has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells stationary. 

To help expand his business, Keneth has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a printer and reams of paper for his business, and will help Keneth to generate greater profits and take good care of himself. Keneth hopes that in the future he will be able to own an internet café. 

Keneth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Keneth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a printer and reams of paper for his business.

loans.name: Soliyamo

texts.ru:
Женщину на фотографии зовут Солиямо. Ей 54 года. Она проживает в городе Куляб. Солиямо замужем и имеет троих дочерей. Все ее дочки вышли замуж и отдельно живут. Солиямо живет вместе с мужем. Ее муж работает мясокомбинате. 
  Солиямо занимается продажей детской одежды и нижнего женского белья. Солиямо любит свою работу, ей приятно одевать детей. Она хочет развивать свой бизнес и создать условия работы. Она располагает свой товар прямо на полу. Солиямо планирует получить кредит и привести детскую зимнюю одежду. Тогда у нее увеличиться доход и она создаст все удобства для работы.
texts.en: The name of the woman on this photograph is Soliyamo. She is 54 years old. She lives in the city of Dushanbe.

loans.use: Для купли детской зимней одежды

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 35 years old and both of her children are in school.

Maricel has a buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

Maricel has been in this business for four years. In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Ms. Abiba K. is around 42 years old. She is a married mother of three children. After giving up her primary school studies at a young age because she did not have enough money, she got into the business of selling yams in Blitta at the age of 14. When she went to Lomé at 16 she helped her mother in this venture. Very soon she had begun her own business using her own money. Her husband is a driver who does not have steady work and must take up his friends\\\' jobs during their time off, so she is responsible for nearly 80% of the household expenses. She is a very careful business manager and has a strong sense of respect for others\\\' property. She has proven herself to be a trustworthy woman by obtaining and completely repaying two loans.

Abiba is now requesting a loan of $950 to continue to build her business. With this loan, she will buy yams and cereals that she will resell for profit. This will increase her income so that she can improve her family\\\'s well-being.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Abiba est une femme âgée de 42 ans environ. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Après ses études primaires qu’elle a abandonnée très tôt par manque de support, elle se lança dans le commerce des ignames déjà à l’âge de 14 ans à Blitta. Arrivée à Lomé, à 16 ans, elle a aidé sa mère dans ce commerce. Très vite, elle initie son propre commerce à partir de ses propres fonds. Son mari est un chauffeur qui n’a pas de travail fixe et obligé de relayer ses amis pendant leur temps de repos. C’est ainsi que près de 80% des charges du foyer restent à sa charge. Très rigoureuse dans la gestion et ayant le sens du respect du bien d’autrui, elle a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux crédits obtenus et parfaitement bien remboursés.

Abiba sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 pour renforcer ses activités. Avec ce crédit, elle achètera des ignames et des céréales qu’elle revendra avec une marge bénéficiaire conséquente. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus pour contribuer à l’amélioration du bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cereals and yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia Wahithe Kamau intends to buy good quality maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
"I established my business over a year ago, but I have not been able to buy much merchandise because I don't have enough money to do so. Hence my store does not have much variety of products to offer, resulting in sales going down. I would like to buy more merchandise, to have a little bit of everything so I can increase the sales. I would like to take a $800 loan to provide a greater variety of products in my store."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo mi negocio desde hace 1 año pero por falta de dinero no he podido comprar más mercancía tengo muy pocas cosas y por lo mismo han bajado mis ventas, quisiera comprar más mercancia, tener un poco de todo y así aumentar mis ventas”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para comprar más mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is 30 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a chauffeur. Candelaria buys clothing in a town called Mesilla, on the border with Guatemala, where she travels one or two times a month and then sells her clothing from house to house to the people in her community and the surrounding areas. With this loan, she hopes to buy larger quantities of clothing and reduce the number of trips she needs to make. She is part of a group with Maria Antonia Vasquez Moreno, who sells tamales and dishes typical of the area, who would like to use her part of the loan to invest in cooking utensils which will improve the preparation of her tamales.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes.

CANDELARIA tiene 30 años , 3 hijos , su esposo trabaja como chofer .Ella compra ropa en la Mesilla ( frontera con Guatemala ) donde viaja una o dos veces al mes y posteriormente vende su ropa de casa en casa entre las personas de su comunidad y de los alrededores, con el préstamo espera comprar mas cantidad de ropa y así disminuir la cantidad de viajes Pertenece al grupo 10 de Abril 3 junto con doña MARIA ANTONIA VASQUEZ MORENO (vende tamales alimentos típicos de la zona) ella con su parte del préstamo espera invertir en implementos de cocina para la mejor preparación de sus tamales

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is a businesswoman who sells wrappers and other clothing for women. She is 42 years old and married with five children. Theresa has been a client of LAPO for the past 4 years. She hopes to expand her business with the loan she is requesting for $550.

loans.use: To buy more female wrappers and shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her inventory

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
We met doña Rebeca, who is 35 years old, at her humble home working hard taking care of her little groceries shop, she opens her shop on Sundays and during the holidays of her hometown of Macari.

From Monday to Saturday she takes care of her 8 cows, which thanks to her efforts and healthy feeding, produce 20 litters of milk per day. She is then able to sell the milk for the production of cheese, butter, yoghurts and other dairy products.

Doña Rebeca’s wish is to buy more products to replenish her little groceries shop and to buy one more veal to sell more milk, this will allow her to give a better quality of life and education to her 3 younger sons.

Thanks to you kind help, Rebeca will be able to succeed in her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Rebeca de 35 años de edad, en su humilde domicilio atendiendo afanosamente su tiendita de abarrotes, ella abre su pequeño establecimiento, sólo los domingos, días de feria de su pueblo natal Macari; de lunes a sábado se dedica al cuidado y protección de sus ocho vaquitas, gracias a la generosidad y a la buena alimentación de estos animalitos le permite acopiar todos los días veinte litros de leche, que los comercializa para la fabricación de queso, mantequilla, yogurt y demás derivados.

El deseo de doña Rebeca es comprar mercadería para llenar el stock de su tiendita y sobre todo anhela adquirir una ternerita más para llenar su establo y así con la comercialización de leche generar mayor ingreso económico para ofrecerles satisfacción y educación a sus tres menores hijos.

Con el apoyo de vuestro generoso corazón, Rebeca podrá tener éxito en su labor.

loans.use: To buy more products for her groceries shop and to buy one veal for the production of dairy products

loans.name: Yao Novinyo

texts.fr:
Yao Novinyo E., age 42, is a disabled man who is married and the father of two children, both of whom are in school. He has difficulty meeting the needs of his family since he lacks the necessary fund to finance his business despite strong customer demand. With this loan, he wishes to acquire 10 cartons of wine, 8 cartons of whiskey, and 3 cartons of gin to meet the demand and to earn more in support of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Yao Novinyo E. est un handicapé âgé de 42 ans marié et père de 02 enfants tous à l’école. Il subvient difficilement aux besoins de sa famille puisqu’il ne dispose pas de fonds nécessaire pour financer son activité malgré la forte demande. Il désire avec ce crédit acquérir 10 cartons de vins, 08 cartons de whisky et 03 cartons de gin pour répondre à la demande et gagner plus pour supporter sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of wine, 8 cartons of whiskey, and 3 cartons of gin

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.en:
Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia are members of the community bank named “Imasumac,” which means "how beautiful" in Quechua. They have been members for 7, 5, and 3 years respectively. In the bank, they have learned to save, how to run their businesses efficiently, and how to be responsible.

Ana Maria is 34 years old. She is a single mother and has one son who is 12 years old. Ana Maria sells grains in the city of Pisco. In Pisco, she buys other products and then sells them in Ayacucho. In addition, Ana Maria sells fresh milk at the market in Ayacucho.

Maria Jesús is 66 years old. She is a widow and has seven children, two of whom are currently living with her. Maria Jesus buys grains at regional markets, grinds them into flour, and then sells the flour in the city of Ayacucho. She used to do this everyday, but due to poor health, now only works occasionally. More often, she now sells candy, cookies, fruits, and juice from her home.

Julia is 66 years old. She is married and has seven children, one of whom lives with her. Julia raises animals, such as cows, pigs, chicken, and guinea pigs, which are eaten in Peru. She then sells them at the local market in Ayacucho. She also sells fresh milk and home-maD. cheeses. In addition, Julia owns a car that her son-in-law drives as a taxi.

Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia need loans of 600, 300, and 1750 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be used to buy fruit, peas, cigarettes, candy, and to pay for car repairs.

Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia dream of owning land, as well as their own stores. They hope that their children will be professionals and have an easier life.

loans.use: Ana Maria, Maria Jesús, and Julia need loans of 600, 300, and 1750 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be used to buy fruit, peas, cigarettes, candy, and to pay for car repairs.

loans.name: Lwaba East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma K.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Fatuma is 27 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 6 and 10, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Kabubu N., Biribawa N., Suzan N., and Beatrice A.. Kabubu N. has a business selling potatoes and wants to construct a stall. Biribawa N. is currently operating a business selling produce and wants a loan to increase stock. Suzan N. operates a business selling tomatoes and wants to add to her business. Beatrice A. is currently in the business of running a bakery and retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients.

loans.use: To add more commodities to retail shop

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Mrs. E. sells bread. She has been in business since 1993 and has been a member of LAPO for the past 6 years.  She is requesting for a loan of $600 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Lawretta

texts.en: Lawretta K. is 52 years old and  married with 8children. She from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells meat  in an open market.  she has been in business for the past 7 years. She is requesting for a loan of $700 to buy more meat for sales. she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sales

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Komi A. is 29 years old, married and the mother of one child. In order to earn money she runs a small general store with her husband in Adeta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Together she and her husband sell a variety of goods. With this loan, their second from FECECAV, they are hoping to stock their shop with flashlights and batteries, cell phone credit recharge cards, matches, and other products. With income from their business they can improve their family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Komi A. est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour gagner de l’argent elle opère un petit marché général avec son mari à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Ensemble, elle et son mari vendent une variété des produits. Avec ce crédit, leur deuxième de FECECAV, ils espèrent approvisionner leur boutique en achetant les torches et les batteries, les cartes de recharges, les allumettes et autres produits. Par les revenus de leur activité, ils peuvent améliorer les conditions de vie de leur famille.

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa lives in her house, which she has owned for 22 years, along with her 25 year old daughter that helps her selling liquors in the family business that they run together. Rosa is a single mother. Her business is placed in a strategic location frequented by wealthy persons and has been selling beverages at the wholesale and retail level for five years. She has quite a bit of demand because there are no other stores in the area that offer the same service, in addition to the attention that both women pay to their clients and the great store hours. This loan will be destined for the purchase of sodas, juices, cans of beer and other liquor which total 4,000 Bolivian Soles. They have a good credit history. It's worth noting that Rosa didn't want to appear in the photo which is why the picture is only of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vive en su domicilio que es propio desde hace 22 años atrás, tiene una hija de 25 años quien también le ayuda en la venta de licores en el negocio familiar que administran. Rosa es una mamá soltera. Su negocio esta ubicada en un lugar estratégico debido a la afluencia de gente por este lugar donde ya ofrece el servicio de venta al por mayor y menor de bebidad desde hace 5 años atrás. tiene bastante demanda porque por el lugar no hay otra tiendas que ofrezcan el mismo servicio, además que la atención que ambas brindan a su clientela es muy buena y los horarios bastante comodos para los demandantes. Este préstamo será destinado a la compra de refrescos, jugos, cerveza en latas y otros licores que en su totalidad asciende a un costo de Bs. 4,000.-. Tienen buenos antecedentes crediticios. Se hace notar QUE ROSA NO QUIZO SALIR EN LA FOTO POR LO QUE SÓLO SE TOMO DEL NEGOCIO.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, juices, sodas for grocery store

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles is married, is 40 years old, and studied until her 5th year of secondary school and did not continue studying because she did not want to, and preferred having a business. She has 2 children and they are elementary school students.

To help herself economically she began selling candy in her home 20 years ago, in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in the Province of Pacasmayo, in the Department of La Libertad. She needed capital to expand her business and decided to join the "San Pedrito" Communal Bank; she currently has a small shop in the main square of San Pedro.

In the communal bank she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00 with which she purchased soft drinks, sweets, chocolates, etc. With the amount of S/. 500.00 that she will repay within 4 months she intends to buy sweets, cookies, caramels, chocolates, sweets, etc. Her dream is to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María de los Angeles está casada, tiene 40 años, estudió hasta 5to año de secundaria no continuó estudiando porque no quiso, le gustó más el negocio tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel primaria. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 20 años vendiendo dulces, en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Pero como la socia necesitaba capital para ampliar su negocio decidió incorporarse al Banco Comunal “SAN PEDRITO” actualmente tiene una pequeña tienda en la plaza de armas de San Pedro. En el banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró gaseosas, golosinas, chocolates, etc. Con el crédito de S/. 500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses tiene pensado comprar golosinas, galletas, caramelos, chocolates, dulces, etc. Su sueño es poder comprar un carro.

loans.use: Purchase sweets at wholesale.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Maria habita en el barrio Hialeah II etapa, procreó dos hijos que ya están mayores de edad, los cuales pudo sacar adelante gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo y el de su esposo. El esposo de Maria trabaja brindando servicios de taxi. Ella es cocinera de un comedor para el cual lleva diez año laborando, inició como ayudante para a prender a elaborar los ricos platillo, ahora gracias a su experiencia y dedicación ha logrado escalar y ahora es la cocinera del lugar. El préstamo solicitado es para infraestructura en la construcción de un porche en su vivienda, para tener más comodidad, y tener también mayor seguridad en su vivienda. Apoya en el cuido de dos nietos de sus hijos y espera poder seguir ayudándolos hasta donde pueda. También quiere apoyar a su esposo en la compra de una unidad de taxi nueva que se encuentre en mejores condiciones que el que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Maria is lives in the Hialeah II neighborhood of her city and has two children who have already reached adulthood and were able to make headway thanks to the hard work of their mother and father. Maria's husband is a taxi driver, while she is a cook at a diner she has worked at for 10 years. She started out as an assistant to learn how to make the rich dishes, and now thanks to her experience and dedication she was promoted to chef. The loan she is requesting is for building a porch addition to her home, to make it more comfortable and add security. She helps caring for her two grandchildren and hopes to continue doing so for as long as she can. She also wants to help her husband purchase a new taxi unit that's in better condition than their current one.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a porch addition to her home

loans.name: Athuman Magesa"s Manyara Group

texts.en:
Athuman M., 40, is married and has four children (ages 16, 12, 8, and 3). He has a charcoal business which he started in 1998. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $172.

Athuman has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he paid back successfully. He is now selling both wholesale and retail. He now hopes for a new loan to increase his stock. Athuman will share this loan with his Manyara subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes or as food venders. Members of Manyara guarantee the repayment of loans for each other.

In the picture, Athuman is in the white shirt on the right.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mrs. Sony Y., 43, and her husband, Mr. Noy Vanny, 43, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and five children: two sons and three daughters. Their eldest daughter is a silk weaver and other four children study at the local school.

Sony has been a silk weaver since 1987, a skill she learned from her neighbor, while her husband has practiced the craft since 1993. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Sony is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase additional silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Julio Alonso

texts.es: El Sr. Julio Alonso solicita su 2do refinanciamiento, para construir un dormitorio en su casa de habitación,  labora como recolector de transporte en la empresa Pedro Joaquín Chamorro, es un cliente que demostró moral, capacidad y voluntad de pago en el credito anterior, es de familia responsable reconocida en el municipio, tiene alto liderazgo, solicita que se brinde ayuda, ya que requiere de mejorar las condiciones de vivienda en la que habita, de esta forma obtener mejores condiciones de vida, solo de esta forma puede salir adelante en la construcción del dormitorio sus hijos van a tener mejor condiciones de vida y social   es un cliente trabajador le gusta superar la forma de vivir, don Julio esta  satisfecho por el servicio recibido de la institución ya que ha tenido grandes beneficio pues el credito anterior lo utilizo para realizar mejoras en su casa, por  esta razón prefiere continuar con el servicio de AFODENIC ya que le ayuda a la familia para salir adelante y desarrolla su situación socio económico.
texts.en:
Julio Alonso is requesting his second loan to build a bedroom in his house. He works as a ticket collector in the Pedro Joaquín Chamorro company. He is a client who demonstrated morals and the capacity and willingness to repay his loans with his first loan. He is from a responsible family that is known in the area. He is a leader; he is asking for help since he needs to improve his living conditions. Through the construction of a bedroom for his children they will have better living and social conditions. He is a hard-working client that would like to improve his way of life. Julio is satisfied by the service he has received from the institution since the last loan that he received was used for improvements to his house; that's why he prefers to continue with AFODENIC, since it helps his family to get ahead and develop his economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Fanny tiene 57 años de edad, estado civil casada su esposo	es comerciante, los planes para sus familia es remodelar su vivienda y que permita obtener mayor comodidad. Doña Fanny tiene su pequeño negocio una tienda donde se vende ropa, zapatos y otros, lo posee desde hace tres años lo inicio con fondo propio, sus metas para el futuro en el  negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta mediante nuevos productos. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar nueva mercadería como: zapatos, ropa para dama, caballero, niños, cosméticos, perfumería. Obteniendo mayor clientela y a la vez mayores ganancia y poder brindar a sus clientes las variedades y estilo de ropa, a si como la captación de nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Fanny is 57 years old and married. She is a salesperson; her plan for her family is to remodel her home so they can be more comfortable. Fanny has a small business - a store that sells clothes, shoes, and other things. She has had it for three years. She started it with her own money. Her goal for the future is to increase her sales by (offering) new products. With the requested loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, she will purchase new merchandise such as shoes, women's clothing, men's clothing, children's clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes. This will give her better clientele as well as better earnings and the ability to offer her customers a variety of clothes and capture new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Andreh

texts.en: Andreh is a 44-year-old married man with two children, living in Touhwitet Al Nahr near Beirut. He owns a taxi and works in Beirut and its suburbs. Andreh has driven a taxi for the last 10 years. Today he wants to borrow $1200 to repair his car.

loans.use: Repair his car

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: LA SRA ROSA TIENE 49 AÑOS,CUENTA CON DOS HIJOS (DE 17 AÑOS Y 22 AÑOS), SOLTERA, LA FAMILIA VIVE EN CASA PROPIA DOTADA DE TODOS LOS SERVICIOS BASICOS. CUENTA CON SU VENTA DE ABARROTES Y UN PUNTO INTERNET EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO CONTANDO CON 5 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. NO TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE ES UNA DE LAS VENTAS MAS SURTIDAS DEL BARRIO. EL CREDITO TIENE COMO DESTINO LA COMPRA DE UN TELEVISOR Y PLAY STATION CON EL CUAL COMPLEMENTARA SU PUNTO INTERNET. ES CLIENTE DESDE EL AÑO 2002, CON 7 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION Y CON PAGOS PUNTUALES, LA MISMA QUE TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES FINANCIERAS.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old, has two children (17 and 22 years old) and is single. The family lives in their own home with all the basic services. In her home she has a grocery store and an internet cafe and has 5 years of experience in this. She does not have much competition since she is one of the most well-stocked stores in the neighborhood. This loan will be used to buy a television and a PlayStation with which she will complement the internet. She has been a client since 2002, with 7 loans with this instution and on-time payments, and has the same history with other loan institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a television and a PlayStation.

loans.name: M/mpya G Group

texts.en:
Zuhura has owned a small beauty salon in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for one year.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more salon items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Zuhura is 21 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jesca and Esther. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy salon items

loans.name: Nasri

texts.ru: Мухаммадиев Насри житель района ГиссарВозраст 42 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование . По профессии шофер. Уже 20 лет работает водителем частного такси. В данный момент планирует произвезти ремонт автомашины. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом . На эти деньги он закупит запчасти. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nasri M. lives in the Gissar district. He is 42 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary vocational education. He has been working as a private taxi driver for 20 years. Currently, Nasri plans to repair his vehicle. He requested this loan in order to purchase auto parts. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia es la sra. AURELIA; ella es natural de Cusco, vive en la asociación pro vivienda en el distrito de Santiago en el departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 3 hijos de (23, 16, 13) años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un restaurante ubicado en la calle pera 489, ella elabora diferentes platos típicos en su local, para lo cual desea el préstamo para poder comprar productos al por mayor y abastecer su negocio, ella manifiesta que se vienen meses altos y también subirán los productos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado para realizar sus compras y así tener mayor ingreso de su venta por lo que se compromete a pagar el total de su préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Sra. AURELIA was born and raised in Cusco. She lives in the neighbourhood of Santiago, in Cusco city. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 13, 16 and 23 years old. As well as taking care of her home, Aurelia runs a restaurant at 489 Perra St., where she serves traditional food. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy the things she needs for her business, including a few high tables and the ingredients for her meals. Aurelia is grateful for this loan, as it will allow her to improve her business and thus, increase her income. She is committed to making her payments responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a restaurant's kitchen

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Mrs. Hon H. was born in 1958 and has been living for years with other family members in Battambang Province. Mrs. H. and her husband own a plantation that was inherited from their grandparents, on which they cultivate all kinds of crops. The couple has four children: one is married and lives separately and the other three are students, and they also help their parents' business when they are not attending school.

The family is lacking capital in order to support their business actions. Therefore, H. humbly requests a loan of $ 800 from Kiva's partner HKL to be used to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to grow

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga M. is 69 years of age. She is married and happily living with her 8 children. Her husband manages their farm. They cultivate their land and plant it with corn, cassava, and bananas. They deliver their products to the downtown area. As of this moment, Dominga and her husband are in need of a loan to buy fertilizer for their corn. She is now applying for a loan from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She will be blessed if her request is granted.

loans.use: To procure fertilizers for farming

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Villa Alto Pura Pura Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Villa Alto Pura Pura” pertenece al centro focal Alto Lima, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos trabajan muy responsables en todas sus actividades de grupo.
Casi todas casadas, con familias numerosas nos cuentan que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares sobrepasan al ingreso que obtienen en sus negocios ya que sus hijos van creciendo y tienen  mayores necesidades.
La mayor parte del grupo se dedica a  comercio, de variados productos, venta que la realizan en puestos fijos y también de  forma ambulante, por ejemplo, venden golosinas y chocolates, productos de limpieza, calzados, medias, celulares y otros. Ahora ellas quieren mejorar sus venta, para esto necesitan de mayor capital para poder comprar mercadería al por mayor. De esta manera  mejorarían sus ingresos, por lo tanto también la  estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Villa Alto Pura Pura Asociacion belongs to group Alto Lima. With the help of their loan assistant they work very responsibly in all their activities as a group. Almost all of the members are married, with various working familiy members that help to ensure that their daily expenses does not surpass the income that receive from their business. Their children are growing and have greater needs but they are still able to provide for them. Most of the group members make a living as merchants selling goods like chocolates, products for cleaning, footwear, socks and pantyhose, cellular phones and other items. Now they want to improve their profits and sales by purchasing wholesale merchandise. This way they will be able to increase their income and contribute to financial stability for their families.

(Translated by Katie of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Ida Marie

texts.fr: A. est une femme mariée qui vit avec son mari et ses 02 enfants dans le quartier d’agoè. En 2000 elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Avec ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu de son commerce elle contribue énormément aux charges de la famille. Son stock a diminué, elle veut se réapprovisionner pour  rehausser son chiffre d’affaire. Elle sollicite  alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 14 bidons d’huile de 25 litres et 4 sacs de sucre.
texts.en:
A. is a married woman who lives with her husband and children in the Agoè district. In 2000 she started off in the grocery business. With what she earns in terms of revenues from her commerce, she help enormously with meeting family expenses. Her inventory of goods is diminished. She wants to stock up again to regain a higher turnover. She is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of rice, fourteen 25-liter drums of oil, and four sacks of sugar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 38 years old. She is blessed with six healthy children namely: Kennedy - 19 years old (college student); followed by Kenneth - 15 years old, (high school student), Kimberly - 11 years old, (elementary student); Twinkle - 8 years old, (elementary student), Nicole - 6 years old (elementary student); and Wendy - merely 3 months old. Her family lives in the rural village of Research Minante 1 Cauayan, Isabela. Wilma manages a food vending business to help her husband support their family living. 
She shares that through their hard work and perseverance, they will be able to improve their living conditions. She hopes that through Kiva loans, she will also develop her vending business like other vendors do. She is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP15,000 as additional business capital. She will probably increase her weekly income of PHP2,500 from her food vending in their village. She also said that through her income in the business, she is able to support the education of her children, even their daily basic necessities.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rinconcito Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
“Rinconcito del cielo” es una Asociación Comunal que pertenece al Centro Focal “Panamericana”, están juntas hace aproximadamente 5 años, una de las fundadoras del grupo es Sofía M., que actualmente es la presidenta, cuenta que se agruparon por la necesidad de acceder a un crédito y de iniciar un negocio propio que les permita generar ingresos para darles alimentación, vestimenta y techo a sus familias. Actualmente todas tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de comida, zapatos, velas, papa, queso, maletines, fruta y confección de faldas y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería (zapatos, velas, papa, queso, maletines, mandarina, naranja y tela).

A ellas les agrada mucho compartir, dicen que se olvidan de sus problemas.
texts.en:
“Rinconcito del cielo” (a little corner of heaven) is a community association that belongs to the Centro Focal Panamericana. They have belonged for approximately 5 years. One of the founders of the group is Sofia M. who is currently the president. She says that they joined together for the need for access to credit and to begin their own business that will allow them to generate income to provide food, clothing and shelter to their families. Currently all of them have their own businesses such as selling food, shoes, candles, potatoes, cheese, bags, fruits and sewing skirts. They need the loan to buy merchandise (shoes, candles, potatoes, cheese, bags, tangerines, oranges and fabric).

They are very pleased to share and say that they are forgetting their problems.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (shoes, candles, potatoes, cheese, bags, oranges, fabric)

loans.name: Elizabeth Magali

texts.es:
La señora ELIZABETH MAGALI BRICEÑO V., tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de educación inicial, pero por criar a su hija dejo de ejercer, tiene 3 hijos de 7 años, 5 años y 2 años,  quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
ELIZABETH  se dedica a la venta de manualidades y confección de ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de una máquina de cocer de segunda mano.
Este crédito de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, lanas, cierres, piedras, etc.
 ELIZABETH sueña con asociarse con dos amigas y tener una microempresa de manualidades y confección de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Elizabeth Magali B. V. is 32 years old and lives in the La Esperanza District of Trujillo Province in the Department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Jerusalén (Jerusalem) Bank. This businesswoman began her upper level studies but left her program in order to care for her daughter. She has three children, aged seven, five and two years old, for whom she has to provide. Elizabeth works at selling handicrafts and making clothing for children, youngsters and adults. Her first loan of 300 New Sols was used to buy a second-hand sewing machine. This loan of 1,000 New Sols will be used to buy fabric, thread, wool, clasps, stones, etc. Elizabeth dreams of going in with two of her friends on a small business selling handicrafts and making clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, wool, lanas, cierres, piedras, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is a retailer of cell-phone loads. She is grateful because she is married to Albert A. who is a very loving husband to her. The couple always helps each other to be able to improve their business and at present it’s doing well.

As days passed by, Evangeline observed that she needs to have an additional amount of cell-phone loads so that she could also generate a bigger income to provide the needs of her family. She would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000 for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that she could obtain the loan to be able to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is from the town of Baliangao. She is 49 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children.

Susana owns and operates a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Susana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC.

Susana is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to build a new house. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Ma. Susan

texts.en: Ma. Susan owns and manages a general store business. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children.  She and her husband are striving hard in their businesses to provide for their daily needs. Ma. Susan rents a stall in her village where she displays different commodities like bread, vegetables, fruits, frozen foods, fish, chicken and other grocery items. She hopes to maintain her business with the help of lenders, so she is now asking to borrow 18,000 pesos. This loan will be a great help in maintaining and improving the business she has started and will be used to purchase more goods. She hopes that her family will always be healthy so they can reach their dreams.

loans.use: For the maintenance and development of her retail business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; ubicados en el distrito de Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  30 años de edad, ella es natural de Catca, pero vive varios años en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, la socia convive con su novio, el vende todo tipo de plásticos, tiene 2 hijos y aún no se casan por que se requiere mucho dinero para efectuar la boda y aún ellos no salen de sus gastos cotidianos; ella tiene un terreno en el cual cultiva papa, y nuestra socia aprovecha este producto para vender moraya (papa deshidratada)  también vende pasto y vende también gallinas. Nuestra socia tiene este negocio formalmente desde el año 2002 y ella requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y gallinas y otros animales menores para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su variedad de comercio.

La socia agradece y valora el crédito así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Communal Bank, which is located in the Andahuaylillas district five minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 30, and she is from Catca. However, she has lived in the Andahuaylillas district for several years. She lives with her fiancé. He sells all types of plastics. She has two children. They have not yet married because it requires a lot of money to have a wedding, and they are still working on paying their daily expenses. She has a piece of land where she grows potatoes. She uses this opportunity to sell “moraya” (dehydrated potato). She also sells grass from the pastures and chickens. She has formally had this business since 2002. She needs a loan to buy seeds, chickens, and other small animals to increase her sales and expand the variety of her business. She is grateful for and values the loan. She promises to make her payments on the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and chickens

loans.name: Goodluck

texts.en:
Goodluck M. is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian businessman. He is a married man with five children of whom three are in primary school and one is in secondary school.

Goodluck runs a garden at Kitunda community in Dar es Salaam. He grows a variety of green vegetables and fruits and sells them at Kariakoo city market to retail customers. He has been in the business for nine years and has managed to buy a water pump machine. The business income helps him to meet his children's school fees and his daily family demands.

Goodluck is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a thirty-five-year-old divorced mother of three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Yaa is a trader. She trades in game meat. She buys the smoked game meat from nearby communities and sells at the local market. Yaa says she also supplies to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy game meat

loans.name: Rosa Luisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Luisa H. S. de 54 años de edad vive en Acomayo – Parcona – Ica junto con sus hijas y sus nietas en su casa propia.
Se dedica hace 30 años a la venta de verduras y otros tubérculos desde las 6:30 am hasta las 12:00 pm en el mercado de Huancavelica – Cercado de Ica. Gracias a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales actualmente y ella cuida a sus nietas en las tardes apoyando de esa manera a sus hijas.
También goza de buenas referencias de parte de los compañeros de trabajo y de sus vecinos.
Desea que la apoyemos para invertir mas en su negocio y asi poder comprar un nuevo toldo que le permita cubrirse un poco del sol ya que estamos en verano y su trabajo es en el día.
texts.en:
Rosa Luisa H. S., 54, lives in Acomayo, Parcona, Ica, with her daughters and granddaughters, in her own house. For 30 years she has sold vegetables and other tubers from 6:30am until 12pm in Huancavelica market, Cercado de Ica. Thanks to her work, effort and dedication she has seen her children become professionals and she still helps her daughters by babysitting her granddaughters in the afternoons. She also enjoys good references from her fellow workers and her neighbors. She wants our help to invest in her business by buying a new tarp cover that wil allow her to shelter from the sun since it is now Summer and she works during the daytime.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her vegetable sales.

loans.name: Shohsarvar

texts.en:
Shohsarvar lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He's married and has two children. Due to the difficulty in finding employment, five years ago Shohsarvar started his own business selling clothes and shoes. He works at markets and is helped by his wife. Together they have been able to move the business forward. It is their only source of income. The quality of their products and the good service they offer has allowed them to quickly increase their clientele. To keep the business growing, Shohsarvar is requesting a loan of $1500 USD, which he will use to purchase merchandise to offer a wider variety to his clients. Shohsarvar and his wife are very grateful for your confidence and support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a married woman with two children.  Since 1999, Nadia has been working as a home-based tailor to help her husband cover their family's living expenses and to pay for her children's school fees.  Now, Nadia is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 60 years old and is married with two children. She and her family live in Musanze, in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

In her village, Christine owns a shop selling a variety of goods such as cosmetics products. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Christine is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her working capital. This will allow her to purchase some additional goods to sell including some foodstuffs like sugar, rice, beans and Irish potatoes as well as more cosmetics products and underwear. Those goods seem to be highly in demand by her customers.

With these additional goods for sale, Christine will earn more profits. With these profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for sale such as foodstuffs, cosmetics goods and underwear

loans.name: N.e.g.

texts.en:
G. is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband and their three kids. Her husband works in a sawmill.

G. conducts her small tailoring business from her home. She wants to improve her business so she can ensure higher education for her children in the future. Additionally, she wants to be self-sustainable, and hopes to create employment for others in the future.

loans.use: To buy cloth and other materials for designing dresses

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin C. is a tailor and sells zippers, thread, fabrics and other sawing supplies at Elmina.  Benjamin has received a senior high school education. He is single and has one child.

Benjamin has been a tailor, and has been selling zippers, rope and fabric, for some time now. He is responsible for paying school fees and bills. His loan will be used to buy more pins, needle, thread and other sewing materials to aid him in his work. He hopes to use any new profits from his business to save to save for his child's education, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more pins, needle, thread and other sewing materials for use in sewing work.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou Kanté est âgé de 39 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son enfant et sa femme dans le quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur Mamadou abandonna  très vite l’école pour s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce d’articles divers. Kanté s’est spécialisé dans l’achat vente des ingrédients entant dans la fabrication des savons traditionnels. Mamadou Kanté est très sollicité et jouit d’une grande notoriété dans la ville de Fana et environs. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après  avoir correctement  remboursé le premier.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des barriques de soude caustiques et des bidons d’huile de palme rouge. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali) pour venir les revendre dans sa boutique sise au grand marché de Fana, en détail au comptant  et souvent à crédit, à une clientèle composée de fabricantes de savons traditionnels appelé  ‘’Gabakourouni’’.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou Kanté, aged 39, lives in a monogamous family with his child and wife in the Banankabougou district, sub-prefecture of Fana (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  He quickly dropped out of school to pursue income-generating work, particularly commerce in a variety of goods.  He became specialized in buying and selling the ingredients for making traditional soaps.  He is in high demand and enjoys great fame in and around Fana City.  Concerned about satisfying further his burgeoning customer base, Mamadou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his second individual loan after having properly repaid the first one.  He intends to use this loan for buying barrels of caustic soda and containers of red palm oil.  He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) in order to come and sell them in his shop located at the big market in Fana.  Cash and often credit are accepted from customers composed of makers of traditional soaps called "Gabakourouni’’. Mamadou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used for family expenses.  The rest will be invested into the business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying palm oil and caustic soda

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells rechargeable phone cards at retail prices to her customers.  She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers.  She also hopes to expand her business.  Kemi has been in this business for 3 years and she is making a lot of progress. She is 28 years old, single with no children. She's an honest and hard working lady.  Kemi is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric M. R. is thirty six years old, married with a two-year-old child. His business is located in a residential area in Mombasa known as Kisimani.  Mombasa is located in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attractions, including the white beaches of the Indian Ocean. 

For the last two years, Eric has been selling cloth and new curtains to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is delayed payments from his debtors. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He believes that he is friendly and has good community relations.

Eric is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy more fabric to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita S.’s “sari-sari” (variety) store is a great source of cash for supporting the needs of her family. It was financed by a loan she requested from ASHI, of which she has been a member since 2008. Though all of her children have their own families now, Nenita still has to work hard and maintain her business because she is the sole provider for her unemployed husband and 77 year-old father. Her business currently provides only a small revenue, but Nenita enjoys spending it on her family’s most immediate needs, and would not want to stop growing her business until it becomes stable and profitable through loans. Though Nenita’s store only sells a few varieties of goods and grocery items at the moment, she envisions someday selling huge volumes of commodities and groceries.

loans.use: o purchase grocery items and comodities for resale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: LA SEÑORA NANCY SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE HAMBURGUESAS TANTO DE CARNE COMO DE HUEVO, Y NO OLVIDEMOS DE LA RICA SALCHIPAPA QUE COCINA A BASE DE CHORIZOS, ELLA ACCEDIO AL CREDITO CON EMPRENDER Y A LA TASA PREFERENCIAL POR SER UNA CLIENTA RECOMENDADA Y CUMPLIDA POR SU HERMANA QUE YA TRABAJA ANTIGUAMENTE CON NOSOTROS, ELLA VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES LO CUAL ELLA ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA, LO QUE ELLA SUEÑA ES ABRIR UNA PENSION EN SU CASA DE SU PAPÁ, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR MESAS Y SILLAS PARA PODER EMPEZAR A VENDER COMIDA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA  EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy sells beef hamburgers and eggs, as well as “salchipapas” made of chorizo sausage. She agreed to take a loan with Emprender because of the preferential interest rate for being a recommended client. Nancy was referred by her sister, who is already a long-time client of Emprender. She lives with her parents and is an enterprising individual. Her dream is to open a boarding house in her father’s home.

This loan will be used to buy tables and chairs so that she can begin her food stand. She is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 67, is an individual loan client with Kiva partner, Esperanza, and her story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). She is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast, where the economy is reliant on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure.
Ana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing by purchasing four large packets of used clothes that come from places like the Salvation Army in the USA. She will use the profits to invest in reconstructing her home and meeting her basic needs. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase four large packets of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Rabiatu

texts.en: Rabiatu I. is married. She sells fresh eggs in small quantities and in crates in Abura by moving from one locality to the next. She has been through senior high school. Rabiatu uses her income to take care of herself. She will use this loan to purchase more eggs and salt to sell (which is going to expand her business). Rabiatu plans to reinvest the profit from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and salt to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina es comerciante, se dedica a la recolección de cartón y también botellas de plástico, por toda la zona sur, para luego vender dichos articulos en las empresas de reciclaje de plástico y cartón..
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Caliri de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para compra de cartón y botellas de plástico y luego vender dichos artículos a las empresas de reciclaje.
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2007, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a trader who collects cardboard and plastic bottles from all over the southern area and sells them to recycling companies that process these materials. Her home is located in the district of Caliri in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to buy cardboard and plastic bottles that she can sell to recycling companies. Saturnina has been a long-time client of IMPRO since June 2007. Her credit history qualifies her as a Level 1 client, which means she has an excellent payment history and is eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cardboard & plastic bottles to sell to recycling companies

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mrs. Phally T. is a 26 year old married woman and she is a villager who lives in tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, pesticide, and to pay for hire farmeing laborers and pay for hire laborers to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Nen Sam is a construction worker who is able to receive a little salary to hold up his family living and aside from construction worker, he is also supports his wife on the farm. This couple has a child, who is just 3-month. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, pesticide, and to pay for hire farmeing laborers and pay for hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita V. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 48 years old. Merlita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Merlita raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Butiti Tweimukye, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
I. Clovis is a 42-year-old married father of 8 boisterous schoolchildren. To shoulder his responsibility for providing for them, he has over the course of the last 10 years been operating a home products retail shop in Butiti Trading centre, Mubende District, alongside a butcher shop. His business has not been without setbacks since its beginning; he has had to bear with myriad challenges, such as the lack of steady income inflow. However, his business has remained active. This  he attributes principally to the good understanding he has struck with his clientele. 

Before his current businesses, Clovis was a hawker in Kampala, moving with his goods from place to place. In a month, Clovis says he makes more than 320,000 Ugandan shillings, a figure he admits will not substantively make his business grow in the near future. He is therefore seeking a loan to lend countenance to his business so that he is able to do restocking for his shop.

loans.use: buying more stock for resale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario Z. is from the town of Dugayung, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Rosario is married. To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosario is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khosiyatkhon

texts.en:
K. Khosiyatkhon is 41 is years old. She is married with three children. She began her business to keep herself busy and active when she found herself sad and depressed due to her separation, as well as in order to have an independent income. That is why her business is the main source of income of her family. 

Khosiyatkhon has been running her own small business for 10 years. She rents a store in the local market for selling the candies and different kinds of sweets. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Khosiyatkhon is very friendly and polite which has provided her with a large clientele. Now she requests a loan for 6500 Somoni. She is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods and increasing the variety of goods. The profits will  provide for her children's needs and their school fees. Khosiyatkhon promises to repay her loan without any violation and thanks everybody who decided to support her. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase goods to increase the stock

loans.name: Losulum Ole

texts.en:
Losulum Ole S. is 51-years-old. He is married to Nalakiti S. and he is the father of five school going children. Losulum is a farmer and, for the last 12 years, he has farmed on his own piece of land.

He learned about Kiva partner KADET Ltd. through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan and he plans to spend 20,000 in order to buy fertilizers and chemicals for help grow wheat on his wheat farm. 

With the anticipated profits from his expanded farming activities, he plans to buy some farm machinery.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals to help grow wheat.

loans.name: Fulanitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Fulanitas,  porque  es el nombre de una marca de artículos que se venden muy bien, es la línea que vende la Tesorera del Grupo y como a ella le ha traído suerte vender esos productos, el grupo decidió llamarse así para que les traiga la misma suerte a todas en sus respectivos negocios. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en  México, está conformado por 9 mujeres exitosas que cuentan con negocios propios y fructíferos.
La señora Inés Z. es la presidenta del grupo, fue elegida para ese puesto por ser una de las personas más responsables y de carácter fuerte del grupo, ella tiene 33 años de edad, estudió bachillerato, es madre de dos adolescentes de 15 y 17 años respectivamente y de un niño de 9 años, a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola pues es madre soltera. Inés  se dedica a la venta de ropa juvenil y accesorios, es una persona emprendedora, ella se ha encargado de negociar  la consignación de los productos que vende directamente con la fábrica, pues ella sueña  que en un futuro podrá comprar una franquicia de la marca y poner su propia tienda, en donde pueda emplear a varias personas y así constituir una buena fuente de trabajo para madres solteras que como a ella les interesa que sus hijos tengan éxito en la vida. Para ella el éxito se vería reflejado en un futuro, mediante la creación de su propia tienda de ropa y accesorios Juveniles.   Su meta en la vida es poder ser creadora de fuentes de empleo para otras mujeres,  que como ella sueñan  con darles a sus familias  una buena educación,  para que no sufran de las carencias que ella ha  pasado.
texts.en: This group call themselves Fulanitas, because this is a brand name of articles that sell very well.  This line is sold by the treasurer of the group, and because she has had luck selling these products, the group decided to use this name so it could bring luck to all the different members.  This group is located in México and is composed of 9 successful women who have their own fruitful businesses.  Señora Inés Z. is the president of the group, elected because she is one of the strongest and most responsible members.  She is 33, has a secondary degree, is the mother of two adolescents of 15 and 17 and of a son 9 years old.  She has gotten ahead alone, because she is a single mother.  Inés sells children's clothing and accessories.  She is very enterprising, having undertaken the consignment of products sold directly from the factory.  She dreams in the future of being able to purchase a franchise of this brand and having her own shop with several employees.  This would be a good source of work for single mothers who, like her, want their children to be successful in life.  For her, success would be the creation of her own shop selling children's clothing and accessories.  Her life goal is to provide employment for other women, who like her dream of giving their families a good education, so that they would not have to suffer the privations she has gone through.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 50 años, es madre soltera y la presidenta del grupo “Señor de los Milagros” desde sus inicios y en total ya son dos años y medio trabajando con Edaprospo. Este grupo está conformado por doce vecinas del vecindario y el nombre evoca la devoción que sienten. 

Ella trabaja en su bodega ubicada en su propia casa de la Zona “Q” en Huaycán, lleva 5 años con esta bodega la cual ayuda a sostener su hogar, además trabaja haciendo tejidos y manualidades, espera arreglar su casa comprando un modulo pre-fabricado, pero para esto necesita tener más mercadería y vender más, y confía en que Edaprospo le ayudara mucho con las habilitaciones.
texts.en:
Elisa is 50 years old and is a single mother. She has been the president of the “Señor de los Milagros” (Lord of the Miracles) Communal Bank since its beginning two and a half years ago.  This group is comprised of 12 neighbors, and the group’s name evokes the devotion that the group feels.
 
Elisa works at her grocery store, located in her own house in the “Q” zone in Huaycán.  She has had this store for five years, and it helps support her household.  She also works making goods that she knits and handicrafts.  She plans to fix up her house by purchasing a pre-fabricated module. In order to do this, she needs to have more merchandise and to sell more.  She trusts that Edaprospo will help her a lot with the renovations.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Las Paceñas Group

texts.es:
“Las Paceñas” es el nombre que adoptaron un grupo de ocho mujeres, que quisieron conformar un banco comunal y formar parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Este grupo está  iniciando su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, ahora les corresponde conocerse no sólo como amigas y vecinas de barrio, sino también como garantes responsables. 

Los negocios que llevan adelante son: macramé de mantas, venta de pollo a la broster, verduras, tejido de chompas, venta de repuestos de minibús, tejido  de chompas, macramé de mantas, venta de golosinas, comida, hilado de lana de vicuña, taller de costura de polleras, macramé de mantas y atención de tienda de barrio.

 La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Silvia  es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad, al momento es madre de un solo bebé, ingresó a la Banca Comunal, debido a la invitación de unas amigas.
