Su negocio es la venta de repuestos de minibús.  Este negocio fue aprendido gradualmente de unos familiares, hace cuatro años. Las ventas son realizadas en su domicilio, todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 y media de la tarde. Debido a la exigencia del horario de atención, recibe la ayuda de su mamá.
texts.en:
“Las Paceñas” [The Women from La Paz] is the name adopted by a group of eight women who wanted to form a communal bank as part of the Cascada regional hub of Pro Mujer. This group is beginning its first loan cycle. They know each other not just as friends and neighbors, but also as responsible guarantors for the loan.

The businesses being run by the group are: macrame blankets (2), sale of broasted chicken, sale of vegetables, sewing of sweaters (2), minibus parts, sale of chickens, food sales, vicuña milk ice cream, skirt-making workshop, and a general store.

Silvia, president of the group, is a young woman of 24 and the mother of one. Her friends invited her into the group. Her business is the sale of parts for mini buses. She learned this business four years ago from some of her relatives. She operates the business from her home every day from 7:00 in the morning until 6:30 in the afternoon. Because of the long hours required, she gets help from her mother.

loans.use: Purchase mini bus parts for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence G. W. is thirty years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She is a mother of one child whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. Her business is located at a busy commercial area in Kajiado town, but she is served by the Kitengela branch.

She owns a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, cooking flour, detergents and other items. She has been in this business for the last nine months and employed three people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more general items to expand her business which will earn her income during the Christmas festivities. She hopes to grow her business and build a residential house for her family. She describes herself as honest and focussed.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour etc.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es: Nemesio, de 54 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rosalía de 45 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El arduo trabajo que Nemesio realiza en sus chacras, le ha traído como resultado una buena producción, ya que sus plantaciones de café, cacao y hojas de coca, han sido cosechadas abundantemente y con muy buena calidad.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su productividad. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Nemesio, 54, is a very kind and hard working man living in his own house with his wife, Rosalía, 45, and their three beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better future.

The hard work Nemesio does in his fields has resulted in a good production since his coffee, cocoa bean and coca leaf crops have produced abundant, good quality harvests.

What he enjoys the most about his work is harvesting because he feels that his efforts are bearing fruit.  He has been a farmer for 35 years and considers the most difficult part of the work keeping his plants safe from insect infestations that can affect crop yields.  In time he hopes to buy more land to increase production.

This is his 14th loan with MFP.  He knows that he has to do his part and work very hard to repay on time and is willing to do so.  He is a very responsible member of the communal bank which makes him highly respected.

He will use the requested 1200 new soles to buy manure and insecticide to improve production.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. Man N. is 44 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sipiyas Ber (pictured together), is 41 years old. They live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have six children: three sons and three daughters. One is a fisherman, one is a garment factory worker, two attend school and other two are still young. 

Man is a carpenter and he also fishes when he is free. He is requesting his first loan of $800 to purchase materials and to pay for house renovation costs.

loans.use: To purchase materials and pay for house renovation costs

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es: Diego Manuel tiene 56 años, su actividad es la venta de lubricantes. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Inicio cuando invirtió en unos cuantos ahorros que tenia ya que de manera ambulante que inicio este medio de vida con el tiempo fue que decidió establecerse en su hogar donde la mayoría de sus clientes saben su ubicación. El financiamiento es para la compra de lubricantes ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos solicitan los productos que Diego ofrece.
texts.en: Diego Manuel is 56 years old and sells lubricants. He has had this business for more than 4 years, and he has 2 young children who he cares for. He began when he invested some of his savings. Since he began this way of life as a street vendor, with time he decided to establish his business at home, where most of his customers know his location. The loan is for the purchase of lubricants, since most of his neighbors request the products that Diego offers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
El Sr. Victorino C. es de Carapeguá, compañía Cerrito, tiene 42 años y vive en concubinato, cuenta con casa propia y tiene una hija de 3 años.
El Sr. Victorino se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa (macatero) hace más de 10 años; aprendió este trabajo desde muy joven viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y así manejarse por cuenta propia.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar y hoy día cuenta con más de 60 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Comercia sus productos por la ciudad de Guarambaré, Mariano Roque Alonso y Luque.
texts.en:
Mr. Victorino C. is from Carapeguá, the Cerrito company, and is 42 years old.  He has his own home, a live-in partner and a three-year-old daughter.

Mr. Victorino is a door-to-door salesman who has been selling clothing for over 10 years.  He learned his trade when he was very young since he needed to start earning his own income and become independent.

He currently has over 60 active customers and earns a considerable weekly income.  He sells his products in the cities of Guarambaré, Mariano Roque Alonso and Luque.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, towels, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Yudaya has a small retail shop that sells new clothes, which she has had for five years.  She also has a second business selling soft drinks  

To help expand her businesses, Yudaya has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and drinks for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yudaya hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

 In the future, Yudaya hopes to own a plot of land. Yudaya is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to improve her business and get new friends

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and drinks for resale

loans.name: Pailon Nathan

texts.en:
Pailon Nathan N. is 28 years old. He is married and has three school-going children. He is a taxi operator and he has been running a transport business for the last four years with a good income. 

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, with which he plans to service his vehicle. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to save and to pay school fees for his children. 

His hope is to become a large-scale businessman and to educate his children.

Pailon is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To service his vehicle

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa R. is from Tinago Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Celsa is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Celsa prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Celsa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Celsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Celsa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Celsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa tiene 33 años, es una mujer experimentada. Vive en casa de su abuela con su esposo Luis, de 43 años y sus dos hijos. Por quienes trabaja arduamente todos los días.

Después de dedicarse a la venta de salchipapas, (pollos y papas fritas) en la puerta de su casa, cambio de negocio, debido que no terminaba de vender todo lo preparado. Ahora vende productos comestibles, en el mismo lugar, pero en la parte interior de su casa y le va muy bien, ya que sólo había empezado con una sola vitrina y de a poco con sus ganancias se compró su repisas y fue  implementado más golosinas y gaseosas. Por sus logros Julissa está muy feliz  y convencida que trabajando arduamente, en adelante ampliará su negocio. Por ello, cuando se le presentó el trabajo eventual la asumió, y la atención de su negocio las delegó a su hijo, por mientras. De esta manera Julissa está convencida de logrará sus objetivos y también podrá brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Pero, por lo tanto quiere abastecer su bodega, con diversidad de productos, para captar la atención de más clientes. 

Es su 2do crédito que tiene con MFP, y se  compromete con los integrantes de su grupo a seguir trabajando como lo hacia, y sobre ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas y reuniones. 

Con el dinero del crédito comprará, piensa comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías perecibles y cervezas, para abastecer negocio.
texts.en:
Julissa is 33 years old and has done many things.  She lives in her grandmother's house with her husband Luis, 43, and their two children, for whom she works hard everyday.

She used to sell chicken and french fries (salchipapas) in front of her house but had to change businesses because she was unable to sell everything she made.  Now she sells groceries in the same location but inside her house and business is going well.  She began with only one display case but little by little with her earnings has been able to buy more shelving to add sweets and sodas.  Julissa is content with her achievements and convinced that with hard work she will be able to expand her business.  When given the opportunity to take a temporary job she accepted and delegated the grocery business to her son meanwhile.  In this way she is convinced she will meet her goals and be able to give her children a good education.  She wants to stock her store with a variety of products to attract more customers.

This is her second loan through MFP and she is committed to the other members of the group to continue working, making payments on time, and attending meetings.

She plans to use the loan to buy larger quantities of perishable goods and beer.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of perishable goods and beer

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Feliciano, es soltero y tiene 30 años de edad, el socio trabaja en el I.N.C. Ministerio de Cultura,  el socio esta en el área de investigación, el paralelamente a su trabaja tiene un negocio de celulares, el socio apertura su negocio para poder tener un ingreso extra, el socio en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para poder apoyar a  su padre y comprar unos medicamentos para su salud, el socio está muy preocupado por la salud de ambos y solo quiere que se mejoren y poder comprarles la medicación correcta, este préstamo él irá pagando con su sueldo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de medicamento para su padre.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SAN RAFAEL” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cuzco. 

Feliciano is single and 30 years old. He works in the I.N.C. Ministry of Culture. He works in the area of research. At the same time, he has his celular phone business. He opened his business to be able to have extra income. At this time, he is asking for the loan to be able to support his father and buy some medications for his health. He is very worried about the health of both of them and only wants them to get better and be able to buy them the correct medication. He will pay off this loan with his salary. He is asking for the loan to buy medication for his father.

Feliciano values and is grateful for the loan and he is committed to paying off his loans in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying medication for his father.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda Álvarez C. tiene 73 años  vive en la Palma de Puerto Jimenez, es muy conocida y querida por todos sus vecinos
Dona Esmeralda se ha dedicado toda su vida a la confección  de ropa, aun a su edad continúan con negocio y hoy está solicitando un préstamo de   ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de respuestas para sus maquinas de cocer y de materiales para la confección como telas e hilos.
Ella se siente feliz que todavía tiene la capacidad de generar dinero para  familia y su casa. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Raíces Capitales una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Esmeralda Álvarez C., 73, lives in Palma de Puerto Jimenez, and is very well-known and loved by all her neighbors.

Doña Esmeralda has worked making clothing all her life, continuing her business even at her age. Today she requests a loan of  500000 colones ($1025) to purchase parts for her sewing machines and materials for sewing such as cloth and thread. She is happy that she still can earn money for her family and her house. She's a member of the Raíces Capitales, S. A. communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase parts for her sewing machines and materials for sewing, such as cloth and thread.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio de 39 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Milagros tiene una pequeña librería en el distrito de Ventanilla en Lima, ella vende cuadernos, lapiceros, plumones, etc., ahora se encuentra vendiendo lo último en útiles escolares, ya que quiere aprovechar la gran demanda que existe en estos meses por parte de los alumnos de escuelas y colegios, cercanos a su negocio. Para ella los más difícil de su trabajo es saber que producto se venderá más, aun así disfruta mucho de ofrecer a sus clientes las cosas que tiene en su librería, tiene ya 6 años en esta actividad y anhela ver crecer su librería y que se vuelva la principal de su barrio, ya que así podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y cambiar su vida para bien. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, ella ha pagado puntualmente su anterior crédito y este último espera pagarlo a tiempo también. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, planea implementar mejor su librería, para así tener más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Milagros is 38-years-old and a very pleasant and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house along with her husband Julio who is 39-years-old and their four beloved children who they want to offer a better quality of life.  Milagros has a small bookshop in the Ventanilla district in Lima.  She sells notebooks, pens, markers, etc.  Now she is selling the latest in school supplies as she wants to take advantage of the big demand right now from students in schools near her business.  For her, the most difficult part of her business is knowing which products will sell best, even with this, she greatly enjoys offering customers the things that she has in her shop.  She has been working at this for six years and hopes to see her bookshop grow and become the main one in the neighborhood as in this way she can improve her income and change her life for the better.  It is her second loan with MFP.  She paid off her previous loan punctually and hopes to pay this latest one on time too.  With the 2000 nuevos soles that she requested she plans to implement improvements in her bookshop to have more products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy school and office supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
Honoria  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene educación hasta 3ro de secundaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su primer préstamo  solicitado fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales como chompas, enaguas, mantas y pantalones.  También nos cuenta que vende  combustible, este negocio aunque no es el principal le da otros ingresos.
En la actualidad solicitará un  nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles dinero que  le servirá para comprar cinco kilos de lanas de diferentes colores para sus tejidos.  En el negocio trabaja sola.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la  facilidad del préstamo y las reuniones porque es una distracción.
texts.en:
Honoria is a member of the communal bank "Las Trenzas de Oro," located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 35 years old, single, and has 2 children.  Her education went through the 3rd year of middle school.  

Honoria has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 3 loan cycles.  Her first loan, for 500 Peruvian soles, was used to buy and sell household animals (pets.)  Now she has a business selling hand-crafted items such as sweaters, petticoats, blankets and pants.  She tells us that she also sells fuel; this is not her main business, but it allows her to have some extra earnings.  

Now she is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles, which she will use to buy 5 kilos of different colors of wool for her knitting projects.  She works alone in this business.

Her dream is to improve her business and see her children become professionals.

What she likes about her communal bank is the easy terms of the loans; she also enjoys the meetings because they are fun.

loans.use: to buy 5 kilos of different colors of wool

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.fr: Accoucheuse de profession, Tchotchovi est mariée à une secrétaire. Elle est âgée de 33ans, Elle a ouvert en 2009 sa clinique pour venir en aide surtout aux femmes enceintes. Elle voudrait ajouter à cette activité la vente des produits génériques c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt.  Elle s’approvisionne dans une société pharmaceutique et revend dans sa clinique.
texts.en: A trained midwife, Tchotchovi is married to a secretary. She is 33 years old. In 2009, she opened her clinic to come to the aid, first and foremost, of pregnant women. She would like to add the sale of generic medicines to this business and that is why she is requesting this loan. She buys her supplies from a pharmaceutical company and sells them at her clinic.

loans.use: to buy generic medicines.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 33 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s single with two children, ages 11 and 15 years; all live at home. For the last three years, she has been selling water and ladies slippers. Her main challenge is that during the rainy season, she has fewer customers and a low number of purchases are made. She learned this business from her friends. 

Musu requested this loan to enable her to purchase more water and slippers. In the future, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more water and slippers.

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa Candelaria es casada, tiene 19 años de edad, curso los 5 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la venta de comida en ferias, inicio este trabajo por iniciativa propia y deseos de superación y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio ambulante.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de insumos y artículos para el negocio que tiene de la venta de comida y bebidas, va a comprar frutas, verduras, condimentos, azúcar, lecha, etc. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio con mayor productividad y ofreciendo un servicio de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Señora Nicolasa Candelaria is married and is 19 years old. She completed five years of primary education and makes a living selling food at fairs. She began this work on her own initiative and her desire to get ahead. She now has three years of experience and she has the support of her husband who earns his living as a street vendor.

She has decided to request a loan that will allow her to purchase supplies and items for her business selling food and drinks. She will buy fruit, vegetables, condiments, sugar, milk, etc. In the future she wants to see her business be more productive and offer a better quality service.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 16 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in Pire, a village located 100 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Their main business activity involves trading with farm products, such as cassava tubers. The group members are experienced in this field and have a strong customer base. The workday starts at 8 a.m. and ends around 8 p.m.

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they will resell at the market. The income earned from the sale of cassava will enable them to strengthen their business and provide for their children (school fees, healthcare and household expenses).

loans.use: to buy cassava, groundnuts and millet.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 34, a resident of Baseco Port Area, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alix, who assists her with her business; and mother to their children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emma operates a business. What she basically does is buy watches and cell phones at wholesale price and resell them per piece with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices. Aside from this business, she earns through her water refilling station. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 3750 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emma dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products she needs in her business.

loans.name: Aymunas

texts.ru: Аймунас проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 61 год. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Ее сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Аймунас зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она покупает телят, откармливает, а потом через несколько месяцев продает. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Aymunas lives in the Yavan region. She is 61 years old. She is a widow with five children. Her son is making a living in Russia. Aymunas earns her income by breeding cattle. She buys calves, fattens them up and sells them after a few months. She has been in this line of work for 18 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase a calf.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Yenny Antonia

texts.es: La Srta. Yenny es una mujer trabajadora, soltera; con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Yenny se dedica a la venta de artículos de bisutería y también presta el servicio de comunicación alquilando teléfonos móviles para realizar diferentes llamadas; el crédito otorgado lo va a utilizar en la compra de mas mercadería de bisutería para así tener más ventas, ya tiene en el negocio más de 6 meses, gana semanalmente S/. 300 nuevos soles. Sus desafíos de Yenny es la competencia con la que tiene que competir todos los días ya que existen bastantes personas brindando los mismos  productos y servicios; sus sueños de Yenny es tener su propia familia y construir su propia casa. Ella está muy agradecida con el crédito otorgado ya que contribuye a salir adelante día a día.
texts.en: Yenny is a hardworking, single woman driven to get ahead.  Yenny sells costume jewelry and also provides communications services leasing mobile phones to place calls.  The granted loan will be used to buy more costume jewelry merchandise to have more sales.  She’s been in business over six months and earns 300 new soles per week.  Yenny’s challenge is the competition she must compete with daily because there are quite a few people offering the same products and services as she.  Yenny’s dream is to have a family of her own and to build her own house.  She is very grateful for the granted loan because it contributes to her getting ahead day to day.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is a farmer from the village of Zeda Leghva, Western Georgia. He is 41 years old, married and lives with his big family: wife – Natela, 19 year old daughter, 18 year old son and parents (retired). Pridon’s daughter is a student. 

Pridon works as worker in the village. At the same time, he is busy with the family agricultural business. He grows tangerines and maize on a family-owned 0.5 hectare piece of land. Pridon sells harvested products at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family, including Pridon’s parents’ pensions, is 700 Laris. 

Pridon has requested credit for two reasons. With one part of the funds, he will purchase a milk cow. Natela will produce cheese and sell it locally. Also, he will get calves after a year and raise them. With the smaller part of the credit, Pridon will pay the high-school study fees for his daughter. Initiating of the dairy farm will give additional income to the family, which will allow them to finance their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to pay study fees for his child.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Elle s'active dans le domaine de la vente de produits cosmétiques et de nettoyages depuis plus de 20 ans. Habitant dans une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal, cette femme sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de renforcer son stock de marchandises et d'acheter des produits (parfums, laits, savons, et des produits de lessives) qu'elle va placé sur le marché vue qu'elle n'a pas de cantine au marché , elle envisage avec les bénéfices qu'elle va avoir d'en louer une pour être plus près des clients
texts.en: She has been active in the domain of selling cosmetic and cleaning products for over twenty years. Living in a city near the capital of Senegal, this woman is requesting a loan to buy some goods in order to bolster her stock of merchandise and to buy products (perfumes, lotions, soaps, and laundry products) that she is going to put up for sale given that she lacks a stall at the market. She envisions using the profits she will make to lease a stall to be closer to customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Aracely De Fátima

texts.es:
Aracely es una mujer emprendedora que desde pequeña fue criada en el campo, se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos como negocio familiar y así ha podido sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante. 

Sueña con tener un criadero de cerdos más grande y mas reconocido en el sector, pues así cada vez serían más los clientes y sus ingresos se incrementarían notablemente. Actualmente espera poder comprar un cerdo para la temporada de fin de año que es cuando las ventas aumenta, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprarlo por lo que solicita un préstamo, puesto que las ventas se incrementan en diciembre y ella debe estar preparada para generar mas utilidades en esa época. Aracely trabaja con gran esmero para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, y asegura seguirlo haciendo para lograr una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Aracely is an enterprising woman.  Since she was little she was brought up in the countryside.  She raises pigs as a family business and that’s how she’s been able to raise her two children.

She dreams with having a larger, better known pig farm because that way each time the number of her customers will be larger and income will increase notably.  She currently hopes to buy a pig to have ready for the end of year season which is when sales increase but she lacks the needed capital to buy it so is asking for a loan because sales rise in December and she wants to be ready to earn more profits during that season.   Aracely works with much dedication to improve her quality of life and that of her family and makes sure to continue to do so to attain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a pig to fatten up for end of year season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat and cheese.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 39 year old businesswoman. She is married to Ngui, and the couple are blessed with three children aged 18, 16 and 14.  She has been running a hotel for the past 11 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

Beatrice is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the money to buy tables and television sets for her hotel. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. She hopes to buy some commercial land in the future.

loans.use: To buy tables and television sets for her hotel

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy, de 36 años, es una hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador, esta casado desde hace varios años, y fruto de su matrimonio tiene tres hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años de edad, el tiene una casa propia en donde vive a  lado de sus hijos y su esposa con quien trabaja mucho en conjunto para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
El trabajo de Roy consiste en la reparación y ensamblado de computadoras, tiene publicidad en todos lados y siempre esta atento a su teléfono móvil en espera de que algún cliente lo solicite. Es proveedor muy importante de una courrier de la ciudad a quienes les da mantenimiento y soluciona problemas de sus computadoras cada 15 días, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace tres años y lo hace solo. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo para poder hacer algunas otras actividades y brindarles los cuidados necesarios a su familia, además de permitirle trabajar en la parte administrativa de una institución publica. Al principio tuvo problemas con su negocio ya que no lo conocían y difícilmente le daban sus computadoras a arreglar, hasta que con el tiempo se ganó el prestigio que tiene ahora con ellos, espera poder tener un local propio para darle mas comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el préstamo anterior en donde demostró ser muy responsable, además le agrada mucho pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos demostraron ser responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará respuestos de computadoras y algunas herramientas, además de programas y antivirus para así poder dar mas seguridad a las computadoras que arregla.
texts.en:
Roy, 36, is a good, kind, very hardworking man.  He’s been married for several years and has three children who are 15, 12 and 3 years old.  He owns a house where he lives with his children and his wife that he works together with to provide a better quality of life for their children.

Roy’s work consists in repairing and assembling computers.  He has publicity everywhere and is always aware of his mobile phone waiting for customers to contact him.  He is an important supplier to one of the city’s messenger services; he services and solves their computer problems every two weeks.  He’s been working in this occupation for three years and he works alone.  What he likes about his work is that it leaves him with free time to do other activities and to give his family the necessary care; it also lets him work in the administrative department of a public institution.

At first he had problems with the business because he wasn’t known and it was difficult for them to give him their computers to repair.  In time, however, he attained the prestige he now has with them.  He hopes to have a locale of his own to provide more comfort for his customers.

This will be MFP loan #2.  He hopes that with this small loan he’ll be able to reach his objectives.  He once again pledges to make his installment payments like he did with the last loan where he showed himself to be very responsible.  It pleases him very much to belong to his communal bank because they are all responsible and supportive.

He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy computer spare parts, some tools and programs and antivirus to provide the computers he repairs with more security.

loans.use: to buy tools, computer spare parts and software.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 25 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijo y una hija, vive con el esposo, hija de 5 años y el hijo de 5 meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Ana  se dedica a la Agricultura siembra de maíz hace 6 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar el estilo de vida  de la familia. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta dialogar con el esposo.
Con el CREDITO ANTERIOR ha podido cubrir las necesidades económicas de la familia, la producción ha mejorado, en el trabajo está motivada y muy trabajadora para conseguir algo en la vida para la familia.
texts.en:
Ana María, age 25, is married and has a son and a daughter.  She lives with her husband, her five year old daughter, and her five month old son in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

The Jerusalen communal bank is located in the El Caimito precint, Puerto Pechichi parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to the agricultural work of growing short cycle corn, rice, and pole beans.

Ana has been growing corn for six years.  She makes her purchases and her sales in Ventanas.

She requested the loan to buy supplies and fertilizers.  With help from the loan she will be able to improve her family’s lifestyle.    She has not had any type of problem.

In her free time she likes to converse with her husband.

With her previous loan she was able to cover the family’s financial necessities.  Production has improved.  She is motivated in this work, and she is working very hard to achieve something in life for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Enrique Tomás

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.ç

En este lugar conocimos a Don Enrique, tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y dos de ellos aun vive con él. Su esposa es una gran ama de casa.

Él para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica al comercio, vende pescado, para lo cual todos los días se desplaza en la madrugada a las playas de la ciudad de Manta y allí compra el mejor pescado a los pescadores que llegan hasta este lugar, y luego  recorre con sus productos por toda la ciudad de Montecristi y sitios cercanos, el realiza sus ventas en  un carro de su papá que le presta para que él se pueda ganar la vida, lleva en este negocio 20 años y es así como siempre le ha llevado el pan a su mesa para que a su familia no le faltara nada.
  
Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita comprar mucho mas pescado para la venta diaria, por que sus ventas an aumentado y por lo tanto sus ganancias, con las cuales ha mejorado su situación económica y el bienestar de su familia. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.
  
Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas en su propio transporte.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized on a national and international level. The famous Panama hats are from this place.

This is where we meet Enrique, age 56.   He is married and has three children; all of them are grown. Two of them still live with him.  His wife is a great housewife.

In order to get his family ahead he sells fish.  In order to do so every day at daybreak he goes to the beaches in the city of Manta.  That is where he buys the best fish from the fishermen who come to this place. He then takes his products all over the city of Montecristi and places that are nearby.  He makes his sales in a car that his father lends him so that he can earn a living.  He has been in this business for 20 years.  This is how he has always put food on the table so that his family does not lack anything.

He is getting another loan because he needs to buy much more fish for the daily sales.  His sales are increasing, and therefore his income is as well.  With the sales he has improved his financial situation and the well-being of his family.  He has been in his communal bank for three years.  He likes it because of the help he gets from the bank.

His dream is to buy a car in order to make his sales using his own transportation.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Omaira Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Omaira se dedica a la producción y venta de arepas desde hace dos años cuando tuvo que recurrir a realizar esta labor puesto que su esposo se quedo sin empleo y ella tuvo que asumir la obligación económica de su hogar, sus dos hijos y un hermano discapacitado que vive en su casa. La jornada de trabajo de la señora Omaira es desde las 3:30 p.m hasta las 12:00 de la media noche todos los días de la semana. Con el fin de continuar llevando los gastos de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, la señora Omaira necesita comprar insumos para fabricar las arepas y dulces y gaseosas que vende adicionalmente. El sueño de la señora Omaira es poder ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda.
texts.en: Sra. Omaira operates a business making and selling "arepas" [a traditional bread made from cornmeal].  She started the business two years ago because her husband was out of work and she had to find a way to support her two children and a disabled brother who lives with them.  Omaira works every day of the week from 3:30 in the afternoon to 12:00 at night.  The income from the business pays everyday expenses and helps improve the family's quality of life.  Omaira is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs to make the arepas she sells.  She will also buy supplies of soft drinks and snacks because she sells those too.  Her dream is to expand her business and open her own store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia, administra una tienda de consumo, actualmente vive sola, solamente atendiendo las actividades domesticas y la tienda pues sus clientes llegan a toda hora a realizarle compras.
Actualmente Herminia está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta básica para surtir la tienda, como el aceite, frijol, arroz, galletas, dulces, boquitas, pollo, huevos, entre otros mas que se puedan mencionar, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y contar con mayor preferencia de los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener una negocio estable, por medio de los prestamos poder crecer y mejorar su disponibilidad económica.
texts.en:
Herminia runs a grocery store. Currently she lives alone, only looking after the household chores and the store. Her customers arrive at all hours to make purchases. 

At this time, Herminia is applying for a loan to buy basic household necessities for stocking her store, such as cooking oil, beans, rice, cookies, candy, snacks, chicken, eggs, and other things that could be mentioned.

This investment will help her improve her business and attract more customers. Her ambition is to have a stable business, and by means of the loans, to grow, and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beans, rice, cookies, candy, snacks, chicken, and eggs.

loans.name: Yesenia Patricia

texts.es: Yesenia Patricia tiene 29 años de edad, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de comida esta actividad la realiza en el campo en su comunidad , este negocio lo aprendió por una hermana y por la necesidad de generar ingreso a la familia y brindarle lo mejor. Yesenia está solicitando crédito para comprar granos básicos y carne para la elaboración de la comida entre otros productos.
texts.en: Yesenia Patricia, 29, sells food, an activity she carries out in the countryside in her community.  She learned this business from her sister and because she wanted to provide income for her family and the best for them.  Yesenia is asking for a loan to buy basic grains and meat among other products to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and meat.

loans.name: Felicita Lorena

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó a vender encebollado en la esquina de su casa y como le fue bien, decidió alquilar un pequeño local.  Trabaja junto con su esposo todos los días y tiene muy buena clientela.  Su esposo además trabaja como albañil realizando obras cuando se lo piden.  Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Le gustaría poder llegar a tener un local en la parte céntrica de la ciudad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de pescado, yuca, sillas y mesas.

loans.use: Compra de víveres y artículos de negocio

loans.name: Suna

texts.en:
Suna is married and a mother of two.  She has been running a laundry and ironing shop for two years.  Most of her customers are university students.  She is using her third loan.  With the help of her loans she bought bulks of detergents and softeners.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Suna Hanım evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  Suna Hanımın 2 yıldır işlettiği bir çamaşır yıkama ve ütü dükkanı var.  Müşterileri genellikle üniversite öğrencileri olan Suna Hanım Maya dan 3. kredisini kullanıyor.  Kredileri ile toptan deterjan ve yumuşatıcı aldı.

loans.use: to buy detergents, softeners and clothes hangers

loans.name: Sindia Adalitza

texts.en:
My name is Sindia Adelitza, I have a business that sales used clothes and new underwear, located on my one room house, which produces income to cover my family expenses and other commitments with my providers. Thanks to this business I’m able to provide education to my children and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Sindia Adalitza, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada y ropa interior nueva, ubicada en mi casa de habitación, el que me permite, generar ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con mis proveedores, gracias a este negocio puedo dar a mis hijos educación y ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: To buy a lot of Mix used clothes and new underwear.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.en:
Maria Graciela is married and has two small children. It is very important to her to offer a better quality of life to her family. Maria is an enterprising and dynamic woman who, when she saw the needs she and her family have, and the difficult job situation in the country, decided to start her own business selling shoes. She is able to do this thanks to being able to travel to the city of Moroleón, in the state of Guanajuato, where she can get the products she needs at a lower price.

Demand for the products she sells has grown because she has worked hard in order to get more clients. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $650.00, which she will use to buy merchandise so that she can offer a greater variety and increase her sales. You can be an important part of this business. Your help will be of great use to this family, have no doubt, they will be very appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Graciela es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, para ella es muy importante ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, Maria es una mujer emprendedora y activa que al ver las necesidades que tienen y la situación difícil del país para encontrar empleo, decidió por iniciar su propio negocio, esto gracias a la facilidad que ella tiene de viajar hacia la ciudad de Moroleón en el estado de Guanajuato, donde puede conseguir este tipo de productos a un menor precio.

La demanda de los productos que ella vende se ha incrementado, porque ella ha trabajado mucho para poder conseguir más clientes, ahora ella tiene la necesidad de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ser parte importante de este negocio, tu apoyo será de gran utilidad para esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rita Nanjala

texts.en:
Rita is a 43 year old mother of 10 who sells tomatoes, onions, and fish at a roadside stand in Myanga, Bungoma Distrcit. Her small business has been operating since 1986, the predominant activity being buying tomatoes in bulk from Chwele and then reselling them to vendors and individual families in Myanga.

On a market day, which occurs twice a week, Rita sells about 4 crates of tomatoes at a profit of 300 Kenya Schillings each (about 4.6 US Dollars). Vendors place their orders beforehand, and then Rita buys from her supplier accordingly. On non-market days Rita sells mostly retail, and can make a profit of about 100 Kenya Schillings from all of her products.

One challenge that her business currently faces is that on market days, she has no tomatoes left over after selling to vendors. Consequently, she cannot meet the demand from individual families who wish to make purchases in smaller quantities. Rita hopes to address this obstacle with a Kiva loan, which she would invest in increasing her stock of tomatoes, as well as onions and fish.

Rita is confident that there would be demand to meet the increased stock from her loan. Her increased capacity would grow her profits, and help her face the challenge of raising 10 children. Her husband is retired from his job as a water engineer, so much of the burden falls on her. Of her 10 children, 5 are currently in primary school, and the other 5 dropped out from secondary school because of a lack of resources to pay for school fees.

While primary education is supposedly free in Kenya, there are still many other expenses that families face, including uniforms, books, tests, school upkeep, etc. Moreover, the steep costs of high school education must be completely paid by families—which makes secondary education a product of tremendous sacrifice, and in some cases an impossibility. Rita hopes that the 5 children currently in primary school will be able to achieve the level of education her other children could not.

loans.use: Invest in the stock of her tomatoes

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.es:
Yonatan is married and lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo León. Due to a lack of employment opportunities in his local area and his need for an income to maintain his family, Yonatan started his own business selling clothes from a catalogue a year and a half ago. His love of sales and his industrious nature have helped his business to grow rapidly and his client base has increased.

He now needs a loan of $475 which he will use to buy merchandise to meet his cleints’ needs and to improve his service. He promises to repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Be a part of the growth of this business. Yonatan and his family thank you very much for the opportunity that you can give them to improve and expand this business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Yonatan es casado y vive en la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León. Ante la falta de empleo en su localidad y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para sostener a su familia, Yonatan inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado por catálogo desde hace un año y medio, su gusto por las ventas y su carácter emprendedor le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio rápidamente e incrementar su clientela.

Ahora necesita de un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Yonatan y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is single with a son. She lives in Izyum and works in the central market. Raisa owns a toy store and a container-store selling children’s footwear. She loves kids and toys. Raisa is the only entrepreneur who has a neat little store selling all different kind of toys and inventory for kids in the local market which attracts many customers to her business. Raisa has been in the business for five years. Her business is characterized by stability and consistency. The client believes her venture has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine loans. Currently, Raisa has about $2000 in inventory. Her monthly income is about $400.     

Raisa would like to get a bigger loan amount for longer term. That is why she is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her turnover capital, purchase more inventory wholesale and offer a wider variety of merchandise for sale in her stores. Her ultimate goal is to meet every need of her little inventive customers of different age groups. Eventually, Raisa is planning to buy a small van which would make it easier for her to transport merchandise from the wholesalers.

loans.use: Increase turnover capital

loans.name: Minata

texts.en: C. Minata is 62 years old and married with 7 children. She and her children live with her husband in Attecoube, a township in North-West Abidjan. Minata's husband has retired from a clerical position in the Attecoube mayor's office.  His retirement pension is not enough to cover their household expenses and Minata is now a key contributor to the family's revenues. She received her first loan from AE&I in December 2004 and has been a good performer since then. Minata is a courageous and dynamic woman who is full of energy and vitality.

loans.use: Coulibaly Minata will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is 22 years old and is the younger daughter of Adela, an exemplary mother. More than 13 years ago, her father deserted the family, causing her much pain and disappointment. Since then, her enterprising and determined mother has been working in different jobs in order to provide for the family. Thanks to Adela’s sacrifice, her two older daughters are working successfully in the professional world. Currently, Estela and her mother work creating beautiful and novel stuffed toys, a job that, thanks to their agility and creativity, is generating tremendous demand on the markets of Arequipa, Cuzco and Puno. This business allows Estela and her mother to satisfactorily cover the costs of their house and Estela’s higher education. In order to better meet these growing demands, they turn to you for your generous support and ask for a loan. This enterprising and hardworking family anxiously awaits your response.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Estela de 22 años de edad, es hija menor de Adela madre ejemplar y muy valiosa. Hace más de trece años sufrió el abandono de su padre, hecho que le causó mucho dolor y decepción, desde entonces su emprendedora y luchadora madre siempre trabajó en diferentes oficios para tratar de sacarla adelante, gracias a su sacrificio sus dos hermanos mayores son profesionales y exitosos.Actualmente Estela y su querida e incomparable madre se dedican a realizar hermosos y novedosos peluches, trabajos que gracias a su agilidad y creatividad están acrecentando y obteniendo gran cantidad de solicitudes en los mercados de los departamentos de Arequipa, Cuzco y Puno, permitiéndole así cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de su hogar y estudios superiores.Para cumplir sus solicitudes recurre a tu generoso apoyo y hace la petición de un préstamo. Esta emprendedora y laboriosa familia espera ansiosa por tu favorable respuesta.

loans.use: Increase of capital to make a greater quantity of stuffed toys.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 37 years old and married with 7 children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs. She needs the loan of $225 to enable her buy more foods to sell. She has been in business since 2003. She is an LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more foods to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel is 20 years old. Out of pure necessity and hunger, he began working when he was 10 years old. This was around the time his parents were having a lot of marital problems and ended up getting a divorce. He was very sad and devastated by this. He used to work at a mechanic shop when he was a little boy. Then, he used to provide transportation services using a tricicle-motor car, which required a lot of physical strength. Now, he has obtain a moto-taxi. He's able to earn more money driving a moto-taxi, and he's able to help his dad support and provide schooling to his 3 younger brothers.

Abel is unable to work in peace because he can't afford to pay for his license renewal and for his membership fee to the transportation company. It's a large sum of money and at this time he has been unable to resolve this problem. He's asking for your help in obtaining this money so that he can be current and work in peace.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Abel es un joven de 20 años de edad, la necesidad y el hambre le obligó a trabajar desde los 10 años de edad cuando sus padres se divorciaron rodeados de muchos problemas, este hecho le causó mucho dolor y decepción.Desde niño trabajó en un taller de mecánica, luego con mucho esfuerzo físico brindó servicios de movilidad en un triciclo y ahora finalmente ha adquirido un mototaxi; con esta herramienta de trabajo está logrando obtener mayores ingresos económicos para apoyar a su padre en la educación y alimentación de sus tres hermanitos menores.El problema de Abel es que no puede trabajar con tranquilidad, porque constantemente recibe notificaciones de la municipalidad de la ciudad de Juliaca solicitándole la renovación de su licencia de conducir y su afiliación a una empresa, este trámite tiene un costo muy alto y no ha podido concluir esta obligación, con el propósito de poner en regla todos y cada uno de las solicitudes de las autoridades de su ciudad recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de acopiar la cantidad necesaria para concluir con su deber.

loans.use: To renew his driver's license and to pay for a membership fee to a transportation company in the city

loans.name: Karomat.

texts.ru:
Karomat P. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. Karomat has a high school education and raises livestock for resale for meat. He purchases livestock at the regional market, feeds it for 30-40 days and then resells it for a profit.

Karomat has been in this business for 10 years. This business is the main source of income for his family. In addition, the expansion of the livestock business provides local markets with fresh meat. Karomat will use the loan to purchase young sheep and goats. He will pay back the loan over a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Пиратов Каромат Усмонович проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 35 лет . Женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит мелко-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 30-40 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 10 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых овец и коз. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase small livestock

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells food stuffs. She is married and has four dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Esi is working very hard to contribute to the family’s expenses.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Virginia Iveth

texts.es:
Virginia Iveth sells shoes, she has been in this business sector for 7 years. Virginia is a single mother, and she has a daughter who goes to school. Virginia has a small retail space, where she leaves a person in charge while she goes to the field to other regions of Guatemala, and reaches various markets where she manages to sell the merchandise. Virginia’s dream is to sale more shoes and therefore be able to generate profits so she can invest in buying mor shoes. Virginia’s goal is to have five retail shoe stores, whether in permanent or walking markets.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia Iveth, se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos, lleva 7 años en el comercio; es madre soltera, tiene una hija la cuál tiene estudiando, tiene un su local pequeñito, en donde deja a una persona encargada y ella también sale a vender a los departamentos de Guatemala, se va a los mercados donde de sol a sol, logra vender su mercadería. Su sueño es alcanzar una mayor productividad de venta de zapatos, para poder generar ganancias en donde ella pueda invertir más en zapatos. Quiere llegar a tener 5 locales o ventas de zapatos, ya sea en mercados cantonales o ambulantes.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Edith Karina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Edith's first loan

Edith is a member of the Village Bank Tu Angel Lucy.

Edith lives with her boyfriend, is 21 years old and has one child. Edith and her spouse have a bar in a house two blocks from the main plaza. At their bar they also organize parties and social events and are open daily, all day. They have been doing this for five years.

Edith needs a loan of 1000 soles ($US375) to invest in the purchase of beer and soda.

Edith's dreams are to make her business better, offer a good education to her children and have a beautiful house.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beer and soda.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. sells fish that she buys from canoes near the sea shore. She is married, and her husband has a single income, but even together it is insufficient for Ama and her two children.

Demand for Ama's goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Capital to expand her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan V., 40, is a widow living in Siem Reap with her four children. Each day she sells souvenir items out of her little stand near the temples of Angkor. She typically makes US$ 6 each day, but she has noticed a higher customer demand and believes she can increase her income.

Chan V. has asked for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a wider variety of souvenir products to expand her business and reach more customers. With any extra profits that she accumulates, she would like to continue expanding her business and provide her customers with an even wider variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase more souvenir products for re-sale

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Hortencia tiene ya mas de 3 años con su negocio de ventas de artículos escolares esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera.

La Sra. Hortencia quiere invertir en su negocio en comprar computadoras para rentarlas a los estudiantes ya que en su colonia no hay quien les pueda ayudar con los trabajos que les encargan en la escuela.

Hortencia a tenido ya crédito en fvp su primer crédito que solicito fue para surtir su negocio de mercancía ahora está solicitándole a Kiva un préstamo para la compra de computadoras y así ella tendrá mas ingreso a su negocio y a su familia.

La Sra. Hortencia solicita un préstamo de $1,200.00 para comprar computadoras e invertir a su negocio ya que por el momento no cuenta con suficiente capita.
texts.en:
Ms. Hortencia has been selling school supplies for over three years. This business is the only source of income for her family since she is a single mother. Ms. Hortencia wants to invest in the purchase of computers so she can rent them to students, because there is no one in their district who can help them with their schoolwork. Ms. Hortencia has already been given a loan from the Foundation for Progressive Living to supply her business with merchandise. She is now asking for a loan from Kiva for the purchase the computers, which will provide her with more income for her business and her family. Ms. Hortencia is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase the computers and invest in her business because at the moment she does not have enough funds to do so.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Computers

loans.name: Muhae

texts.ru: Болтабаева Мухае  жительница района Дж.Руми. Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей мелко-рогатого скота. Мухае покупает на рынке  небольшую отару барашкев  и отправляет их на пастбище. Затем продает их на рынке по более выгодной ей цене. Бизнес является основным источником дохода их семьи. На кредит клиентка хочет закупить мелкий рогатый скот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhae B. lives in the J. Rumi region. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education. She is in the business of buying and selling cattle. Muhae buys a small batch of sheep on the market and sends them off to a pasture. Afterwards she resells them at a more profitable price. This business is the main source of income for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy more cattle. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang C. lives in the Siem Bauy village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is 27 years old and the mother of two very young children. She sells fish and her husband, Mr. Lok Long, is a fisherman. They do not earn much money. Thus, Mrs. Sang C. is requesting a loan to buy a boat to support her husband's fishing business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy a boat to support her husband's fishing business

loans.name: El Condor Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal El Condor está formado por 10 clientes, pertenece a la zona D. San Pedro, una zona populosa D. la ciudad D. La Paz. El Banco surge gracias al emprendimiento D. la familia S., quienes se dedican al comercio.
Eva Q.  es la líder del grupo desD. sus inicios, tiene un pequeño puesto D. venta en el mercado D. la Zona, se dedica a la venta D. comida. Ella vive en la ciudad D. El Alto, Bolivia, pero todos los días empieza su jornada desD. tempranas horas D. la mañana  preparando la comida que va a vender durante el día, luego viaja a la ciudad D. La Paz y se instala muy temprano en su puesto D. trabajo, La meta D. la señora Eva es sacar adelante a sus hijos, mejorar su calidad D. vida y su negocio. 
El Señor Felipe S., es el tesorero del grupo es uno D. los integrantes varones del grupo se dedica a la venta D. repuestos en la misma zona, D. San pedro, vive con su mamá y sus sobrinos a los cuales mantiene con su negocio. 
Lourdes es la Secretaria D. Actas es una señora trabajadora que venD. todo tipo D. productos D. temporada ya sea chompas, juguetes etc. Tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar el esposo le ayuda con mantención del hogar, y con los estudios y cuidados D. los hijos.
Es un grupo bastante solidario que al momento no presentan problemas D. pago ya que se encuentran en su 4to crédito.
texts.en:
El Condor Communal Bank is maD. up of 10 clients and is located in the San Pedro zone, a populous area in the city of La Paz. The bank arose thanks to the entrepreneurship of the S. family, who work in commerce. Eva Q. has been the leader of the group since its beginnings. She has a small stand in the local market where she sells food. She lives in the city of El Alto, Bolivia, but everyday she starts her work from the early hours of the morning preparing food that she is going to sell during the day. Then she travels to the city of La Paz and sets up her work stand very early. Eva's goal is for her children to advance and to improve her quality of life and business. Mr. Felipe S., the treasurer of the group and one of the male group members, work selling auto parts in the same neighborhood of San Pedro. He lives with his mother and his neices and nephews who he supports with his business. Lourdes, the secretary, is a hardworking woman who sells all types of seasonal products such as sweaters, toys, etc. She has 2 children who are school aged. Her husband helps her with the household expenses, with their studies and to care for the children. It is a group with a lot of solidarity that at the moment does not have any repayment problems as they are already on their 4th loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in clothing to replenish a small store

loans.name: Delali

texts.fr: Delali G. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse des mèches et des produits de beauté dans un quartier populaire de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Avec ce crédit elle souhaite redonner plus d’élan à son commerce en alimentant sa boutique de nouveau produits afin d’attirer plus de clients ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroître ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits
texts.en:
Delali G. is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She resells hair extensions and beauty products in a densely populated suburb of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She will use this loan to invigorate her business by stocking her store with new products to attract more customers, which will increase her sales and by the same token increase her profits.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth es una joven muy decidida, a sus 24 años ya es conciente que tiene que trabajar mucho para alcanzar sus metas, ella vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres y siente que es hora de mejorar su vida. A los 19 años ya sabía que sólo trabajando duro iba a salir adelante, es por eso que decidió ayudar a sus padres en el negocio familiar y aprendió a tejer artesanías, ahora ya con 5 años de experiencia, tiene su negocio propio de tejidos artesanales, los cuales vende en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca), es una vendedora muy convincente y alegre, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes. Ella desea tener una tienda exclusiva de tejidos artesanales, ya que le gusta mucho tejer y más si son artesanías, lo único difícil de su trabajo es trasladar los tejidos hasta su puesto de venta y esto le demanda muchos gastos. A pesar de todo ella es muy feliz y quiere mejorar su futuro y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará. Este es el segundo préstamo de Yaneth con MFP y piensa pagarlo a tiempo, igual como hizo con el anterior crédito, ya que no falló en ninguna de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida y recibe el apoyo de todas las socias ya que es muy joven aún. Con este dinero incrementará su capital de trabajo, ya que desea comprar más lana para tejer más artesanías y surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a determined young woman and, at 24, she is already aware that she has to work hard to meet her goals. She lives alone in the house that her parents left her and feels that now is the time to improve her life. Even at 19, she knew that working hard was the only way to get ahead so she decided to help her parents with the family business and learn to weave and make local crafts. Now, with 5 years experience, she has her own crafts business. She sells her products on the esplanade at Laguna Temporal (where the local market at Juliaca is sited). She's a persuasive and friendly saleswoman and, consequently, she has a lot of regular customers. She hopes to have an exclusive shop selling local crafts because she likes weaving and especially the art that goes into her products. The only difficult thing about her business is moving her goods to the place where she sells them, a big expense for her. Despite everything, Yaneth is happy and wants a better future, something she knows she will get with hard work. This is Yaneth's second MFP loan and she believes she will repay it on time, just like she did the last one. She didn't miss a single payment. She's very dear to her community bank and has the support of all its members because, after all, she's still a very young woman. With this money, she will add to her working capital. She wants to buy more wool to make her crafts and better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for crafts business.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ky K., 33, lives with her three children, all students, and her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province.  They operate a CDs and VCDs store from their home, earning around $7 daily, and they also have another business selling resin.  Ky would like to take out a loan to order more CDs and VCDs for resale and to purchase more resin.

loans.use: To purchase CDs, VCDs and resin.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola S. is a 30-year-old beautician with two children. She has a shop open from 7am to 11pm Monday to S., where she also sells hair extensions, hair cream and hair relaxer. Lola has a lot of customers as her shop stands out from others because she has so many hair products and a generator to provide power when there is a power failure (a very common phenomenon in Nigeria). As a result, the shop remains open until late to cater for all the customers who troop through. Lola learned her business in three years and she has been in the business for the past nine years. Lola needs the loan amount of NGN80 000 to purchase more weavons, hair attachments, hair relaxer and hair cream. She thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products to sell

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Agée d’environ vingt sept (27) ans, Mme Mama L. est née à Agoè dans la Préfecture du Golfe où elle pratique le commerce des poissons frits dans l’huile (Canami). C’est une recette qui entre dans l’alimentation de tous les jours et qui peut accompagner facilement n’importe quel plat (konŋ, ablo, colico, riz, pâte, foufou, couscous, petit pois, haricot…). La qualité de son produit et la régularité de son service lui ont value une grande renommée. Compte tenu de sa popularité et la demande souvent assez élevée, certaines bonnes femmes font des commandes trois jours et des fois une semaine d’avance pour être sûre d’être servies au moment opportun car c’est un aliment également utilisé lors des cérémonies de libération des apprentis, des funérailles, des naissances, des réceptions, des mariages, des fêtes de famille et autres. Le financement qu’elle sollicite présentement pourra lui servir à moderniser ce secteur d’activité par l’achat d’un grand four moderne, à s’approvisionner régulièrement en gros en poissons et huile, en sel et charbon de bois et se procurer un conservateur de poissons frits digne de ce nom. Elle pourra ainsi veiller à l’épanouissement de son unique (01) enfant pour le moment et assister son jeune mari toujours sans emploi stable.
texts.en:
Ms. Mama L. is about 27 years old and was born in Agoè, in Golfe prefecture, where she does commerce in fish fried in oil (Canami). This is a recipe for every-day food, which can easily accompany absolutely any dish (kom, ablo, colico, rice, corn mash, foufou, couscous, peas, beans, ...). Her quality of product and regularity of service have won her great fame. Given her popularity and the often high demand, some women put in special orders three days in advance, and sometimes a week in advance, to be sure of timely service. This is because it’s food that is served equally for graduation ceremonies of apprentices, funerals, births, receptions, marriages, family celebrations, and more.

The financing she’s presently requesting will allow her to modernize this business sector through the purchase of a large modern oven. It will also allow her to get bulk supplies of fish and oil on a regular basis, and salt and charcoal, too, as well as to have a worthy and proper way to keep fried fish. She will thus be able to watch over the ultimate development of her only child for the moment and to help her young husband, who is still without stable employment.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fried fish

loans.name: Okaba Agness Alumukeng Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Agness is a married woman, aged 48 years. She has 5 kids, 3 of whom are schooling, and 3 orphans who are also going to school. She has been selling charcoal for over 2 years. She is using the loan to purchase more bags of quality charcoal to sell. Her dream is to bring more than 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of quality charcoal to sell

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla K. est un jeune homme de 28 ans, célibataire sans enfants. il est menuisier à Kpalimé. Depuis 4 ans, Komla exerce cette activité et il est compté parmi les meilleurs de la ville. Il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des planches et des outils de travail pour l’exécution de ses œuvres
texts.en:
