Komla K. is a young man, 28 years old, unmarried, and without children. For four years, he has been in this business, and he is counted among the best in town. He would like to use this loan to buy planks and work tools for performing his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks and work tools to carry out his work

loans.name: Sara Rode

texts.es:
La señorita Sara Rode G. López tiene 27 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria incompleta, no tiene hijos que depende económicamente de ella, pero sus padres son ancianos y ella trabaja para solventar los gastos de sus ancianos padres.
Sara se dedica a la venta de ajíes molidos, el negocio se inició con su madre hace 25 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en el mercado Bellavista.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos (ajos, ají panca, culantro) para preparar.
El crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos (ajos, ají panca, culantro) y verduras para implementar su puesto.
Sara tiene como sueño tener su propio puesto de verduras y ajíes molidos  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Sara Rode G. López is 27 years old and lives in the Esperanza district of the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

She did not complete her secondary studies and has no children who depend on her financially, but her parents are elderly, so she has to work to pay for their expenses.

Sara sells chili powder for a living. Her mother started this business, which is located in the Bellavista market, 25 years ago.

She used the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Bellavista II Microfinance Institute in purchasing supplies (garlic, Peruvian red peppers, coriander).

This 300.00 PEN loan will be used to purchase garlic, Peruvian red peppers, coriander, and vegetables to restock her stand.

Sara’s dream is to set up her own vegetable and chili powder stand so that she can grow as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase garlic, Peruvian red peppers, coriander, and vegetables

loans.name: Teopista Kyazze Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 43-year-old, divorced woman with five children aged between 16 and 29. Three of the children go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she is living with four people.

Teopista doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Teopista operates a restaurant in Kamwokya market, in one of the Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys at her place of work from suppliers who get food from the villages.

Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business, feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last seven years Teopista has been with MCDT for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more food and charcoal and cutlery. Teopista aspires to see her business grow bigger and own permanent business premises. .

loans.use: buy more food to prepare restaurant dishes

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Лола кредитор в организации с 2007года. Она работает учительницей в средней школе , только во вторую смену. А до обеда она работает в самбусочном цеху по производству самбусы. Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для увеличения производства своей продукции. Хочет закупить муки несколько мешков и одну духовку для выпечки самбус
texts.en:
Lola has been our client since 2007. She works as a teacher in a secondary school, but only the second shift. Prior to lunch, she works in a sambusa factory, making sambusas. She wants to use her next loan to increase her product production. Lola wants to buy several bags of flour and one oven for baking sambusas.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and an oven for baking sambusas

loans.name: Getu's Group

texts.en: K. Getu is a welcoming and determined lady and a mother of three children aged 15-7 years. She also cares for one orphan. She is a strong business lady with a wood workshop that she has operated from Bushenyi for eight years now. When she had just started with the business, people thought it was a male job but she has come to disprove all of them. She has wood products like chairs and tables for home & different office requirements – the products feed local populations of motels, schools, and general apartments. The key to her success is treating her customers as kings. She has a dream of owning multiple workshops in town plus seeing all her children attain the highest education levels. She also has a side business selling beans and this time round, she needs to buy more beans for resale using her loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo e hija, por quienes trata de trabajar arduamente para la satisfacción de sus necesidades dentro de su casa. Desde joven le agradaron las manualidades y aprendió fácilmente las diversas técnicas. Es así que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de decoraciones para diversos tipos de eventos sociales. Debido a que la competencia es muy fuerte en su localidad, Norma trata de brindar servicios adicionales para ganar clientela. Por ello, usa su habilidad para elaborar objetos de decoración muy hermosos, los cuales han logrado tener gran aceptación por sus clientes. Por tal motivo, Norma quiere incrementar sus materiales, con el fin de agilizar e incrementar sus trabajos, pues en el futuro le gustaría instalar una tienda que suministre diversos artículos de decoración. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir formando parte de la institución, ya que su responsabilidad y cumplimiento con sus pagos, la garantizan como una persona cumplida. Los 3000 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de materiales para la producción de sus decorados.

loans.use: Compra de materiales

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La señora Maximiliana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en la parcialidad de Lupaza Maya Pamaya.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 meses,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado mayor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde, para luego venderlos en la feria de la zona.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maximiliana belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 47, married, and has five children. She has a third grade education. She lives in the Lupaza Maya Pamaya region. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months. With her initial loan for 500 PEN she bought large livestock. She currently needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy cattle to fatten. She will then sell them at the regional fair. Her wish is to keep working. She likes the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en: Densmaa is a 50 year old woman who lives with her husband and son in the Arkahngai province of Mongolia. Her son attends university and her husband helps her with her business. Densmaa works hard to ensure the happiness of her only child and family. She started her food trading business in 1995 in a small shop. At that time, the working capital was 80 000 tugrug (~56 USD). Today, the working capital has reached 600 000 tugrug (~420 USD) .  As her business has grown, she has earned enough money to buy a new house for her family. She says "Having our own home is very nice and our life becoming happier than ever". She is requesting  a 1 000 000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more products in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Mas

texts.en: Mas T. is 34 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than seven years. She sells fish that she buys them from her wholesale supplier or from the river which is full of fishermen. She married, but divorced her husband since her two children were very young. In the past, Mas T. needs to pay the cost of hiring taxi for transporting her fish to sell at the market. She right now hopes to have a motor for supporting her business, but she doesn’t have money to buy it. Therefore, she would like a loan on Kiva in order to buy a used motorcycle for transporting purposes.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for transporting purposes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  Benkadi sont tous des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 42 ans et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat et  vente de bois de chauffe,  de céréales, d’oranges, de friperie etc.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur  quatrième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts  précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 2 chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 5 sacs de 100 kg de céréales, 2 colis de friperie et 2 chargements de charrettes en oranges. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants auprès des producteurs. Elles vendent dans les différents marchés, dans les autres quartiers de la ville de Sikasso et à domicile au comptant, souvent à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Benkadi are all married, they are on average 42 years old and have on average two children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhood of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of the republic of Mali.

This group of women trades various items such as firewood, cereals, oranges, secondhand clothing etc… They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwasso in order to meet the needs of their customers. This is their fourth group loan. All the previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

With their new loan, they plan on buying 2 small truck loads of firewood, 5 bags of 100 kg of cereals, 2 bales of secondhand clothing and 2 cart loads of oranges.

They buy their goods from the market in Sikasso town and from local farmers in the neighboring villages. They sell in different markets, in other neighborhoods of Sikasso and from their homes. They sell for cash, often on credit, to customers made up of men and women.

They are each planning to make an average monthly profit of 18,500 CFA (about USD 41.50) of which one part will be used for savings and to meet the needs of the families, and the other part will be reinvested in the businesses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe  DANAYA  sont toutes mariées dans des familles  monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et  2 enfants. Elles habitent à MEDINE un des  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur  huitième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but  de  satisfaire le besoin de leur  clientèle et d’augmenter leur profit. Tous  les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus, d’habits,la restauration, la vente tubercules (pomme de terre, igname) etc. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  20 pagnes wax , 20 colis de tissus pour enfants, 15 sacs de pomme de terre et 200 kg d’igname. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, Bamako et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider le mari et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA  ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
The four women of the DANAYA group are all married and in monogamous families. On average they are 38 years of age and have 2 children. They live in MEDINE, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their eighth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying the needs of their clientele and increasing their profit. All the preceding loans were repaid well. They perform various activities, including the sale of fabrics and clothing, restoration and the sale of root vegetables (potato, yam, etc.), among others. With this new loan, they plan to buy, 20 sheets of wax, 20 packages of fabrics for children, 15 bags of potatos and 200 kg of yams. They supply themselves in the big market of the city of Sikasso, Bamako and in the surrounding towns. The merchandise is sold from a location in the big market of Sikasso city, door-to-door and on foot to a cash clientele composed of both women and men. They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA each, of which a part will be used to help their husbands and the rest will be invested in the business and in repaying the loan. The women of the DANAYA group aim to become wholesale traders.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatos, yams, cloth, wax and other items for resale

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr: S. Mouniratou est née le 18 Juillet 1967 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à DJANFAROU Ibrahim, Mouniratou est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mouniratou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Avrotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis sept ans. Seul Ibrahim assure les charges de la famille. Mouniratou n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis cinq ans environs, Mouniratou vend des tissus (bazins, hitarget, etc.) par le système de distribution. Mouniratou s'approvisionne dans une boutique des libanais à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement  et agrandir son activité, Mouniratou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mouniratou S. was born on July 18, 1967, in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She's married to Ibrahim DJANFAROU and the mother of four school-attending children. For seven years, Mouniratou has been living with her children and her husband in the Avrotou neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Ibrahim supports the family on his own. Mouniratou never attended school. For about five years, she's been selling fabrics (bazins, Hitarget, etc). She gets her supplies from a lebanese shop in Cotonou. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who already benefited from three loans, which were repaid without problems. To bolster her working capital and expand her business, Mouniratou is seeking her fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics (bazins)

loans.name: Marithza

texts.es:
la sra. Marithza A. O. tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pan dulce y blanco, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, muy temprano se levanta a comprar el pan en la ciudad de Choluteca y luego lo reparte en diferentes barrios y colonias cercanas donde ella vive, el pan dulce y las galletas son un alimento que se come en el desayuno, muchas personas estan acostumbradas a comer pan dulce con cafe bien caliente por las mañanas, tambien en las tardes se acostumbra a tomar una tasa de cafe con galletas. 
la mayoria de su producto lo vende en las mañanas y por las tardes lo que le queda de las ventas, a veces todo se le vende en las mañanas y por las tardes no tiene que vender, necesita el credito para comprar mas pan y asi tener y poder cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes.
el pan que vende Marithza lo compran mucho ya que tiene buen sabor es grande y lo mejor de todo que lo vende a un precio justo para los pobladores de la zona en donde ella vive. la mayoria de las personas de esa zona son de escasos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Marithza A. O. is 41 years old. She has a small business selling sweet bread and white bread that she runs from her home. She gets up very early to buy bread in the city of Choluteca, then sells it in the various neighborhoods near her home.

Sweet breads and cookies are commonly eaten with hot coffee for breakfast, and many people also have a cup of coffee with cookies in the afternoons. Marithza makes most of her sales in the mornings, and sells what is left in the afternoons. Some days, she has no product left to sell in the afternoons.

This loan will be used to buy more bread and so be able to fulfill the needs of her customers. The bread she sells is popular because it is large and tasty, and she sells it at a price that is affordable by her neighbors. Most people in this zone have scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy white bread and sweet bread to sell

loans.name: Mirzokul

texts.en:
Mirzokul is 37 years old and married with four children. He is a very optimistic man in spite of the circumstances he has endured. Mirzokul raises cattle, work which helps him meet his family’s expenses. He has a great appreciation for animals, and his work helps him considerably in supporting his children and providing daily bread for his home. Mirzokul wishes to increase his number of cattle and therefore increase his earnings. He hopes that you can help him by funding his loan application. You could become an important part of his family's life. Mirzokul deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Amistad Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMISTAD MILAGROSA” y son 11 miembros. Ellos viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la casa de la señora Ruth como se ve en el video. El socio Gorki es el presidente del banco comunal y da unos saludos por navidad y año nuevo a sus compañeros.  

Algunos de nuestros socios tienen pequeños negocios como por ejemplo: Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Margarita vende artesanía, Celia vende cosméticos, Marina vende jugos y Elvis vende artículos de bromas. 

Los demás socios  brindan servicios o son empleados en una institución privada como por ejemplo, Alva trabaja como empelada en el Hotel “Monasterio”, Reyna Milagros es profesora en una academia de música,  Aura es supervisora de ventas y José Gorki es docente del colegio San Francisco de Borja. 
  
Los socios que tienen negocios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como comestibles, cosmético, artesanía y muchas cosas más. Los socios que brindan servicios requieren el préstamo para el gasto familiar o para abrir un pequeño negocio.     

Nuestra Ruth, es casada,  tiene 49 años y tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene un pequeño cafetín en la Plaza principal del distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Ruth requiere el préstamo para comprar productos para tu tienda como pasteles, dulces y gaseosas.     

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Amistad Milagrosa Communal Bank; there are 11 members. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in Ruth’s house, as can be seen in the video. Gorki is the president of the communal bank, and he is giving Christmas and New Year’s greetings to his colleagues. Some of our members have small businesses. For example, Martha has a grocery store, Margarita sells handicrafts, Celia sells cosmetics, Marina sells juice, and Elvis sells humorous items. The rest of the members offer services or are employees in private institutions. For example, Alva is an employee in the Monasterio Hotel, Reyna Milagros is a teacher in a music academy, Aura is a sales supervisor, and José Gorki is a teacher at the San Francisco de Borja School. The members who have businesses need the loan to buy more products like food, cosmetics, handicrafts, and many other things. The members who offer services need the loan for family expenses or to open a small business. Our member, Ruth, is 49, married, and has three children. She has a small café in the main plaza in the Santiago district in the city of Cusco. She has been in the business for various years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Our member, Ruth, needs the loan to buy products like pastries, sweets, and soft drinks for her store. The members are grateful for and value the loan, and they promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur  ALBA ZORAIDA from  Peru

loans.use: Buy more products like food, cosmetics, handicrafts, and many other things- The members who provide services need the loan for family expenses or to open a small business

loans.name: Panfila Regina

texts.es: Panfila Regina  labora como docente de primaria en la Escuela Diriangen  desde hace varios años, su familia se siente orgullosa de tener una maestra dentro del nucleo familiar, su esposo  es comerciante de ganado y ademas se dedican a la siembra de yuca y quequisque,  ella se siente agradecida con el credito anterior otorgado por los  financiadores kiva ya que logro satisfatoriamente cumplir con su pequeño proyecto de mejorar su casa,  esta solicitando su 8vo credito y espera seguir contando con el apoyo del fondo kiva para hecharle el piso a la casa  que actualmente no tiene, su sueño es  tener siempre buena salud, que sus hijos estudien y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con mejores condiciones para que sus hijos gozen de mejores condiciones  y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Panfila Regina has been employed as an elementary school teacher at Diriangen School for several years. Her family is very proud to have a teacher in the family. Her husband is a cattle merchant and they also farm yucca and quequisque (a tuber). She is thankful for the previous Kiva loan because it allowed her to finish a small home-improvement project. This is her 8th loan request and she hopes to continue to have Kiva's support, this time to lay a floor in her house, which currently lacks one. Her dream is to always have good health, that her children study, and that she have a pretty house in the future with better conditions so that ther children will enjoy better conditions, and that she have employment security so that she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install flooring.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth sells foodstuffs (yams) at retail prices. She has been in the business for some years and she is doing well. She manages the business with her children to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She works hard to make sure there is food on her table.

Loveth hopes to expand her business in future. She hopes for the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more yams to sell.

Loveth is 35 years old and is married with six children, her youngest being 5 years old. She hopes to support her husband in sponsoring the children to a higher level of education and that they be called, for example, mama doctor or lawyer in future. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Marie Alphonsine

texts.fr: Marie Alphonsine est une femme de 64 ans, est mariée et a la charge de ses 3 petits fils et de 2 autres enfant qui lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle fait la transformation et vente de céréales, la vente de bouillie de farine de mil et de bois de chauffe. Elle participe aux différentes charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Alphonsine, age 64, is married and has to support her three grandsons, as well as two other children. She's been a member of the Village Bank WANGO for eight and one half years. She transforms cereals, and sells cereals, millet porridge, and firewood. She takes part in supporting her family's various expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark B. K. is a trader who resides in Torpoi town, Bo. He sells used clothes at a well-recognized market area known as Roma Market which is located at old Gerehun Road.

Mark is married with three children and they are all in school.

Mark is seeking a loan buy more stock. He will later use the profit from the business to complete the construction of his house and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy  used clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Née en 1953, C. Alice vit depuis 21 ans au quartier Sètovi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Alice est mariée à MITOUN Victorin, un électricien, et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Alice n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Alice vend des tissus, et aussi du charbon de bois à son domicile. Alice achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, mais également à Houègbo et à Sékou. Alice exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a obtenu une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé. Alice a bien remboursé le crédit. Alice sollicite un deuxième crédit, afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux demandes de ses clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1953, Alice C. has been living for the last 21 years in Sètov in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. She is married in Victorin Mitoun, an electrician, and mother of two children that are both educated. The couple work together to address the needs of the family. Alice did not attend school. To address her needs, Alice sells cloth and wood coal from her home. She purchases her materials in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, as well as in Houègbo and Sékou. Alice has been doing this work for the last eight years and received one loan previously from ALIDé, which she reimbursed. Alice is asking for a second loan, in order to increase her activity and better respond to the demands from her clients.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cloths

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia 59 años está casada y tienen 4 hijos (25,21,19 y 17) años , son una familia de escasos recursos económicos ya que ninguno de sus hijos lograron estudiar una carrera profesional , el hijo mayor está casado y tiene 2 hijos , pues no tienen una casa propia y la señora Virginia le ayudo heredándole un pequeño lote de terreno para que puedan construir su casa, todos sus hijos no tienen una vida estable por ejemplo la que tiene 17 años está embarazada sin estar casada.

La señora Virginia vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de A. rancho, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para ayudar a su hijo en la construcción de su casa en el terreno que le regalo.
Entre sus sueños y metas es que por los menos sus nietos estudien una cerrera profesional y ayudar a todos sus hijos en lo que ella pueda ya que es una señora de edad
texts.en:
Virginia, age 59, is married and has four children (25, 21, 19, & 17). They are a family of scant economic resources, and none of their children were able to study for a professional career. The oldest child is married and has two children. They do not have their own house. Virginia helped them by passing down to him a piece of land so that they can build their house. None of her children have a stable life. For example, the 17 year old is pregnant, and she is not married. Virginia lives in the city of Cochabamba in the A. Rancho area. Her main activity is the production of raw milk. She delivers her product to a company that makes dairy products. The loan is to help her son build his house on the land gave him.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Huoy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people who live in Prey Sangkum village in Prey Veng province. Mrs. Huoy H. is the group leader, selected by all the members. They will all use the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 

She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice: not to sell but to support her family. She also breeds pigs and her husband, Mr. Thoeurm Hang, is a construction worker. They try to work hard with their careers but they earn a low income. To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Huoy H. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

Mrs. Huoy Huoen is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school. The other child is 3 years old and is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Lauren María

texts.es: Lauren María B. C., tiene la edad de 21 años, está en unión libre, y tienen dos hijos que es su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 2 y 4 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado (terneros), la idea es tener ganado para el desarrollo y engorde, además para aumentar el número de animales. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan.Cuenta con un potrero de buena calidad,además, que es una zona apta para esta actividad. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Lauren tiene varios años de trabajar con ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Lauren María B. C. is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 2 and 4) who are her highest priority. This loan will be used to buy calves for fattening and development so that she can increase her herd. She wants to provide her cattle adequate maintenance so that she can obtain the best possible price when the time comes to sell them. Lauren has a pasture that is of good quality, which is a suitable area for this activity.

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that have been provided. Doña Lauren has been raising cattle for several years. She wants to provide her family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, she hopes to continue growing as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for fattening

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora es alguien responsable y disfruta de su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, el negocio que está ubicado en su propia vivienda es visitado por muchos clientes que asisten a su local, en busca de los deliciosos platillos preparados por Maria, pues siempre está buscando nuevos platillos que ofrecer. Con el paso del tiempo Maria ha tenido experiencia y su negocio ha mejorado pero necesita más capital. Este el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, frutas verduras entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Maria is a very responsible woman who enjoys her work; selling food. Her business, which is located within her own home, is visited by many customers who enjoy her many delicious dishes. She is always looking for new dishes to offer. Over time she has gained more experience and improved her business, but she needs more working capital. She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and fruits and vegetables, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr:
Femme de 53 ans marie a un Pasteur ayant 6 enfants; elle a commence le tricotage depuis son jeune age chez les religieuses, tres entreprenante elle avait acquerit trois machines a tricoter il ya de cela plusieurs annees
Avec ce pret elle compte acheter des lots pelotes de fils en gros de differentes couleurs pour tricoter des pulls pour enfant,adultes, des grenouilleres et de la layette. Pour la croissance de son manufacture elle pense faire au moins dix complets de layette par jour soit 60 complets par semaine pour deposer dans les 5 grandes maternites de la capitale, vendus a bon prix pour aider les femmes qui accouchent a avoir de quoi vetir leurs enfants.En plus de cela elle travaille a la reinsertion des jeunes filles meres pour leur apprendre a tricoter et l'aider dans son travail
Elle a des grandes ambitions,ouvrir une ecole de tricotage et grand magasin d'exposition et vente, ne travaillant pas seule,ses enfants aussi l'aident a faire le travail garcons comme les filles sont en oeuvre pour l'elargissement de leur unite de production
texts.en:
This is a 53-year-old woman with six children. She is married to a pasteur. She started knitting with nuns at a young age.  A very enterprising woman, she had acquired three knitting machines several years ago.  With this loan, she plans on buying in bulk some balls of yarn of different colors for knitting sweaters for children and adults, jumpsuits, and items for babies.  For the growth of her production, she is thinking of making at least ten baby outfits each day, thus sixty outfits a week. These products will be placed among the five major maternity facilities in the capital and sold at a good price to help new mothers to clothe their children.  In addition to this, she works at re-adapting very young mothers by teaching them to knit and to help her in her work.  She has great ambitions to open a knitting school and a large store for shows and sales.  Her children also help her with the work.  The boys as well as the girls are at work expanding their production unit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spools of knitting yarn, buttons

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
Yony, tiene 29 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino.  
Su actividad económica principal de Yony es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papas, cebollas, etc. Ella empezó su negocio hace 10 años atrás. Yony participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yony is 29 years old, a single mother with two children, and belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Members meet every thirty days, at Mr. Paulino’s house in the Rumichaca community. Her primary economic activity is the sale of vegetables, for example, carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. She started her business 10 years ago. Yony participates in the cooperative bank, and things go well for her because she is a responsible and punctual person with regard to making her payments. She needs this loan in order to buy more vegetables. This member is very grateful for the opportunities granted her through this medium, and likewise commits to making her loan payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Tun

texts.en: Tun S., 38, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a chef for wedding parties, earning an income of USD 1.6 per day. Her husband buys fruit from local farmers to resell for an income of USD 7.1 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more fruit to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Samarik Ole

texts.en:
Samarik Ole S. is a 24-year-old farmer who supports four members of his family. His spouse is Kiraposho S., who is also a farmer. They do the farming together on their own piece of land. He is been in farming activity for the last three years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) on harrowing, 20,000 KES on seeds and fertilizer, and 10,000 KES on planting 10 acres of wheat.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to large-scale commercial farming.

Samarik's dream is to do large-scale farming and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking, determined man.

loans.use: To spend on harrowing, seeds, fertilizer and planting wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more ingredients to prepare doughnuts to sell

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala H. is 44 years old. She is married and has three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows and two calves. Her monthly income is about 180-220 AZN. Now, Kamala wants to expand her business and, as her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. So she is asking for 1000 AZN in order to purchase cattle and some sheep. Kamala expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and six sheep.

loans.name: Josefelia

texts.en:
In 2000, Josefelia G. found an opportunity to acquire business capital. She joined ASHI and was inspired by the stories she heard of other poor women. She wanted to become successful like them so because of this opportunity, Josefelia was able to start a fishing business.  She has taken all the risk of running a business; she thought she could be successful because her husband is there to support her and because of a dream of having all her children graduate from college.

Josefelia hopes that her children never have to experience the hard life she and her husband had . She dreams of increased space for her fishing equipment and an expanded fishing business.  Josefelia’s main challenge has been having a small stock due to the hindrances of small working capital to put into her fishing business. Therefore, Josefelia needs a larger loan to expand her fishing business. The fish her husband catches are sold by Josefelia in their village and to people selling fish in the market. She thinks that commercializing her fishing business and expanding it will enable her to earn more revenue and be able to pay school fees for her children and provide for other family needs. Josefelia’s wish to give her children a brighter future fuels her commitment to her fishing business. 

With all of her plans for the growth of her business, Josefelia would be happy if her children are able to achieve their personal dreams and have a life free of poverty.

loans.use: To expand her fishing business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia vive con sus padres en  la zona de Vino tinto de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 30 años de edad, egresada como profesora de Kinder, trabaja actualmente en el colegio Sagrados Corazones.

El crédito que solicita es para cubrir los costos de viajar al Brasil y costo de un curso de  especialización en su profesión. Su deseo es seguir trabajando en el colegio pero poder percibir un mejor sueldo.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo a través  de Impro. Por ser un crédito para Educación y   por el carácter social Silvia puede se sujeto de crédito. .
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her parents in the Vino Tinto sector of La Paz.  She is 30 years old and has completed studies as a Kindergarten teacher.  She is currently employed at Sagrados Corazones School.

She needs the loan to cover enrollment cost of a course to specialize in her profession as well as travel expenses to Brazil.  Her wish is to continue working in the school but earning a higher wage.

This is the first time she’s asked for funds through Impro.  Because it’s an educational loan and because of Silvia’s social characteristics, she is eligible to receive a loan.

loans.use: To pay for a child care and teaching course as well as travel expenses to take it.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es: Edgar Antonio tiene 54 años. Su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura eléctrica. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación es en su vivienda realiza diferentes trabajo como verjas metálicas, portones y elabora marcos de aluminio. Es una persona muy humilde pero trabajadora es por eso que se preocupa por  brindar a sus clientes una buena atención para que este satisfechos con su trabajo. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para la elaboración de sus productos.  El deseo de Edgar es mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Edgar Antonio is 54 years old.  His occupation involves electrical welding services.  He has dedicated himself to this line of work for over 4 years.  He conducts his business from his home and does various types of jobs, including metallic and front door welding and aluminum shielding.  He is a very humble yet hard working person, as such, he worries about providing the best possible service to his clients so that they are always completely satisfied.  Currently, he is seeking this loan for work capital to be able to purchase supplies that he needs to be able to elaborate his products.  Edgar's dream is to increase his earnings in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Work Capital.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a dos hijos en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, es uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque y es uno de los más pobres, su población se encuentra distribuida en zonas urbano marginales, las principales actividades económicas son el comercio y el transporte.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi en un pequeño auto Tico de su propiedad. El brinda este servicio en  su distrito y en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad de encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

José Manuel desea brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo, de modo que pueda trabajar de forma mas estable, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

José Manuel es una persona bastante responsable y entregada a su familia, el trata de esforzarse al máximo y trabajar muchas horas para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children in a marginalized urban area of the District of José Leonardo Ortiz. This district is one of the most populated in Lambayeque Region as well as one of the poorest. Its population is distributed among marginalized urban districts. The main business activities are trade and transportation.

José Manuel provides taxi services using a small Tico automobile that he owns. He provides his services in his district and in the city of Chiclayo. With the income that he earns from his business, he is able to move his family forward.

José Manuel wants to maintain his vehicle so that he can work in a stable manner. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can meet this objective.

José Manuel is a responsible individual who is devoted to his family. He strives to the do the best at his job and works long hours so that his family can get ahead and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: Zacarías, de 49 años, es un hombre muy humilde y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Jhon de 19 y Jonathan de 17, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Zacarías, es la siembra de cacao, café y coca, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos su producción al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, pero para mejorar sus ganancias desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará fertilizantes para mejorar su siembra.
texts.en:
Zacarías, age 49, is a humble and hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his two beloved sons, Jhon (age 19) and Jonathan (age 17), for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Zacarías grows cacao, coffee, and coca leaves and sells his harvest in the city of San Francisco where he has several customers. They are aware of the quality of his product and have no hesitation to buy his produce in large quantities. What he enjoys most about his work is sowing the land and making it fertile and productive. He has been farming for 24 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting his crops from plagues of insects. To move forward, he hopes to continue selling his products. He also wants to buy additional farmland to improve his earnings.

This is his first loan with MFP. Zacarías knows that he must submit his payments on time if he wants to access additional loans in the future. In his Communal Bank, he is a very responsible member who is concerned about the welfare of his group. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy fertilizers to improve his crop.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha, D. 33 años, vive en casa D. sus suegros al lado D. ellos, D. su esposo José D. 33 años y sus 2 menores hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Cada día esta emprendedora mujer empieza su labor desD. muy temprano, pues luego D. mandar a sus hijos al colegio se dirige a ofrecer los productos D. belleza, D. una reconocida marca, que comercializa a sus conocidos y clientes a través D. catálogo. Esta muy satisfecha porque es una labor tranquiL. ya que le permite dedicarse a sus hijos sin problemas; además le entretiene interactuar con sus clientes, y su capacidad D. persuasión  le permite convencer a sus compradoras para que adquieran cierto tipo D. productos que mejor le queden. Lo que no le gusta del negocio es que como ofrece los productos a crédito muchos clientes se demoran en el pago D. sus deudas; pero al final le pagan, pero le atrasa el movimiento D. su capital. Además tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar, donD. no solamente ofrezca sus productos, si no también adornos e implementos para el hogar. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete que cumplirá con el pago puntual D. sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mirtha tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en L. compra D. cantidad D. mercadería en productos D. belleza, pues quiere tenerlos en stock para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, y D. esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 33, lives in her in-laws’ house with them, her husband, José, 33, and their two minor children.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead.  

This enterprising woman starts her work day very early.  After sending the children off to school she heads out to offer beauty products of a well known catalogue brand to her acquaintances and customers.  She is very satisfied because the work is calm and she can dedicate herself to her children with no problem.  Besides, she enjoys interacting with her customers and her power of persuasion enables her to convince her buyers to get the product that best meets their need.  What she does not like about the business is that since she offers products on credit many customers lag behind with their payments although in the end they do pay; but this delays the circulation of her capital.

She plans to set up a small store where she won’t just offer these products but also decorations and items for the home.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who maD. this contribution that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress.

Mirtha plans to use the funds to buy a large amount of beauty products because she wants to have them in stock to offer the best to her customers thereby improving her profits.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: La señora Marta S. Álvarez es de la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 58 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de primaria, ella es casada y tiene 7 hijos Salustio tiene 42 años, Antonia tiene 40 años, Lucio tiene 38 años, Fidel tiene 36 años, Víctor tiene 34 años, María Enriqueta tiene 32 años, Victoria tiene 30 años todos trabajan. La señora Marta tiene su servicio de computadoras se llama Ciber Queta  y su taller de costura y solicito su préstamo para el mantenimiento de las  maquinas y va a comprar hilos, ahujas, aceite, tijeras, también una parte para la casa para la alimentación, ella ofrece a sus clientes la venta de dulces y servicio de computadoras , este negocio lo inicio hace 7 años y es de su hijo pero ella lo atiende, la costura lo aprendió primero Planchando y después aprendió a coser, elaboraba mandiles y los salía a vender, ella tiene en su taller tiene 3 maquinas industriales cuando comenzó el maquilero le prestó una maquina ya después maquilando fue ahorrando se compro 1 maquina y después las otras 2, su negocio está en su casa, para ella su negocio es importante porque obtiene dinero y la parte favorita de su negocio es coser y le da gran satisfacción la costura, ella recuerda muy orgullosa cuanto tuvo su primer maquina ya con esta máquina amplia su trabajo, sus clientes son diferentes personas por que sale a vender sus productos, su negocio es popular mas la conocen por las computadora o el Ciber y arreglos de cierres y está planeando ampliarlo comprar más tela para tener mercancía para trabajar y lo piensa lograr ahorrando o con el préstamo. Su negocio enfrenta la competencia de mas personas que se dedican a lo mismo, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para la alimentación, ella está bien contenta con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque le va ayudar a su negocio para invertirlo en mercancía y tener para trabajar y sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando y este negocio le va a ayudar a compartir lo que gana con sus hijos. Tlayecac es un lugar bonito, ya tiene muchos años viviendo en este pueblo que es muy tranquilo. La Señora Marta quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por el préstamo y que sigan ayudando a las personas que lo necesitan para el bien de ellos y de sus familias con estas ayudas los negocios siguen trabajando”.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta S. Álvarez, 58, is from the community of Tlayecac, Ayala in the state of Morelos, México.  She studied up to the third grade of elementary school.  She’s married and has 7 children: Salustio, 42, Antonia, 40, Lucio, 38, Fidel, 36, Víctor, 34, María Enriqueta, 32 and Victoria, 30.  All of them work.

Marta has a computer service business called Ciber Queta and she also has a sewing workshop.  She requested the loan to service the machines and to buy thread, needles, oil and scissors.  She also needs part of it for food for the household.  She sells candy and computer services to her customers.

She started the business 7 years ago and it’s her son’s but she tends to it.  With respect to the sewing: she first learned ironing and then sewing.  She used to make aprons to sell.  She has three industrial sewing machines in her workshop.  At first, she used a borrowed machine that she got from the “maquilero” (person who assembles clothing for third parties).  Later on, as she did more and more clothing assembly jobs, she saved up and bought a sewing machine and then another two.  Her business is in her house.

Her business is important to her because she earns income.  Her favorite part of the business is sewing and sewing gives her much satisfaction.  She remembers proudly when she got her first machine that allowed her to expand her business.  Her customers are different people because she goes out to sell her items.  Her business is popular and she’s also well known thanks to the computers, or the Cyber, and zipper repairs.  She is planning to expand buying more fabric to have merchandise to work with.  She plans to accomplish this either with savings or with the loan.

Her business faces competition from other people who do the same thing.  She uses profits from the business for food.  She is very happy with the loan she’s getting because it will help her in business buying merchandise and providing working capital.  Her dreams and aspirations are to stay in business and to be able to share what the business produces with her children. Tlayecac is a very beautiful place.  She has been living in this town for many years.  It is very peaceful.

Marta wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you very much for the loan and continue to help people who need it for their own and their families’ wellbeing.  With this help the businesses continue working.”

loans.use: To service the machines and to buy thread, needles, oil and scissors.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Punto Nueve del distrito de Mochumí, una zona netamente agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de media hora  de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de diversos productos en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de uso diario y abarrotes. Ella trata de brindar a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y un trato amable, gracias a sus esfuerzos la acogida de su negocio por parte de su clientela es permanente.

Gregoria desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 52 years old, single, and lives with her family in the settlement of Punto Nueve, part of the district of Mochumí. It is a mainly agricultural zone located in the province of Lambayeque, more than a half-hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She works selling various products in a grocery store set up in her house and there, she sells different daily items and groceries. She tries to provide her customers with good quality products and friendly service. Thanks to her efforts, the reception of her business by her customer base is permanent.

Gregoria wants to expand her business with the purchase of more products so that she can meet the current demand. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To expand her business with the purchase of more products

loans.name: Federico José

texts.es:
Don Federico José G. R. trabaja como higienista en el mercado Oriental de Managua, desde hace 7 años.

Es casado de 31 años de edad, con tres personas a su cargo, este es el crédito número seis que presta en CEPRODEL todos los créditos incluyendo este los solicita para reparación de vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por la oportunidad que le da de mejorar su casa poco a poco ya que es una persona de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Federico has worked as a hygienist in the Oriental (Eastern) Market in the capital, Managua. He has been married since he was 31 years old and is responsible for the wellbeing of three persons.  

This is Federico's 6th loan with CEPRODEL. All of these loans, including this one, he solicited for repairing his home.  Federico is grateful to CEPRODEL for the opportunity which it offers to improve his house, little by little, since he is a person with scarce financial resources.

loans.use: REPAIRING HIS HOME

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
The name Piñata Land brings to mind images of good times and family fun.  Alejandro D. and his family recently bought a party accessory business in their home town of El Paso.  They renamed the store Piñata Land, emphasizing the colorful variety of piñatas they offer.  

The idea of owning a store specializing in piñatas first presented itself when Alejandro’s sister-in-law, who was working at the party accessory store at the time, discovered her employers’ intention to sell the business.  After Alejandro and his family decided they wanted to purchase the business, they approached the store’s former owners with an offer contingent upon financing.  Alejandro needed this financing quickly, before the owners moved on to other interested buyers.  With a loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana, they were able to purchase the store, including the store’s equipment and remaining inventory.

Piñata Land is a true family-owned and operated business, consisting of Alejandro, his wife, brother-in-law, and sister-in-law.  Alejandro’s wife and sister-in-law run the storefront and day-to-day operations, while Alejandro and his brother-in-law balance full-time jobs with managing Piñata Land finances.  Alejandro and his wife handle all of this in addition to raising two small children (ages 3 and 4).  The kids have adapted to their parents' constantly being at work because, as Alejandro explains, “we bring them with us (to the store)… they like being there.”

Alejandro hopes to eventually expand Piñata Land into a catering business, possibly also opening a second storefront.  For now though, he and his family are focused on strengthening their inventory to sell party accessories.   They are off to a good start.  “January is traditionally a slow month, but so far sales are better than expected.”

loans.use: Purchase of business, including existing inventory

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita P. is 53 years old and lives in Kapan city. She is a widow and her only son lives in Russia with his family. For about 12 years Rita has run a clothes and shoes trading business. She buys merchandise from Yerevan once a week and resells it from a rented stall in Kapan clothes market. Rita is able to support herself with this business.
Rita is asking for a $1,000 loan to buy spring season clothes and shoes for her business. This is Rita’s eighth loan from Kiva partner, Nor Horizon, and she has never made a late loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy spring season clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her biggest monthly expense is school fees for her children. She makes a living by running a stall where she sells vegetables, including potatoes, green vegetables and tomatoes to her neighbors and to passersby. She has applied for a loan for Kshs 70,000 to buy the pipes she needs to start a water-distribution business, and joined Yehu in hopes of securing funding to bring her dream to life.

loans.use: To buy pipes to start a water-distribution business.

loans.name: Jeanly

texts.en:
Jeanly T. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old. Jeanly is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jeanly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jaime Ignacio

texts.es: Jaime nació en la ciudad de Lima y tiene 47 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, él ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Capital Arqueológica de América) y se dedica a la vende de ceviche pues tiene un local donde expende sus productos llamado “CALAMARO”. Ya son seis años que tiene al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Jaime pertenece al banco comunal “Conzume III” de la Asociación Arariwa y ya son varias veces que se presta crédito de la institución pero en esta oportunidad,   Jaime requiere el préstamo para el aumentar el capital del negocio desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo limón, cebolla, pescado y otras cosa más, otra parte del crédito desea para ahorrar para que en el futuro se compre su terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en: Jaime was born in the city of Lima and is 47 years of age.  He is married and, as fruit of this union, he has four children.  He now lives in the city of Cusco (Archeological Capital of America) and is dedicated to selling ceviche (a traditional seafood dish). For this purpose he has a location where he prepares his products that he calles "CALAMARO".  He has already had the business for six years and it goes very well thanks to the determination that he puts into his work.  Jaime belongs to the "Conzume III" communal bank of the Arariwa Association.  He has already had several loans with the institution but at this time Jaime requires a loan to enlarge the capital of the business.  He wants to buy supplies such as lemons, onions, fish and other things.  Another part of the loan he wants to save so that in the future he can buy land to build his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as lemons, onions, fish and more.  Another part of the loan he hopes to save.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Ahmadiyya Primary School in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1960 by the Ahmadiyya Muslim Mission. The school is currently staffed with nine teachers and has an enrollment of 326 pupils. This is the first loan from Kiva lenders from which teachers of this institution have benefited. 

Abu B. B. is a teacher at the school and the leader of this group. The 49-year-old Abu was born in the township of Lunsar. He has been in the teaching profession for twenty-one years now. Abu is married and has two children who are in college. Abu is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 SLL in order to pay college fees and buy school learning materials for his children in college. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children, while others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay college fees and buy school learning materials for his children in college

loans.name: Milene

texts.es:
Milene tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa de sus familiares.

Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos con su esposo, han arrendado un terreno que se ubica cerca de su casa y que se ha vuelto su fuente principal de ingresos en su familia, todos los días trabajan y han contratado también mano de obra que les ayuda en la preparación de los ladrillos ya que Milene se dedica exclusivamente a la venta y búsqueda de nuevos clientes y el trabajo suele ser muy dura que requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Con estos años de trabajo ha visto que la fabricación y venta de los ladrillos es ventajosa en sus rentas por lo que  tiene planes de extender su negocio arrendando otros terrenos. 

Es su crédito numero 16 que tiene con MFP, considera que este tiempo de trabajo en su banco comunal es muy gratificante ya que le ayudo a superar su economía además de que compartió gratis comentos con sus compañeros de grupo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos.

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos.
texts.en:
Milene, age 24, lives with her husband and her son in a house of their relatives. For nine years, Milene and her husband have been running a brick manufacturing business in a lot that they have rented near the house. They work every day and have also contracted additional labor to help them with the production process.

Milene is focused exclusively on the sales and client acquisition part of the business -- a job that is quite difficult and requires a lot of effort. With all the years of experience in this line of work, Milene finds that the business of manufacturing and selling bricks has been quite profitable which is why she plans to expand the business by renting additional production lots.

This is Milene's 16th loan with MFP; she feels that her work as part of her communal bank is very rewarding since it has helped her improve her financial situation and also gives her the ability to exchange ideas with her fellow members of the bank. Milene is committed to the timely repayment of the loan. She will use the funds to purchase raw materials.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making bricks

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: El señor David labora en una institución en la ciudad de Managua donde a diario se esfuerza para llevar el pan a su mesa y así beneficiar a su amada familia. Se siente muy satisfecho porque ha logrado mantener dicha familia proporcionando las condiciones de vida y supliendo todas y cada una de las necesidades que se presentan en el hogar. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de materiales de construcción como arema, cemento y otros para reparar la sala que ha estado en malas condiciones y asi proporcionarle un lugar seguro a su familia. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para iniciar con la obra de mejora de construcción.
texts.en: David works in an institution in Managua where he strives daily to bring food to the table for his beloved family. He feels very satisfied that he has been able to provide for his family everything that they need. The loan that he is asking for is to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and others to repair a room that is in poor condition and thus give his family a more secure living space. He hopes that his loan will be given satisfactorily in order to begin construction.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and make improvements on his home.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 30 años, vive con su madre  y su hijo en casa de sus padres ya que su esposo trabaja en otro país. Hace más de 6 años y medio se dedica a la venta de ropa, mercadería que lleva a otra ciudad cada fin de semana para su venta. Y en las quincenas se abastece de mercadería viajando a la ciudad de Lima buscando nuevos diseños y modelos en ropa. El tipo de prenda que vende es generalmente para niños aunque en ocasiones vende chompas y casacas para adultos. Durante todo este tiempo de trabajo ha vivido muchas experiencias entre buenas y malas, que le han enseñado como afrontarlas. Actualmente ha logrado conseguir un espacio de ventas en la feria comercial de la ciudad donde viaja, y por tal espera establecerse y abastecerse de mercadería, por ello pide de su apoyo para concretar sus planes. Es su crédito número 6 con MFP,  considera que es de mucho beneficio formar parte de un banco comunal que le permite mejorar en su negocio y como persona porque  tiene un espacio de amistad con cada uno de los integrantes de su banco a la cual valora mucho. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma is 30 years old.  She lives with her mother and son in her parents’ house since her husband works in another country.  She’s been selling clothes for over six and a half months.  This is merchandise that she takes to another city to sell every weekend.  At every biweekly payday she goes to Lima to stock up on new styles of merchandise.  The type of garment she usually sells is children’s clothes although she sometimes also sells sweaters and jackets for adults.  During all this time working she has faced many experiences, some good and some bad, that have taught her how to face them.  She has managed to secure sales space in the commercial market in the city that she travels to so she expects to establish herself and stock up on merchandise.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to bring these plans to fruition.

This is loan #6 with MFP.  She considers being part of a communal bank to be very beneficial because it allows her to improve her business and to improve as a person because she has space for friendships with each of the bank members which she values highly.  She will use the requested loan to buy clothes to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en:
Musyoki is a 33 year old business man who is married to a woman named Alice.  They are blessed with two children, ages 10 and seven years respectively.  He has been running a green grocer business for the past 10 years earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

He is taking out his third loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He will use the loan to increase the stock that he buys, like kale, tomatoes and potatoes.  With the anticipated profit from the business he intends to educate his children.

His hope and dreams are to open a general shop which will enable him to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 26 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area. She’s single with two children aged 4 and 12. Both live at home and attend school. For the past four years she has been involved in the sale of "lapper" (traditional cloth). Her main problem is the rise of "lapper" prices from 350 to 600 Liberian dollars.

She started this business with the help of her former husband who gave her money to start selling and she learned this from her mother. Kebbeh says what she likes about this business is that it helps her to take care of her children and also she likes being responsible for own business, to make it work.

Kebbeh has requested this loan to purchase more goods to sell. Kebbeh plans to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more "lapper" (traditional cloth) to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Triunfo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group Mujeres al triunfo 1 & 2 (Women to victory). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her biggest challenge is to have savings so that  if her grown children need something, she could proviD. it and have a better living standard. This is her first loan with Esperanza. 

Juana has had her business for almost two years. Using some savings she started selling fried food and now she has a Pica Pollo (fried chicken restaurant), where the principal dish is chicken with fried plantains or potatoes. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying many pounds of chicken, plantains, potatoes and cooking oil. Also she will purchase chairs and tables. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.

Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo and is composed of 10 people.

loans.use: to buy chicken, plantains, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Americo; el socio tiene 45 años; el socio es casado y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos es independiente y con el estan 4 hijos, de 21, 16, 14, 11 años de edad;  El socio se dedica a la compra y venta de palos, el socio compra palos al por mayor y los vende en calidad de leña, el socio los hace cortar y los agrupa en montones a la puerta de su casa con un letrero que dice se vende leña al por mayor y menor; el socio compra palos y los almacena en su casa, el socio desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de palos al por mayor para convertirlos en leña. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de palos al por mayor.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Americo, a member of “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”, a Communal Bank located in Yungaqui, a district of the Anta province in the Cusco department.

Americo is 45 years old, he is married and has 4 children aged 21, 16, 14 and 11. He engages in buying and selling poles. He buys poles at wholesale price and sells them as firewood after having had them cut. He buys poles and he stores them in his house. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of poles to transform into firewood. He is requesting a loan to invest it in the wholesale purchase of poles.

He is very satisfied with and thankful to the support he will receive through this loan, and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues according to the agreed schedule.
