loans.use: To buy poles at wholesale price.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and married to Ruth. They are blessed with six children, ages 13, 11, 9, 7, 5 and 3. He has been selling plastic utensils for nine years with a monthly income of KES 30,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to add plates, cups and jugs to his business.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy a piece of land. His hopes and dreams are to build rental houses and educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to add plates, cups and jugs to his business.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, single and lives with four family members, one of whom works.

Salem has owned a market since 2006, selling all kinds of barley and wheat. He has good experience in this field and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana  de 58 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su hijo de 20 años, donde llegó desde su natal Tumaco, en busca de nuevos horizontes para su hijo, su principal motor para trabajar persistentemente y lograr su futuro exitoso. Esta es la razón por la cual emprendió su aventura de negocios donde vende mercancía variada como colonias, cosméticos ropa, accesorios femeninos, para el hogar etc, mediante la modalidad de contado y a crédito a clientes fieles. Su creciente clientela hacen que su capital de trabajo sea insuficiente para responderles y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará en mayor volumen, perfumes, cosméticos, talcos, y mercancía encargada por sus clientes a quienes planea responder de manera oportuna, para continuar ganado credibilidad y posicionamiento en el mercado. Su sueño más adelante es tener un local comercial propio en grandes superficies y por eso se esfuerza en lograr diariamente relaciones comerciales convenientes.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her 20-year-old son. She arrived here from her birthplace of Tumaco in search of new horizons for her son, who is her primary motivation for working persistently and achieving future success. For this reason, she established a business selling various merchandise such as colognes, cosmetics, clothing, women’s accessories, household goods, and other items. She conducts cash sales and also extends credit to her loyal customers. Her growing customer base has exposed her lack of sufficient capital to respond to their orders. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Ana will use the money to buy large volumes of perfumes, cosmetics, talcum powders, and other merchandise that have been ordered by her customers so that she can respond to them in a timely manner. This will allow her to continue gaining credibility and positioning in the marketplace. Her dream for the future is to have her own shop with a large space. For this reason, Ana strives every day to establish convenient business relationships.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, talcum powders, and other products that have been ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 47 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  He is from the village of Chekhedana, West Georgia. Tengiz and his wife are running a family agricultural business, which is the only source of income for the family. Tengiz grows 1,000 nut and tangerine trees on the family- owned 0.5 hectare of land. They sell harvested products locally to wholesalers. Their total average monthly income is 280 Laris. 

Tengiz is requesting a loan to purchase nuts from wholesalers for an inexpensive price. He will process them and sell in the spring for a higher price. Tengiz will use the profit for financing the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase nuts for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Nancy has been buying and selling livestock for six years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Nancy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maryuri Jackeline

texts.es:
Maryuri de 38 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”, es una mujer que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento en su negocio.
Su negocio es un Salón de belleza, lo inicio aproximadamente hace 10 años.
Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, pero hay cliente que prefiere que ella vaya a su domicilio para brindarle su servicio.
Su horario inicia a las 10:00am hasta las 22:00pm, de lunes a viernes.
Su dificultad es la ubicación de su negocio, ya que es un poco complicado al acceso de vivienda, por eso ella prefiere salir a brindar su servicio a domicilio.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos como: tinté, extensiones de cabellos, shampo, etc.
Su sueño es poder obtener otro local en donde se encuentre en buen acceso para llegar.
texts.en: Maryuri, 38, lives in a suburban zone called “Durán.”  She’s a woman who aspires toward her business’ growth.  She has a beauty salon that she started about 10 years ago.  It’s located at home although some of her customers prefer that she come to their homes to provide the service.  She works from 10am until 10pm, Monday through Friday.  Her difficulty is her salon’s location because getting to her house is a little complicated that’s why she prefers to provide her services in her customers’ homes.  She is asking for the loan to buy products like: hair color, hair extensions, shampoo, etc.  Her dream is to obtain another locale that’s more easily accessible.

loans.use: to buy hair color, hair extensions, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Ella vive en compañía de su mamá Elva y sus 2 hermanas: Celeste y Ariana, a las que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de San pedro de saño. Desde joven apoyó a sus padres en las diferentes actividades económicas que realizaban. Como hermana mayor ella tomó las riendas del hogar, es por eso que hace algunos años abrió una panadería donde, comenzó preparando panes, con el tiempo incursionó en la elaboración de pasteles, tortas y demás productos a base de harina, le va muy bien en su trabajo, pues recibe la ayuda de sus mamá y hermana. Ello le permitió abrir su negocio de cabinas de Internet, comenzó con 4 máquinas y cuenta con 9 en la actualidad. Ahora, sus planes son  expandir más sus negocios, invertir en tecnología, comprando máquinas nuevas que le permitan obtener buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San pedro” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Maribel, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de panteones, chocolate, harina y manteca; para está campaña navideña.
texts.en:
27-year-old Maribel is a hard-working woman who lives together with her mom, Elva, and her two sisters, Celeste and Ariana, who she cares for in her own home which is located in the small village of San Pedro de Saño.  She supported her parents in their different business activities since she was a young girl.  As the eldest sister, she took over the reins of the household and, some years ago, she opened a bakery where she started making bread.  Over time, she also started making pies, cakes and other flour-based products.  She is doing very well in her work and receives help from her mom and sisters.  This allowed her to open another business (an Internet cafe).  She started out with four machines and now has nine.  Her plans are to further expand her businesses and invest in technology by purchasing new machines which will allow her to make good profits.

Maribel belongs to the San Pedro community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time.  Maribel enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, Maribel will invest the money she has requested in buying panettones, chocolate, flour and butter for this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy panettones, chocolate, flour and butter to stock her bakery

loans.name: Spora

texts.en:
Spora has operated her potato sales business in Nakuru town for the last 10 years.  She is 49 years old and widowed with four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officer during marketing and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of potatoes to sell in her business.

In the future, Spora hopes to expand her potato business and become one of the leading potato suppliers in Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia nació en la  ciudad de Acomayo y desde hace varios años que radica en la antigua ciudad del Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Aurelia tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Aurelia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Aurelia se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de forma ambulatoria. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Aurelia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Aurelia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo medias, calzoncillos, calzones y otras cosas más. 

Aurelia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Aurelia was born in the city of Acomayo and for several years lies in the ancient city of the Empire of the Incas (Cusco). Aurelia is 44 years old, married and from this marriage has 3 children.  Aurelia carries out her daily and economic activities in the city of Cusco.   

Aurelia has mobile stand where she sells undergarments.  She has been doing this for four years, thanks to the hard work she puts into her business. 

Aurelia belongs to the community bank “Ñahupacman Purisun” of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Aurelia requires the loan to buy merchandise such as stockings, underwear, long-underwear among other things.

Aurelia is grateful for the opportunity afforded by these means and likewise agrees to comply with the payment according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as stockings, underwear, long-underwear among other things.

loans.name: Washington Saturno

texts.es:
Washington Saturno tiene 38 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 9 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Washington se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 30 años , las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Jacinto. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar insumos. El sueño es poder comprar terreno.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión

Con el dinero del crédito anterior invirtio en la agricultura, siembra de maíz, compras de fertilizantes. En el Trabajo y la Familia esrá muy bien.
texts.en:
Washington Saturno is 38 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He lives with his wife and with his children, aged 16, 14, 12 and 9, in the canton of Ventanas, Los Rios province.

The "JERUSALEN" communal bank is located in the town of El Caimito, which belongs to Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and Gandul beans [pigeon peas]. 

Washington has done farm work for 30 years, working with corn and rice crops. He makes his purchases and sales in San Jacinto. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy supplies. His dream is to be able to buy land. 

He has not faced any kind of problem. In his free time, he likes to watch television. 

With the funds from the previous loan, he invested in agriculture, planting corn and buying fertilizer. Things are going very well for him with his work and with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El señor Luis Manuel del de 46 años esta casado con la señora Patricia, tiene 3 hijos en edad que actualmente están estudiando el es herrero cuenta con un negocio propio el cual le permite cubrir los gastos familiares y de educación de sus hijos. El tiene la necesidad de comprarle una computadora a sus hijos gasta alrededor de $100.00 diarios en renta de equipos de computo e impresiones para que sus hijos elaboren sus tareas el ha estado ahorrando para comprar una computadora para sus hijos el se las había prometido para DICIEMBRE y es fecha en que no le alcanza con sus ahorros para comprarla y solicita el apoyo para que le puedan dar para apoyar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Señor Luis Manuel is 46 years old and married to Señora Patricia. He has 3 children who are of school age and are currently studying. He is a blacksmith, a trade that allows him to cover his household expenses and his children's education. He needs to buy a computer for his children. He spends around $100.00 daily to rent computer equipment and on printing so that his children can complete their assignments. He has been saving to buy a computer for his children. He had promised them one for December, however, he doesn't have enough saved at this date to buy it. He is asking for help so as to support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Espiga Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  Espiga y se integra de tres personas dos hombre y una mujer y viven en  una comunidad pequeña.
 
   Don Virginio fue quien se le tomo la entre vista, el es casado con la señora  Elisa y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes ya están casados, y comenta que solicito l préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de  madera para la elaboración de muebles en donde lleva trabajando   veinte años y le va bien y que con ello a logrado muchos ingresos para su familia.

  Su inispiracion por esta actividad fue por si solo ya que  trabajo con un señor que es carpintero y de ahí comenzó su noción por esta actividad y  decidió poner su propia  carpintería para ganar su propio dinero.

   Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo y su actividad pueda seguir aumentando su negocio para así seguirá adelante con su familia.

   Las personas que integran en el  grupo son: el señor Enrique  quien solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de madera para elaboración de muebles y la señora  Josefa invertirá en la compra  de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
The group is called "Espiga", and is made up of three persons; two men and a woman. They live in a small community.
 
Virgionio was the one interviewed. He is married to Elisa, and they have four children who are already married. He says that he applied for the loan in order to buy wood for making furniture. He has been in this business for 20 years. It's going well, and he has managed to earn a good income for his family.

The inspiration for this business was his alone, as he worked for a carpenter, and the idea for this business began from there. He decided to set up his own carpentry shop to earn his own money.

What he most wishes is that with the loan and his hard work, he can continue increasing his business, so that he and his family can get ahead in life.

The people who make up the group are Enrique, who applied for the loan to buy wood for making furniture, and Josefa, who will use the loan to buy ingredients for making tamales.

loans.use: To buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Mariyei

texts.es: La señora Mariyei a sus 41 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la confección de prendas de vestir sobre medida y por encargos. Esta actividad la aprendió gracias a una amiga quien le enseño todo lo relacionado a este trabajo y desde entonces puede conseguir el sustento para ella y sus cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 9 años. Con el ánimo de producir una nueva línea de ropa de niño, la señora Mariyei necesita de la compra de insumos como telas, hilos y moldes con lo cual pueda cumplir su objetivo. La señora Mariyei sueña con tener un taller mucho más grande en el cual puede generar varios empleos directos y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mariyei, 41, has been making clothes to order and based on prior orders for ten years.  She learned this occupation thanks to a girlfriend who taught her everything related to it and since then she’s been able to earn her livelihood for herself and her four children who are 15, 13, 11 and 9 years old.

Hoping to introduce a new line of children’s clothing, Mariyei needs to buy supplies like fabric, thread and patterns to reach her objective.  Mariyei dreams with having a much larger workshop where she can generate several direct employment opportunities and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and patterns.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La señora Guillermina de 49 años es casada desde hace 4 años ella con el ayuda de su esposo el Sr. Ramiro decidió iniciar un negocio el cual le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y que al mismo tiempo le permitiera atender las labores del  hogar como lo son lavar, planchar, cocinar, limpiar la casa. Buscando Guillermina la manera de no descuidar ninguna de estas actividades decidió vender ropa de segunda mano en su casa colocándola en las rejas de su casa. La señora Guillermina requiere el apoyo de comprar ropa de temporada de frio y calor para los cambios climáticos.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 49, is married.  Four years ago, with the help of her husband she decided to start a business that would allow her to help her husband with the household expenses.  At the same time it would allow her to take care of the household chores, which are washing clothes, ironing, cooking, and cleaning the house.  Looking for a way to not neglect any of this work, Guillermina decided to sell used clothing at home, placing it on the fence of her house.

Guillermina needs the support to buy clothes for cold and hot weather for the changes in climate.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for her business.

loans.name: Lucila Amalia

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó a vender pescado asado con su mamá y como le fue bien, empezó a prepara otros platos.  Ahora trabaja por su cuenta todos los días y ha ganado muy buena clientela.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como guardia en un hotel de la localidad.  Tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.  Desea a futuro poder tener su propio local en la parte céntrica de la ciudad.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, pollo, aceite y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos que vende.

loans.use: Compra de víveres

loans.name: Bonte De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BONTE DE DIEU est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. Adelaïde Monique, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans est veuve, mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Aucun de ces enfants ne sont à sa charge. Adelaïde Monique vit seule. elle assure toute seule les charges de la maison. Adelaïde Monique a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour ce faire, depuis sept ans, Adelaïde Monique vend des produits vivriers et divers produits (savon, boîtes de conserve)dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Adelaïde Monique vend aussi des tissus, ce qui lui permet de subvenir facilement à ses divers besoins. Adelaïde Monique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Adelaïde Monique sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BONTE DE DIEU sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des produits vivriers.

loans.name: Ayitchéou David

texts.fr: Ayitchéou David âgé de 30 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture, activité qu'il exerce depuis quinze ans dans sa région. Ayitchéou David est marié à une marchande du nom de Agnès et est père de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et rien a leur charge. Ayitchéou David vit ensemble sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Ayitchéou David vend des tissus et des fournitures de couture de façon secondaire. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. David  achète ses produits dans une ville de Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Ayitchéou David pour une sixième fois sollicite, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des fournitures scolaires.

loans.name: Dioutala's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 12 Novembre 2015. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Dioutala (debout à droite avec une main levée),est l'emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires .

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile de palme, 01 sac de sucre, des bouillons du thé et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails chez elle.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants (habillements, soins médicaux habillement etc.…) et développer son activité.

loans.use: acheter 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile de palme, 01 sac de sucre, des bouillons du thé et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails chez elle.

loans.name: Héctor Oswaldo

texts.en:
Hector M. lives in Merida, Yucatan, is 28 years old and is single. As a young child he helped his mother sell clothing in neighbouring towns. Now, some time later, Hector h as decided to take up the business of selling clothing given his years of experience helping his Mom. Now he has an established business in a market and his goal was to help his Mom with the family\'s expeditures so that she may be able to retire. She has now retired.

Hector needs a loan of $475 to improve his business and remodel the shop (refinishing the floor and the walls). Become part of Hector\'s efforts by helping him develop his business, so that he in turn can help his Mom.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Héctor M. vive en la localidad Mérida, Yucatán, tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero. Él desde pequeño acompañaba y ayudaba a su madre a los pueblos vecinos del estado para vender ropa. Luego de algún tiempo, Héctor decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de ropa, con la ayuda de la experiencia que había adquirido al acompañar a su madre por muchos años. Ahora él tiene un negocio establecido en un tianguis de la localidad y su objetivo ha sido ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la familia, para que ella se retire de trabajar y lo ha logrado.

Héctor actualmente requiere de un prestamo de $ 475.00 dólares para poder mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, realizando una remodelación del piso y las paredes. Vuélvete parte de los logros de Héctor y ayúdalo a crecer para que él pueda ayudar a su madre.

loans.use: remodeling

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur has been a cattle breeder since 2005. He works very hard for the success of his children. He wants to improve his business and his revenue, which will result in better living conditions for his family.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought 2 calves.Now he applies for a loan of $1000 to buy a cow. 
Seymur is 40 years old,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has a small store where she sells various items including school and office supplies, toys for children and snacks. She is hoping that she can receive a loan in order to buy even more products. She particularly wants to focus on items that are attractive to children as her store has become popular with youth.

Martha is 35 years old and has three children, who are studying. Her home is made out of wood and bamboo and needs some work. She hopes she can save to improve her house and for the future of her children.

loans.use: to invest in toys and other products

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina first took out a microfinance loan a year ago when she began selling fruit and chocolate out of her home. The wife of a gold miner and mother of five children, her customers were her neighbors and miners on their way to work. Being based in her house is also helpful because at the age of 57, it is becoming more difficult for Marcelina to travel, and she would be able to save money by working from home.

Since her home is in a prime location near the mines she is requesting a $500 loan to open a store in her home and increase the quantity and types of food she sells. Several of her adult children continue to live with her and work as bricklayers or help her out with her business.

She hopes to save some of the money from this business for her grandchildren’s education. One of her greatest regrets is not being able to afford education for all of her children. Hopefully, as a result of her plans to open a store, her grandchildren will have some opportunities that their parents and grandparents never had.

loans.use: Open a store to sell food out of her home.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a very ambitious young man with amazing selling skills. He is 27 years old, lives in Bourj Barajneh in the suburbs of Beirut, and has been working in the clothing industry for the past 10 years. He was able  to expand his small business, over the year, into a well-known shop in the neighborhood. Bilal is a fashion addict and he observes carefully the new fabrics, colors, and trends of the year. Bilal needs a loan for an amount of USD $1,200 in order to buy inventory of clothes for the new season.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of new clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a woman that has tried her best to move forward in her life, given that her husband left her alone with four children. Besides her regular job she is studying so that she will be able to have a job that will allow her to pay for the studies of her children. She took a course to learn how to make crowns for tombs of the dead and she makes little decorations in her free time. Three years ago she finished her class and now she works making and selling the crowns and decorations outside of a cemetery where many people pass by.

However, the high season for people visiting the cemetery is about to begin, and that’s why she is asking for a loan of three hundred dollars to be repaid in three months. With this loan she will be able to buy the materials necessary to be able to make her products. Also, she would like to be able to buy stuffed animals and other gifts to be able to have more variety in her business. With your help Catalina will be able to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Catalina es una mujer que a luchado por salir adelante, puesto que su esposo, la abandonó con cuatro hijo, y aparte de su trabajo trató de conseguir otra ocupación para poder darle estudio a sus hijos. Y fue así como entró a un cuero de manualidades para poder aprender a hacer coronas para muertos y decoraciones para venderlos en sus tiempos libres. Hace tres año terminó su curo y ahora se dedica a fabricarlos y venderlos a las afueras de un panteón por donde pasa mucha gente.

Sin embargo la temporada alta del tránsito de gente está por empezar y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 mese y con este dinero catalina podrá comprar material para realizar sus manualidades. Y además de comprar peluches y regalos para poder tener más surtido en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Catalina podrá vender sus productos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to make her arrangements

loans.name: Parade Tani Group

texts.id:
This group of 10 men are farmers, and each of them have 0.1 hectares of paddy field. They run this 0.1 hectares they would need quite a lot of capital because they need to prepare seeds, seedlings, fertilizer, insecticide and and to pay worker's salary as well. They hire workers to level the field by using water buffaloes or tractors. Then the workers will plant the seedlings and clear off any wild plants. This group of men are from the same tribe and area, which allowed to help each other out. Their wishes are to let their children to have better education, and a better economy.

Translated from Bahasa by Maria Hernandez, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok ini beranggotakan 10 orang yang kesemuanya adalah para petani. Mereka mengusahakan tanah mereka dengan menanam padi dan rata-rata setiap petani mempunyai lahan 10 are. Di tanah yang 10 are ini para petani membutuhkan modal yang tidak sedikit karena mereka harus menyiapkan pupuk sekitar 100 kilogram, bibit sebanyak 5 kilogram, obat-obatan untuk hama, biaya perawatan dan jasa para pekerja. Para petani membutuhkan tenaga pembantu seperti buruh traktor untuk membajak tanah baik itu menggunakan tenaga tradisional (sapi, kerbau) ataupun menggunakan tenaga mesin (traktor), pekerja untuk menanam bibit padi, membersihkan gulma (tanaman liar) serta para pekerja untuk memanen padi tersebut. Kelompok ini terdiri dari para kaum bapak yang ada di satu dusun atau satu desa yang tentunya tempatnya berdekatan sehingga memudahkan bagi mereka untuk saling mengontrol satu dengan yang lainnya. Harapan-harapan mereka tentunya dapat menyekolahkan anaknya lebih baik lagi, keadaan ekonomi akan lebih meningkat sehingga keluarga mereka akan semakin baik dikemudian hari.

loans.use: To buy Seedlings , fertilizer, insecticide and other agriculture necessities.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim M. (his employee is pictured) owns and operates two stores in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He owns both a café and an auto parts and accessories store. Rasim is maried with three children and has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for funding so that he can increase the amount of items that his small auto parts store has in stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify the inventory at his auto accessories

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina is a multifaceted entrepreneur and a very organized person. She sells fresh pork meat in the morning and men’s and women’s clothing in the afternoon. Argentina is a single mother, and by means of these activities, she supports her five children.

This entrepreneur wants to expand her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase clothing in bulk. She will also buy the fresh meat of other animals, such as chicken and cows, to add to her inventory. Argentina says that her most important value is to work for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk and to purchase fresh meat to supply her two businesses.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen E. sells firewood to earn a living. She has been in business since 1998. She needs the loan of $600 to buy more firewood for sale.

Queen is married with 7 children. She is 49 years old. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sale

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr:
She was a retailer from the start, located along a path in the N'VENAMEDE district in Cotonou. Today, Ms. Gisèle A. A. is doing business in one of the SYNAPOSTEL shops. She was born on January 20, 1973 in Cotonou. Married to a clothier, she is the mother of three children. For six years, she has been buying sacks of corn, rice, beans, and voandzu (similar to peanuts), and other goods that she sells retail. She is on her fourth loan at Alidé and is credited with good ethics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Au départ revendeuse au bord de l'une des voies du quartier N'VENAMEDE à COTONOU, dame A. A. Gisèle exerce aujourd'hui son activité dans l'une des boutiques du SYNAPOSTEL. Elle est née le 20/01/1973 à Cotonou. Mariée à un couturier , elle est mère de 03 enfants. Depuis 06 ans, elle achète des sacs de maïs, de riz, de haricot, de voandzu et autres qu'elle revend au détail. Elle est à son 4ème prêt chez Alidé et se trouve crédité d'une bonne moralité.

loans.use: To buy twelve sacks of corn, each 120 kg

loans.name: Edith Adelaida

texts.es:
Edith belongs to “Las Almendras” (The Almonds) community bank, located in 323 Jr. Manco Capac, in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 64 years old, mother of 3 children, widowed, but the income she makes is not enough for her everyday financial needs. What Edith did with the first loan of S/. 300 received from Manuela Ramos was to invest it in a small stand to sell bananas.

Nowadays, she constantly travels in her boat through the Ucayali river to buy her bananas and sell them in the city.

With this loan of S/. 1,000 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy gas for her boat and some supplies for the trip.

With the loans provided Edith has done better in her business, it's a big help that also makes her feel good and be a women that can get through with the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el Jr. Manco Capac 323, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 64 años, es madre D. 3 hijos, es viuda, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Adith con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño puesto D. venta D. plátanos.

En la actualidad viaja constantemente a su chacra que tiene por las riberas del rió Ucayali para traer sus plátanos los y venderlos en la ciudad .

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: gasolina para su bote y algunos víveres que llevo para poder ir a traer sus frutas.

Edith con los prestamos recibidos esta surgiendo, prosperando con su negocio, y es una ayuda muy granD. que le brindan para sentirse bien y ser una mujer que aun pueD. salir adelante con el apoyo D. Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buy gas for her boat to travel to buy fruit for sale

loans.name: Ynés

texts.es:
Doña Ynés and her beloved children are very helpful in the home and in her business. For three years, her family has lived in one of the most distant neighborhoods in the city of Juliaca, where they have built a small home and where they have set aside space to open her little grocery store that they have named “Bodeguita San Pedro.” This little shop is very useful to its new neighbors who are content because of the good service they get. At the same time, they have many requests that Doña Ynés’s shop cannot satisfy. While she does housework and fulfills her role as mother, her supportive husband Isidro is employed as a master mason and with the support of their four children they have been working toward the goals they have achieved. Doña Ynés and her children count on your support to increase and establish her little shop and in this way satisfy her clients’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ynés y sus queridos hijos son muy colaboradores en su hogar y en su negocio, su familia hace 3 años vive en uno de los barrios más alejados de la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde construyeron su pequeña vivienda y en donde adecuaron un espacio para abrir su tiendita de abarrotes al cuál bautizaron con el nombre de “ Bodeguita San Pedro”, esta tiendita es muy servicial para sus nuevos vecinos quienes se sienten contentos por la buena atención que reciben, pero al mismo tiempo tienen innumerables solicitudes que la bodeguita de doña Ynés no puede satisfacer.Mientras ella se dedica a sus labores del hogar y a cumplir su rol de madre su esforzado esposo Isidro se desempeña como maestro albañil y juntos con apoyo de sus cuatro hijos vienen llevando a cabo cada una de las metas que se han trazado.Doña Ynés y sus hijos desean contar con tu apoyo para ampliar e implementar su bodeguita, y así complacer las solicitudes de sus clientes.

loans.use: Investment of capital to implement her small daily work space

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
I own a small grocery store where I sell all type of things people need for their home such as vegetables, fruits, bread, tortillas, water, milk, etc. The income I earn comes solely from what I sell in the store, and that income is sometimes very little. For that reason, I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to stock the store with items that people might need in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con un negocio de abarrotes pequeño, donde vendo de todo tipo de cosas que la gente necesita para su hogar, como verduras, frutas, pan, tortillas, agua, leche, etc... Los ingresos que obtengo son solo de lo que vendo en la tienda, y a veces es poco lo que saco de ingresos, por ello solicito el préstamo de $1,200.00 dll. Para surtir la tienda con más cosas que la gente pudiese necesitar para su hogar.

loans.use: Stock his small grocery store.

loans.name: Ni Kadek Murtini

texts.id:
Despite her young age, Kadek Murtini is highly motivated in running her convenient kiosk business in front of her house. Her husband, I Gede Murdana, also helps her with her business. They live with their 2 young children.

With an initial capital of $215.35, Murtini buys supplies for her convenient kiosk. All sorts of household items exist in her kiosk: rice, soap, oil and cosmetics. Her daily profit is $5.38, which is used for her daily needs, capital for her business, her children's school tuitions, and savings.

Kadek Murtini and her husband bought their house, which is built with semi permanent materials. The loan from DINARI will be used to increase their business capital. They hope that their business will grow towards a better future.

Translated by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Kadek Murtini yang usianya masih muda tetapi dengan tekun menjalankan usaha warungnya didepan rumahnya. Suaminya, I Gede Murdana, juga membantu usaha warung istrinya. Mereka tinggal berempat bersama anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil. Dengan modal awal Rp. 2.000.000,- Murtini membeli perlengkapan untuk keperluan warungnya. Segala kebutuhan rumah tangga ada diwarungnya, seperti beras, sabun, minyak dan kosmetik. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000.- per hari. Keuntungan ini di pakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari, modal usaha dan sekolah anaknya yang masih TK dan sisanya untuk ditabung. Rumah yang mereka tempati adalah rumah sendiri yang bangunannya semi permanen. Pinjaman dari DINARI di pakai untuk menambah modal usaha dan harapannya usahanya semakin maju dan berkembang kearah yang lebih baik.

loans.use: To increase capital for more inventory

loans.name: Sadai

texts.es:
Sadai G. B. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

Sadai es madre soltera tiene dos hijos a los cuales les quiere dejar un patrimonio ya que ellos viven en la casa de su cuñado y quieren tener su propio espacio, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora. Esta Señora tiene un empleo en el cual con el transcurso del tiempo fue acumulando suficientes puntos y así ella busco la forma de poder adquirir una casa, se contacto con una inmobiliaria pero esta le comento que aún así le faltaba una cierta cantidad de dinero. La cantidad que ella requiere es $600 dólares.
texts.en:
Sadai G. B. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Sadai is a single mother of two. She would like to leave a nest egg to her children. They live with her brother-in-law and they would like to one day own a home. She's a hard worker and very goal-oriented. She has a job where with a lot of time she has been able to accumulate enough points (credit) to purchase a house. She found out through her lender that she still needs to come up with some money. The total amount she needs is $600.


Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a home

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Mrs. Soy Y., 55, is a widow with four sons. One of her sons is married and lives outside the family home. One son is employed  full time, and the other two sons study in the local school. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soy has sold groceries for 12 years. She buys groceries from the market for resale at her home. Now, she is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Savat

texts.en: Mrs. Savat S. is a 50 year old widow and now lives in Lvear Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are attending the local school. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. She has a problem because her field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Savat S. requests a loan to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Grupo “Renacer” esta representado por la señora Regina. En su mayoría los socios (as) se dedican a la venta D. comida en snacks o en pequeños puesto D. venta, también a la venta y elaboración D. pan, cosméticos por catalogo y los varones se dedican al transporte público. Son gente honesta y trabajadora que se conocen D. tiempo ya que residen en el mismo barrio, en general conocen del trabajo en grupos solidarios porque participaron en grupos anteriores en la Fundación y saben D. la responsabilidad que implica los pagos y puntualidad D. los mismos. El dinero financiado servirá para la compra D. insumos y materiales así como para el crecimiento D. sus puestos D. venta D. comida y para la reparación D. los vehículos que son las herramientas D. trabajo D. los socios. Los socios (as) se encuentras esperanzados ya que este dinero les servirá para incrementar los ingresos y para cumplir mejor sus metas y enfrentar las dificultades del día a día.
texts.en:
Group “To Revive” is represented by Mrs. Regina. Most of the members sell food in snacks or in small stands. They also sell and make bread, sell cosmetics through a catalogue, and the men work in public transport. They are honest and hard-working people that have gotten to know each other over time since they live in the same neighborhood. In general, they know how to work in mutually binding groups because they have participated in groups before with the Fundación and they know the responsibility and punctuality associated with the payments. The money loaned will serve to buy supplies and materials as well as for the growth of their food stands and for the maintenance of the vehicles that are their tools for work. The members are hoping that this money will help them increase their income, reach their goals and face day-to-day difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise capital

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeang S. is a villager in Trapaing Bet village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Mei Mang, is a cow breeder. Since his cow-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Yeang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to raise.

Mrs. Yeang S. hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family. She is a 52-year-old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to raise

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La vivienda de la señora María Del Carmen M. la adquirió por medio de su trabajo, por medio de un crédito de gobierno. Pero a la casa le esta haciendo falta algunas cosa, ella quiere empezar a poner el poso de concreto al frente de la casa y hacer el contrata de agua. 
En esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la mejora y contratar el agua. Requiere del apoyo de ustedes para  poder llevar a cabo su proyecto.
La señora María Del Carmen es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilizad una hija, que esta estudiando y desea darle lo mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. María Del Carmen M. obtained a house through her job using a government loan. However, the house needs to have some improvements made. She wants to start laying pavement in front of her house and connect to the water supply.

At this time, she does not have the money needed for the home improvement and water main connection. She needs your help in order to carry out her project.

Ms. María Del Carmen is a single mother with a school age daughter under her care. She hopes to give her the best.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pavement and running water

loans.name: Virginia Patricia

texts.es: Virginia Patricia Rodríguez Ríos tiene 49 años, está casada, y tiene cuatro hijos. Todos los hijos trabajan o estudian, y tienen 24, 21, 20, y 19 años, respectivamente. Doña Virginia tiene de poseer este negocio hace más de 30 años, ella inicio este negocio desde que era muy joven ya que sus padres ejercían esta actividad. Más tarde, Doña Virginia decidió independizarse por su propia cuenta logrando sufragar los gastos de su familia. La ventad de sus productos las realiza en el mercado central, por lo que es muy importante para ella poseer capital de trabajo. Por eso,  Doña Virginia buscó la ayuda de la Fundación León 2000 y con un préstamo de Kiva, ella va a vender una variedad más grande de productos en el mercado. Sus sueños son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. El monto que solicita es de C$ 12.000 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Virginia Patricia Rodríguez Ríos is a 49-year-old married mother with four children, ages 24, 21, 20, and 19, who all either work or study. Ms. Virginia has been in business for over 30 years, starting out at a very young age because her parents were also in this trade. Virginia later went independent, thus managing to cover the family expenses. She sells her products at the central market, so it is very important for her to have business capital, which is why she sought the help of Fundación León 2000. With a loan from Kiva, she will offer a greater variety of products at the market. She dreams of improving her home. She is requesting a loan for C$ 12.000 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San K. is a widower of three children who lives in the Kampong Cham province. He has a business charging batteries from his home to earn a living, and is able to make US$5 per day. The family also gets support from two children who work as a hairdresser and a tailor.

Mr. San K. is asking for a loan to purchase hairdressing tools for his daughter. (Hak Sreypuch, a daughter of Mr. San K., is pictured at home.)

loans.use: Hairdressing supplies for daughter

loans.name: Agasef

texts.en:
Agasef A. is from the city of Sabirabad. He dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region.

He is the father of one son who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

Agasef has engaged in this business for more than 15 years. He would like to expand and purchase two more calves.

With your help, Agasef will be able to make his business more successful and support his family.

loans.use: Purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe A. is 55 years old and married with four children. She sells groundnut oil to her customers and is requesting a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more groundnut oil to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnut oil  to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is a farmer and her main crop is rice. She sells her harvest in sacks to the rice traders in her village. She also saves some of her rice for family consumption. Alma is already a widow. She manages her farm alone to support her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 to buy the fertilizers that she needs. She is also interested in looking for some other possible income areas to contribute better to the family income.


CEVI’s aim is to help small business to grow. To achieve that goal, CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage services to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Adamu Group

texts.en:
This is Adama B., Fatu T. and Mariatu K., who belong to the Adamu group, named after their group leader. This will be the fourth loan the group is requesting from SMT/Kiva, the previous ones, all since repaid, having had a huge impact on their lives. This group is now requesting a new loan to further strengthen their businesses.

Adama (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. Married with four children, 40-year-old Adama was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone and has been a businesswoman selling dried fish for many years. With this loan, she will be able to buy about two baskets full of dried fish. At Tongbo village (about 170 miles from Makeni), where she normally makes her purchases, a dozen fish cost her about Le 60,000 – Le 70,000.00.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda has always worked hard to support her family, while facing a series of personal tragedies—the death of her parents, followed by the loss of her brother to cancer and her stepson to a drunk driver.  Amanda made it through this difficult period, but needed to find a way to support her four children. She invested the money she had to purchase a busy street corner lot and opened a gourmet hot dog stand. Amanda’s only employees are her teenage kids who help her with cooking, cleaning, catering special events, and even bookkeeping. This helps her save money while helping her children develop a strong work ethic.

A $6,500 loan will enable Amanda to purchase an electric panel and an ice machine, which will save her both time and money. Amanda will also invest in fliers and advertisements in local newspapers to boost business.
Visit http://mandyskorner.com/

loans.use: Electric panel, ice machine, and advertising

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
A. est une femme très dynamique qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle maîtrise parfaitement la gestion de son activité ce qui est dû à son ancienneté dans ce commerce. Son stock a diminué, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes de haute qualité.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
A. is a very energetic woman who earns an income from commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She has mastered the managing of her business because of her seniority in this commerce. Her stock of merchandise is diminished. She would like to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 bolts of pagnes of high quality. She is married and the mother of four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy West African batik cloth

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda A. is from the village of Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Yolanda is married to Leovegildo A. and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business selling home products, like hypo chlorine, to the local community members. She also engages in selling rice and dried fish in their village. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Purok 9, GK, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City

loans.name: Lloyda

texts.en:
Lloyda sells a little bit of everything, including soft drinks, homemade popsicles, ice, beer, juice, and various local fruits.  On Saturdays she barbecues chicken, for which she sells tickets in advance.  Lloyda either sells her goods from her home or from a small stand in front of her sister-in-law's home on the main road.  Lloyda's neighbors know what she sells, so she has a number of regular customers.    

Lloyda is 32 years old and lives with her partner, who is a painter.  They have two children, 14 and 2.  Lloyda has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about two years and used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in candy for sale.  She still continues to sell candy on occasion, but has since diversified into the sale of other items.  Lloyda plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in more of the various goods that she sells.

Lloyda feels that her loans from Manuela Ramos have helped her business.  She is currently saving money to refurbish her house -- she would like to take down the wood siding and replace it with brick.  Lloyda also thinks that this loan might be her last for a while -- she feels that loans are a big commitment, one for which she must take all the responsibility.

loans.use: a variety of items for sale, including ice, soft drinks, beer and fruits; also chicken for sale at a BBQ

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg D. started her dairy business in 2004 with an investment of 80,000 tugrugs (approximately 55 USD). She is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and three children in Arkhangai province in central  Mongolia. Her husband works as a water kiosk operator, her oldest son and daughter both attend a local secondary school, and her youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

Because of her hard work and good customer service, her business has been growing steadily and her working capital has reached 400,000 tugrugs (approx. 276 USD). In addition, improved business has enabled Altantsetseg and her husband to enroll their children in good schools and have a good quality of life. She says, "My dream is to have my own store." Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of 700,000 tugrugs (approx. 483 USD) to  increase her inventory by purchasing more dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Lourdes is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mạnh's Group

texts.en:
Mạnh Thị N. grows vegetables and sells them in the market. She was born in 1960. Her husband has died. She has two children. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She is active and friendly. She has taken part in SEDA for four years. This time, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy seedlings and fertilizer. ID: 010114010002

About the other borrowers in the group: Tám Thị Trần grows vegetables. She was born in 1959. She has three children. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy vegetables to resell. ID: 010114010016

Thủy Thị N. is a worker and she raises chicken. She was born in 1977. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND to buy feed for her chickens. ID: 010114010019

Nghiệp Thị N. grows vegetables and raises pigs. She was born in 1959. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy hog feed and fertilizer. ID: 010114010021

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at Y., 33, and her husband, Hout Thol, 40, live in a small village along National Road Number 2 about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married for more than eight years and have one son and three daughters, two attending school and one still too young to go to school. Mr. Hout Thol is a driver for an electrical shop in Phnom Penh.

One of Sam-at’s children works at a garment factory along with her. Since they don’t have transportation for commuting to work, Sam-at is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en: Reyna Isabel is 45 years old and the mother of two teenagers. Her children, 16 and 18, are both in school. She sells cooked beans and firewood. She started her business two years ago when her partner retired from his work and they needed a way to support themselves. Her good credit history and relationship with Fundacion Leon 2000 made her a strong candidate for a Kiva loan. She reports that her loans have greatly helped support her business and household.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is forty. She is married and has four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Grace is a trader. She sells kerosene in gallons and bottles in her community. She says she buys from fuel tankers that come around to supply. Grace sells to retailers in her community. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy kerosene in large quantity so she can supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy kerosene.

loans.name: Cristo Vive 1 Group

texts.en: Maria lives in Samana and wants to use the loan to improve her house and to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. She has five children and wants the best for them. She trusts Esperanza International to give her an opportunity to improve her future. Help us to help her.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
el señor Juan Jose E. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en union libre con su pareja la señora Rosa Lainez con quien tiene 8 hijos, todos estan casados y no dependen de ellos. Su esposa tambien vende  verduras y refrescos en su casa.
 
el señor E. quien se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado mayoreo de Tegucigalpa los fines de semana y los dias de semana vende su producto en barrios, colonias de Nacaome y San Lorenzo.
el carro con que transporta sus verduras es propio.
 
esta solicitando el credito para invetir mas en su negocio ya que debido a la epoca navideña la demanda de frutas y verduras es mayor.
 
su meta a corto plazo es tener un puesto estable de verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Juan Jose E. is 56 years old and lives with his partner Rosa Lainez, with whom he has 8 children. All of his children are married and financially independent. His wife sells vegetables and soft drinks from their home.

On the weekends, E. sells vegetables in Tegucigalpa's wholesale market. On weekdays, he sells his merchandise in the residential areas of Nacaome and San Lorenzo. The car that he uses to transport his vegetables is his own.

He is requesting a loan to invest in his business, since the Christmas season means increased demand for fruits and vegetables. His short-term goal is to have an established produce stand in San Lorenzo's municipal market.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, green bananas, limes, oranges, and carrots

loans.name: Kyagalanyi Masajja Group, Central

texts.en:
M. Margaret is 30 years old and married with 3 children ages 11, 3 and 9 months.  She also takes care of 3 other dependents. Margaret has had a drug shop in Masajja A zone for 7 years and she is able to make 100,000/= (Ugandan Shillings) as profit almost every week due to her stock and good customer care.

Margaret struggles for this profit margin to increase since she works towards having a first class drug shop and becoming a rich family. She is such a hard working lady and needs a loan to be able to buy more drugs for her shop.

loans.use: Buying more drugs for her shop.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder  de  26 años vive con sus padres, Leonardo de 66 y Epifanía de 54 años, juntos habitan una casa alquilada.Desde hace 4 años cultiva papa, alverja y flores de gladiolos de  diferentes colores, esta actividad le permite mantener los gastos de la casa, cubrir las necesidades de sus padres  y principalmente ahorrar, lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es cultivar y cosechar las flores de gladiolos con delicadeza, porque puede ver su intenso color ,además la comercialización le resulta bastante rentable porque durante las temporadas de cosecha sus ingresos económicos se duplican devolviéndole de alguna manera el esfuerzo que realizó; en el futuro quiere sembrar  en mayor cantidad todos los productos agrícolas que pueda, para seguir progresando.Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta contento de trabajar en su banco comunal porque los integrantes son responsables.Con el dinero del crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, fertilizantes y bolsas de semilla de alverja, esperando obtener una cosecha productiva.
texts.en:
Wilder, age 26, lives with his parents, Leonardo, age 66, and Epifanía, 54. They live together in a rented house. For 4 years he has grown potatoes, peas, and gladiolas of different colors. This activity has allowed him to keep up with household expenses, cover the needs of his parents, and, most importantly, to save money. What he likes most about his work is the delicate cultivation and harvesting of gladiolas because he can see their intense color. In addition, the marketing of this product turns out to be rather profitable because during the harvest season his income doubles, giving him a return on the effort that he puts in.

In the future, he wants to plant a greater quantity of all the agricultural products he can in order to continue progressing. This is the fourth loan that he has had with MFP, and he is happy to work in his communal bank because the members are responsible. With the money from the loan he will buy several sacks of organic compost, fertilizer, and bags of pea seeds, hoping to obtain a productive harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy compost, fertilizers, and pea seeds

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen C. de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña solo cuanta con  luz y agua como servicios básicos, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 10, 13, 20 años de edad. 

Carmen  comenzó hace muchos años atrás con una cámara prestada tomando fotos en fiestas infantiles, poco a poco pudo reunir suficiente dinero para comprarse una cámara. 

En el presente ella trabaja en las escuelas y eventos sociales como fotógrafa, trabaja en conjunto con su hijo mayor, una de las complicaciones que ella tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cámara fotográfica profesional para que su hijo pueda trabajar también, en el futuro quiere tener su estudio fotográfico y tener su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Carmen C., 36, lives in a periurban zone along Guayaquil's beltway. Her house is made of sugar cane stalks and the only utilities it has are electricity and running water. She is a single mother of three children: 10, 13, and 20 years of age. Many years ago, Carmen started taking pictures at children's parties with a borrowed camera. Little by little, she saved enough money to buy her own camera. Currently, she works as a photographer at schools and social events. She works with her eldest son. One of the difficulties is the high crime rate in her area. She will use the funds to buy a professional camera so that her son can work too. In the future, she would like to have a photography studio and a concrete house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina R. is a married woman who supports her family by raising pigs and running a general store. She lives in Inalad, Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband, Jovencio, who is 38 years old, and their five children who are 6 to 18 years old and all currently going to school.

Ma. Gina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,900.

Ma. Gina is now borrowing Php 25,000 to buy feeds for  her pigs and also continue buying inventory for her general store. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

Ma. Gina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy feeds for her pigs and additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Víctor C. N., tiene la edad de 50 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y un hijo de 11 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer producir los cultivos de la finca, la idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Víctor cuenta con una finca de 10 hectáreas donde tiene diversos cultivos como: hortalizas, café, granos básicos, entre otros. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Victor también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Víctor C. N. is 50 years old and married. He lives with his wife and his 11 year old son. He wants the loan to be able to buy materials to help produce his crops on the farm. The idea is to improve and increase the production capacity and increase the area of crops. Víctor has a farm, which is 10 hectares. He grows diverse crops like coffee, basic grains, and others. He wants to give them adequate maintenance and achieve a better quality. He also wants to get the most income possible when it is harvest time. This is his first loan with Fudecosur, and he is very happy with the ease of payments that they provide. Víctor has been farming for many years. In the future he hopes to improve the quality of his life and have greater economic stability. That way he will be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help for his farm

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta D. is 50 years old and she is married with four children. Her husband also works to support the home.

Augusta is a petty trader and sells fruits like pawpaw, bananas, pineapples, oranges and mangoes. She started her business four years ago and she hopes to expand her business.

Augusta is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more fruit to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: C2141 Twuzuzanye Group

texts.en:
Fortune is 44 years old and is married with two children, 15 and 18 years old. She also takes care of one dependent who is not a relative. Her husband does not work.

Fortune works hard for her family. She is also the group representative of this group called Twuzuzanye in the local language. This group contains six members; most of them sell green bananas although one sells vegetables.

Fortune and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses. Each of them has a target of increasing their business through purchasing more various products for sale. Fortune and her group have businesses that are known in the market where their businesses are located.

Fortune has been in her operation of selling vegetables for four years. Her business is open two days a week on Wednesdays and Fridays; the hours of her business are from seven in the morning to eight in the evening.

With this loan, Fortune and her group expect to earn more profits which will allow them to save money for the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah P. is a married small-businessman with two schoolchildren. He runs a foodstuffs shop at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases and sells a variety of foodstuffs including rice, maize flour, wheat flour, beans, groundnuts, sugar and millet. He purchases from the wholesale shops at Kariakoo city shopping center and sometimes direct from the suppliers. He sells to customers at retail. He manages to meet his family's daily demands and business capitalization from his business income. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to boost the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1951, N. Justine vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Justine est une veuve ayant un enfant qui est scolarisé. Justine assure seule les différentes charges de la famille. Justine n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Justine  mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qui l'aident à faire face à ses différents besoins. C'est à Lomé au Togo, et également au Nigéria, deux Etats voisins du Bénin, que Justine achète ses tissus. Justine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Justine sollicite un autre prêt, en vue d'augmenter son stock de produits et de pouvoir mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1951, Justine N. has lived for around twenty years in the Ayélawadiè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is a widow with one child who attends school. Justine covers the various family expenses herself. She has never been to school. For almost 25 years Justine has had a business selling fabric through the distribution system. This activity generates income which helps her to provide for her various needs. She buys her fabric in Lomé in Togo, as well as in Nigeria, both of these countries bordering on Bénin. Justine is an old customer of ALIDé and has always repaid her loans without problem. Faced with growing customer demand, she is requesting another loan in order to increase her stock of products and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pieces of fabric

loans.name: Khandjamts

texts.en:
KhandJ., 40 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Residing with her family in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, KhandJ. currently operates a construction materials trade business out of a rented stall at the largest market in her town. With few competing businesses at this market, her business has seen steady growth since its inception in 2003.

Her children haven't attended secondary school, but KhandJ.' dream is for them to complete their education. A very optimistic and hardworking person, she also hopes to save money to build her own house. KhandJ. is now requesting a loan to purchase more supplies for her construction materials trade business.

loans.use: To purchase more construction materials

loans.name: Santa Colastica

texts.es:
Santa de 63 años, V. en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Ella tiene una tienda de víveres, por la falta de oportunidades y los pocos ingresos de su esposo ella decidió readecuar la sala de su casa y convertirla en una pequeña tienda. Empezó vendiendo bebidas y bolos( es una funda llena de jugo congelado). 

Poco a poco fue incrementando los productos que vendía, así continuo hasta ahora que tiene una tienda surtida y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Para tener aun mas surtido su negocio quiere comprar víveres, bebidas, enlatados etc. 

En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su tienda para tener asegurada la vejez.
texts.en:
Santa, 63, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She operates a small grocery because there are few opportunities to do anything else and because her husband's meager income isn't enough to pay their bills. She decided to convert the living room of her house to a small shop and began selling drinks and "bolos" (a shell filled with frozen juice). Little by little, she's added to the products that she sells so that she now has a well-stocked store. She works every day from 8:00am to 7:00pm. To better stock her store, she wants to buy everyday products, drinks, canned goods, etc. In the future, she wants to expand her store so that she will have some security as she grows older.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria J.  es una señora   de 40  años de edad la cual vive con sus 4 hijos  en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.
