Desde hace varios  años María  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos.  Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su hijos le motiva a  seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el negocio le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.
 Actualmente María  está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢641.000 (seiscientos cuarenta y un  mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

María es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera poder  crear su propia Granja.
texts.en:
María Jiménez is a 40 year old woman who lives with her four children. They live in a community called Hernández, which is in Los Chiles in the Aljuela province. This is a community that is known for its mountainous areas and beautiful countryside; it is quite humid and is located along the highway that runs very close to the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are livestock production and farming, specifically basic grains, tubers, and oranges. For several years María has been raising chickens to fatten. She also raises laying hens for their meat and eggs. She sells her products to her neighbors in her community, and they are very satisfied. She says that having her children’s support motivates her to continue with the plan. She also says that her business is very interesting to her. This is because she has seen how, little by little, her business grows and the demand is stronger every time. María is currently requesting a small loan for ¢641,000 (six hundred forty one thousand colones) to buy more chickens and hens, concentrates, and products to treat illnesses. She will also expand and strengthen her location. She hopes that by doing this her business will grow more and she will improve her quality of life. Her business is going well, but due to the lack of money she has not been able to make it grow. She will use the loan she is requesting to increase her sales and to improve her family’s economic condition. María is a member of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo” (Communal Credit Company for Development) communal bank, one of a hundred EDESA affiliates in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she plans to use it to be able to make her own farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hens and repair the corral

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistarnos a la socia Damiana. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 
Damiana,  tiene 29 años, tiene dos hijos (Mariluz de trece años y estudia en el colegio y Fabricio de cuatro años y está en el jardín). Su actividad económica principal de Damiana es la venta de fruta en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. Ella nos cuenta como empieza su trabajo, ella se levanta a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 7 de la noche. Hay temporadas en que ella compra fruta de las proveedoras que traen frutas de la ciudad de Quillabamba pero en otras ocasiones ella misma viaja a la ciudad de Quillabamba a traer mercadería. Ella requiere el préstamo para adquirir un carro y la idea de ellas es viajar en carro propio a la ciudad de Quillabamba y traer frutas y ya no comprar de las proveedoras.

El sueño de la socia es  comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
While visiting the Virgin of Copacabana Communal Bank, we interviewed Damiana, a member. The communal bank's meetings occur every 30 days in its offices in the city of Ollantaytambo. Damiana is 29 years old, has 2 children (Mariluz who is 13 and attends school, and Fabricio who is 4 and in kindergarten). Damiana's principal economic activity is selling fruit in the Virgen Asunta Market in the city of Ollantaytambo. She has done this for 6 years and it has gone very well, thanks to the effort she put into the work. Damiana told us about her workday: she rises at 6:00 am and finishes at 7:00 in the evening. There are times when she buys fruit from provisioners who bring fruit to the city of Quillabamba, but on other occasions, she herself travels to Quillabamba to bring back merchandise. Damiana needs the loan to acquire a car; her idea is to travel in her own car to Quillabamba and bring back fruit, and no longer buy from the provisioners. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A CAR TO HAUL FRUIT FROM ANOTHER CITY TO BE SOLD

loans.name: 030635- Quang Trung - Hoang Thanh- Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"N. Lường thị (03 06 087) was born in 1976 and lives in the town of Thôn Quang trung- Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hóa.  N. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 030635-Quang Trung- Hoang Thanh (030635-Quang Trung- Hoang Thanh).


N. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 800000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, N. joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4248000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê thị L. (77) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Lê thị T. (64) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Hồ thị H. (107) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


4.  Chu thị

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Mawuli Kokou

texts.fr: D. est un jeune homme célibataire très dynamique, afin de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à ses propres besoins, il s'est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, il exerce ce commerce dans une petite boutique, il a 2 ans d'ancienneté dans ce commerce. il a déjà obtenu du crédit de WAGES qu'il a remboursé, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
D. is a young single man who is very dynamic. In order to provide for his own needs, he set himself up in the general food products business in 2008. He carries out this business in a small shop and has two years' experience. He has already had a loan from WAGES which he paid back, and he is requesting another loan from WAGES to buy various general food products.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
In his mid 50’s, Patrick M. has been running an agricultural enterprise for over 14 years and is still at his best, proving to fellow agriculturalists in the area that he can make it. Having been motivated by personal traits and inspired by his parents for quite some time, hardworking Patrick had a vision to develop a banana plantation alongside his coffee-sales enterprise and livestock farming. He has been practicing this from Kanyansheko, Ibanda where he earns 320,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.

However, Patrick's main drawback is harvesting poor quantities, so with this loan he will be able to purchase agricultural inputs such as manure. This will make it possible for him to achieve greater output and earn more revenue to support his family of six children and a wife at home and to further his goal of expanding his business and educating his children, who are still attending school.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as manure for the banana plantaion

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malik M’BÔ âgé de 37 ans, marié, père de quatre enfants  il habite avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) .
Il exerce l’activité  d’achat et de vente Prêt à Porter depuis environ quatre ans après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès. 
Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour lui solliciter ce premier prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter, 10 chemises  de différentes qualités, 15 pantalons de qualités différentes, 20 paires de chaussure  de différentes qualités (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 4 complets de veste, 10 Tee-Shirt, etc. 
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako afin de les revendre dans sa boutique située en pleine cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso à une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Mr. Malik M’Bô is 37 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives with his family in Sanabougou I, Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been a retailer of ready-to-wear clothing for the past four years, after unsuccessfully trying his hand at different activities. Given the increasing number of customers and his inability to meet their expectations using his own resources, he found it useful to approach the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to request a first personal loan. The loan will enable him to buy clothes of varying quality: 10 shirts, 15 slacks, 20 pairs of shoes (Soulier and Ferardine brands), 4 vests, 10 T-shirts, etc. He resupplies in Bamako and resells his products in his shop located at the very centre of the Sikasso bus station, mainly to a customer base of travellers and drivers. With this first loan he hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 120,000 FCFA. This will enable him to increase his working capital but also honour his commitments to Soro Yiriwaso and cover other family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing (shirts, slacks, T-shirts, shoes, etc.)

loans.name: Mrs. Bou Mach Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Bou M. was selected as the leader of a group of thirteen people in Tboung Damrei village in Takeo province seeking a loan. Each group member will use his/her portion of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Bou M., 47, sells rice and Khmer cake in a local market, which enables her to earn enough income to support her family. She is also a farmer: she owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice, which she sells. Because her rice business is going well, she wants to expand. She is seeking a loan to buy more rice to sell. She is a widow with two children. One is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the other is employed in a casino club.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Ranulfo Guillermo

texts.es:
Ranulfo Guillermo G. Q. tiene 46 anos. Es casado y vive en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 18, 17, y 9 anos. 

Ranulfo es socio del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Ranulfo tiene un negocio de transporte y tambien trabaja en la agricultura. Vende sus cultivos a la semana en San Pablo. 

Solicita el credito para comprar los abonos y semillas para cultivar maíz, trigo, papas, frijoles, alverja, y mora. Su sueno es educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ranulfo Guillermo G. Q. is 46 years old.  He is married, lives in the San Pablo settlement in the Bolívar province, and has three children, ages 18, 17, and 9.  Ranulfo is a member of the “Integracion Microempresarial” group of San Pablo de Atenas.  The group is made up of 14 members, most of whom generate income for their families by being involved in different merchandising, businesses, and agriculture.

Ranulfo runs a transportation business and also works in agriculture.  He sells his harvests weekly in San Pablo.

He is asking for this loan so that he can invest in fertilizer and seed to grow corn, wheat, potatoes, beans, peas, and blackberries.  His dream is to be able to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: Fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Pomape del distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus trabajos artesanales realizados en cerámica, madera y telas. Se encuentra situada a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de veinte años a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. El cría ovejas en un ambiente cercano a su domicilio alimentándolas de pastos naturales. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos o a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad constituye la principal fuente ingresos con la que cuenta su familia. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura.

Santos desea adquirir alimento para sus animales, ya que en esta temporada el forraje se ha vuelto escaso y caro. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con el cual piensa seguir alimentando a sus ovejas.

El es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is a 53 year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Pomape sector of the Monsefú district, an area known at the regional level for its ceramic, wood and fabric handicrafts.    

For over twenty years he has raised and sold sheep.  He raises sheep in an area near his home and grazes them on natural pasture.  When they are well developed, he sells them to his neighbors or sales people who frequent the area where he lives.  This is his family's main source of income.  He also works in agriculture.  

Santos would like to buy feed for his animals, since in this season the feed is scarce and expensive.  For this reason, he has chosen to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 new soles, which he will use to continue feeding his sheep. 

He is a very tranquil and responsible person.  His greatest desire is to continue growing as a business owner in order to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his animals

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is a married woman who lives in Purok 4, Barangay Fatima, Santa Catalina, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a fishing  business.  Her husband, Raul M., who is 57 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 8 to 23 years old. 

Susan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Susan has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $238, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear and pay for maintenance on her pump boat so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Susan M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Catalina Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Catalina Maruja; tiene 58 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa para niños, ella tiene un puesto en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 p.m  hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de niños como pantalones, polos y chompas.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO” Banco Comunal, which is located in the district of Cachimayo, which belongs to the Anta province in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Señora Catalina Maruja; she is 58 years old, married and has five children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling children's clothes. She has a stall in a market in the city of Cusco and she works from 9:00am to 7:00pm. Señora Catalina Maruja wants to expand her clothes selling  business. She is requesting a loan to buy children's clothing such as pants, t-shirts and sweaters.

She is grateful for this loan and committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing such as pants, t-shirts and sweaters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing merchandise to meet the demand of her clients

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 37 años, ella se caracteriza por ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Su actividad es una pulpería que inicio hace más de 10 años, ella ha demostrado que puede salir adelante y ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos. Es por eso que se encuentra muy motivada con este medio de vida, ya que ha sido con el paso del tiempo que ha logrado adquirir la experiencia necesaria. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos entre otros. Sueña con mejorar su pulpería y proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos básicos.
texts.en: Mercedes is 37 years old.  She is known for offering good service to her customers.  Her business is a small grocery store that she set up more than 10 years ago.  She has shown that she can get ahead and improve her income.  This is why she is very motivated by this way of life since, over time, she has managed to acquire the necessary experience.  She is requesting this loan to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, etc.  She dreams of improving her grocery store and providing her family with a basic income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Naty

texts.en:
Mrs. Naty T. is 23 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Sokea Moeurn, is 25 years old.  They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have lived there since 2005 and have a 2-year-old son. 

Natyis a farmer.  She grows ginger on her farm in the village where she lives. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her ginger farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Heradio Adrian

texts.es: El señor Heradio posee un negocio que es una pulpería. Y está ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace nueve años. El realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado, las compras las efectúa en el mercado donde le resulta mucho más favorable ya que así compra el por mayor. Pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. El está solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, además es padre de cuatro niños y solamente dos están a su cargo, los cuales asisten al colegio y están a su cargo. El nos cuenta que sueña con mejorar su actividad económica que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Heradio has a general store business that has been located in his home for nine years.  He buys his supplies in cash, and sells his products both in cash and on credit.  He purchases his products at the market, which is much more cost-effective since he can buy at wholesale prices.  He has always enjoyed working and supporting his family.  

He is requesting a loan to invest in his business.  He is the father of four children, but only two are still in school and dependent on him.  He tells us that his dream is to improve his enterprise, as it is his way of life.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: La Sra. Marleny  vive en el la zona del plan 3000 desde mayo del 2010 en casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos y su esposo, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, también vende almuerzo en su domicilio, y recibe renta de su vehículo. La Sra. Marleny es cliente en su cuarto ciclo en emprender anteriormente estaba en el banco de emprendimiento La Paz durante 3 ciclos. El crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar mas víveres para su tienda de abarrotes, la Sra. Cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hijas para atender la tienda. Ella es muy trabajadora, se esfuerza junto con su esposo para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Marleny has lived in her own home in Plan 3000 neighborhood, with her husband and 4 children, since May 2010.  She owns a grocery store, sells lunches from her home and also hires out her vehicle.  Marleny is in her fourth loan cycle with Emprender.  She was previously a member of the La Paz communal bank for three loan cycles.  

Marleny is requesting a loan to buy more food products for her grocery store.  One of her daughters helps serve in the store.   Marleny is a very hard-working woman who, together with her husband, works hard to provide her children with a good education.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: Working capital.  To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Emima, 68 years old, is part of the Umucyo (a Kinyarwanda word meaning "light") group. A mother of eight children between the ages of 8-36 years old, she has been able to provide an education for only some of them due to financial limitations. Emima sells a variety of foodstuffs, a business she has enjoyed for 35 years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs, and she plans to keep her profits for savings.

Most of the other group members also sell foodstuffs, while others sell a variety of items such as fruits and vegetables, sugar, flour and other home items.

loans.use: Buying food stuffs.

loans.name: Marlene Emperatriz

texts.es:
MARLENE EMPERATRIZ A. Z., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO PROFESORA,  ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y SOLO UNO  DEPENDE DE ELLA.
DOÑA MARLENE ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC Y PERLINES PARA TERMINAR DE REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA, YA QUE ESTE EN INVIERNO EL AGUA SE PASA..
MARLENE DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A BRINDADO MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Marlene Emperatriz A. Z. is from Managua and works as a teacher. She is the mother of three children, but only one is a dependent.

Doña Marlene visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new home improvement loan to buy construction materials such as zinc and crossbeams in order to finish the repairs to the roof of her house. Water seeps through during the winter.

Marlene says she is grateful for the loans provided by CEPRODEL because they have helped her improve her home and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair her roof

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga T. K., 50 years old with one child, is living with her family in Yen Hau village. Being a farmer, her main activity focuses on growing rice, corn, and vegetable in paddies of 4,500 square meter.  These agricultural products are used to meet her family food needs.  Besides, when having free time, she and her husband do extra work as carpenters. They make wooden family equipment such as desks, tables, beds, etc.  This helps her have more money to cover her family expenditures.  

To have  more capital to buy wood to use as a material, she  wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND  from  our credit program.

 Dan T. D., a 31-year-old  woman, has run a wood workshop for many years. She needs to have a loan of 6,944,000 VND to buy materials.

 Hung V. N. is 47 years old with two children. He is raising 10 pigs for meat.  He is in need of a loan of 6,944,000 VND to buy feed for them.

 Thach V. L. is 48 years old.  He has a wood workshop that makes wooden equipment to export to other provinces. He wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy materials.

loans.use: to buy wood to use as a material.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina nació en el departamento de Arequipa y tiene 62 años de edad. Actualmente, Justina vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene su restaurante donde vende almuerzo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como pro ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas. 

Justina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Justina was born in the department of Arequipa and is 62 years old. She now lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who works selling food. She has a restaurant where she sells lunch. At this time, she needs a loan to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, and other things.

Justina is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Ana Jarvis III" communcal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and other ingredients

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
La señora Marisela vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposo y un hijo que tiene de pequeña edad.
Como desea tener su propia vivienda esta tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que ella pude recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo. 

Marisela trabaja como empleada de una papelería. Por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para completar el crédito gubernamental y así adquirí su casa. 
Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su hijo.
texts.en:
Marisela lives in a borrowed house together with her husband and her young son.  As she would like to own her own home, she is applying for a house through Infonavit (who provide government-subsidized housing loans) but the cost of the house is higher than the amount of the loan she qualifies for because her wages are low.

Marisela works as an employee in a stationery store.  She is requesting a loan to make up the difference between the amount of the government loan and the amount of down payment required so that she can acquire her house.  She would like to have secure equity for her son.

loans.use: to put towards the down payment for acquiring a house through Infonavit

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es:
Guzman tiene 61 años, vive con su esposa en su propia casa.

Tiene 21 años de experiencia en la fabricación de muebles en su propia casa tiene su taller de carpintería y ebanistería de las cuales por el tiempo de experiencia ha visto que su trabajo ha ido mejorando con la calidad de siempre y en la actualidad tiene pedidos frecuentes que hacen estables sus ingresos y le permite sostener las necesidades de su hogar, su esposa en ocasiones la apoya su esposa en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Desea para mas adelante mejorar sus ingresos y tener mejor implementado su taller renovando las que ya tiene sin embargo por el momento se abastecerá  de mayor cantidad de materia prima. 

Es su primer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos en los próximos meses. 

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de maderas que se le ha presentado por ocasión a menor costo y desea aprovechar esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Guzman is 61 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife.

He’s been making furniture from a workshop in his home for 21 years.  Over time he saw that the quality of his work was improving and now he gets frequent orders that make his income steady and allows him to support his household.  Sometimes her wife helps her seek new clients.  He hopes to be able to improve his income in the future and to renovate his workshop.  For the time being he will stock it with large amount of supplies.

This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very grateful for the opportunity and promises to be on time with his payments over the coming months.

He will use the money from this loan to buy lumber, which he has the opportunity to buy at a special price and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Javier De Jesús

texts.es: JAVIER LABORA COMO  ALBAÑIL , ES CASADO , DEPENDE CUATRO PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL SEGUNDO CREDITO CON CEPRODEL, LO NECESITA PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO ARENA , BLOQUE ,HIERRO,CEMENTO, MANO DE OBRA,PARA LEVANTAR UNA PARED DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Javier works in construction. He is married and supports four people. This is his second loan with CEPRODEL and he needs it to buy construction materials such as sand, cinder blocks, iron, cement and to pay workers to build a wall for his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya is 45 years old and lives with her son in a rented apartment in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is 14 years old and attends a secondary school.

Munhtuya runs a construction material trading business from a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2007 and has gained much experience. Recently, she began renting one more stall in order to increase her sales channel.  She is a polite woman who says, "I want to have my own house in the future."  

Munhtuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials from China to sell this coming summer.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He has been running a general shop for the past 15 years with a monthly income of 11,000 KES. He is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to add stock such as sugar, rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil for sale.  

With the anticipated profit from his business, Ephantus intends to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand his retail shop, educate his children up to high levels, and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: To add stock like sugar, rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sylvan

texts.en: Sylvan is 30 years old. He has two children who are three and six years old. His wife is a tailor and Sylvan used to ride a motorcycle for a business but he started up a tailoring business as well. Sylvan has been in the tailoring business for the past eight years and his businesses are going well. He is requesting a loan to buy pieces of fabrics to sell in his tailoring shop so that his clients will buy them if they need them.

loans.use: to buy pieces of fabrics.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old and lives in Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married with 12 children.

To earn a living, Francisca has a business selling different kind of products.  She earns about PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. Francisca has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to purchase different kinds of products such as mineral water, boiled egg, etc.

Francisca has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Francisca would like to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of products such as mineral water, boiled egg, etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor de 34 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (cuenta con varias zonas arqueológicas).

Nestor desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (pavos, patos, cerdos y ovejas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Nestor es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Néstor, 34, lives with his family in his own house that only has electricity and is located in Mórrope District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  This zone is noted for farming, raising livestock and for tourism (it has several archaeological zones).

Néstor has been raising small farm animals (turkeys, ducks, pigs and sheep) to sell for several years.  His corrals, which are apt for this, are located in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed, grains and natural grasses so that his animals will reach optimal development and he’ll be able to sell them in the various local markets obtaining good profits to cover his household’s daily expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more animals and their feed.  Profit obtained will be used to repay the loan and to provide his family with better quality of life.  Néstor is a person who has known how to move his entire family forward through effort and much dedication

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old and married to Eunice. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the rice farming business for the past eight years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to buy a water pump and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his farming business. His hope is to educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 7 y de 1 año de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en el campo. 

Nuestra amiga a mas de ser una gran madre y ama de casa también se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos para lo cual tiene una pequeña graja aprovechando que su casa  está ubicada en el campo, allí tiene las facilidades para poder criar estos animalitos que le dejan muy buenos ingresos cuando los vende. Nos cuenta que los compra cuando están pequeños y luego los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y ellos los llevan a los distintos mercados del cantón y la provincia, lleva 5 Años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y no quedar mal con los pagos al banco.
texts.en:
In the 24 de Mayo Canton in Manabí province, known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, its varied fauna and for its kind, hardworking people dedicated to farming and animal husbandry, the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.

Rosa lives here.   She’s 30 and in a common law relationship.  She has three children who are 9, 7 and 1 year old.  The two oldest are going to school.  Her husband is a field hand.

Our friend, besides being a great mother and housewife, also raises chickens and pigs.  She has a small farm taking advantage of the fact that her house is located in the countryside.  She has all the facilities there needed to raise these little animals which produce good profits when she sells them.  She tells us that she buys them when they are small and then raises them for a time and when they are ready she sells them to merchants that come by her house and then they take them to the various markets in the canton and province.  She’s been in this business for five years and does quite well.

This loan is to buy chickens and feed and medicines both for the chickens as for the pigs so that they will develop properly.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because the loans have helped her out quite a bit.  Her dream is to continue forward and not to disappoint with her bank payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine for pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором жительница района Шахритус. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается растениеводством. В основном она выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян лука и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Dilorom lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 25 years old, married and has four children.  She is involved in agriculture and primarily grows vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of onion seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Rosa Maria has been growing and selling rice for 10 years. She earns about 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from farming.

Rosa Maria has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes this loan will help improve their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mwita

texts.en: Mwita is married and blessed with one child.  For the past three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination.  In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a piece of land. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, Mwita has been able to access loan to boost his business. With this loan for 80,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Zephanous

texts.en: Zephanous intends to use this loan to buy second-hand clothes. He has always gotten money for the same purpose and is happy with the progress of his business as his stock and turnover have greatly increased. His challenge is price fluctuation and his dream is to buy and sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dennys Eduardo

texts.es:
Dennys pertenece al banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” y las reuniones de los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco. 

Dennys tiene 21 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Dennys es la distribución de “papitas ligth”. Desde abril de este año compra los productos de una marca conocida y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Dennys requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como “papitas ligth”. 

Dennys agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Dennys belongs to the communal bank "Qorichaska del Cusco" which holds member meetings every month in the city and province of Cusco.

Dennys is 21 years old and has a common-law wife and a son.  He was born in the city of Cusco which is where he lives now and runs his business distributing "papitas light" (light potato chips).  Since April of this year he has been buying the products of a well-known brand, and thanks to his hard work business is doing well.

On this occasion Dennys needs a loan to buy wholesale merchandise, such as the "papitas light".  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale goods.

loans.name: Canaan Youth Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Canaan Youth Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kevin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Kevin is the facilitator of the Canaan Youth group. Kevin is pictured alongside his group members  in the photograph. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Canaan Youth group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Kevin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Kevin had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Kevin was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Kevin will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Sibang Sari Group

texts.en:
The Sibang Sari group is a women's group and has 10 members. The group is located at the Penyambangan village, Gerokgak district, North Bali. This is the first group in this area. The group consist of 10 women who have the same business: pig breeder. Although they already have a main job, they run this business to support their family income. Most of them work at the beach breeding fish.

Gusti Putu, as the head of the group, coordinated the group to receive the loan and training from MUK. They need the loan to start the business and the training to improve their knowledge of pig breeding. Gusti Putu will use the loan to purchase four local pigs for pig roll.

She has a plan to save the profit to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase four local pigs

loans.name: Manuel Agustín

texts.es:
Manuel Agustín tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá y los hermanos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol hace 3 años.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura comprar semillas, abonos agrícolas.
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar más insumos. El sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para trabajar, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a dios.

Con la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR ha podido mejorar el estilo de vida, la relación familiar ha mejorado, los ingresos han aumentado a medida que se va vendiendo los productos.
texts.en:
Manuel Agustín is 20 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his mother and brothers in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. The Jerusalen communal bank is located in the precinct of Caimito, which is in the Puerto Pechiche parish of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This communal bank is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work such as planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Manuel has grown corn, rice, and beans for three years.

He buys and sells in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farm work.

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy more supplies. His dream is to be able to have his own land to work, and he has not encountered any problems. In his free time, he likes to devote himself to God.

With the help of Credito Anterior he has been able to improve his lifestyle, and his family relations have improved. His earnings have increased as the produce sells.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farm work.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie 32 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Rubie runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, and soaps. Rubie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

Rubie is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Rubie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela cuenta 39 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos a cargo, su esposo se llama Arquímedes es técnico  sus hijos están estudiando Amairani esta  cursando 3° de prepa, Brayam esta en 1° y Gibram 3° de secundaria.

Ella tiene un negocio de electrónica donde su esposo es el técnico ella invertirá el préstamo en algunos líquidos que utiliza y material piezas que hacen falta para reparar algunos aparatos, ellos ya tienen 25 años con su taller doña Carmela esta pensando abrir un local y poner su taller.
texts.en:
Carmela is 39 years old, married and has three children in her care.  Her husband’s name is Arquímedes and he’s a technician.  Her children attend school.  Amairani is in 12th grade, Brayam is in 1st and Gibram is in 9th grade.

She has an electronics repair shop where her husband is the technician.  She will use the loan to buy some liquids he uses and spare parts needed to repair some devices.  They have had the shop for 25 years and Carmela is planning on opening a local and set up her shop.

loans.use: to buy some liquids she uses and to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 57 years old green grocer and cereal seller. She is married to Njeru, and together they are blessed with two sons. Sofia has been running her grocery and cereal store for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Sofia is applying for her second loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to purchase more beans, maize, ground nuts, bananas to stock her business for more profits. 

With the anticipated profit from the business. she will pay her loan and pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, maize, ground nuts and bananas for resale

loans.name: Chuachinup 2 Group

texts.es: Antonia es de 25 años de edad, es soltera  (es la que aparece de primero de izquierda a derecha de blusa café), vive en el municipio de Nahuála, departamento de Sololá, ella obtiene sus ingresos de la venta de banano en el lugar donde vive, formaron un grupo para ayudarse entre ellas en las labores de manteamiento y cosecha de banano, a ellas le gusta esta actividad porque les genera ingresos para poder mantener a su familia, Antonia solicita un crédito para comprar insumos para el mantenimiento de banano,  aprendió de sus padres los conocimientos de este oficio desde pequeña, dentro los planes de ella es sembrar más plantaciones de banano en el futuro.
texts.en:
Antonia (who is the woman appearing first, from left to right, in the brown top) is 25 years old.  She is single and lives in the town of Nahuála, in the Sololá region.  She gets her income from selling bananas in the place where she lives.  

They formed a group to help each other in the maintenance and harvesting chores of the banana plants.  She likes this work because it creates income for supporting her family.  Antonia is asking for a loan to buy supplies to care for her banana plants.  She learned how to do this work from her parents when she was young.  Among her future plans is planting more banana fields.

loans.use: to perform upkeep on her banana trees

loans.name: Carmen Pastora

texts.es: Doña Carmen Pastora trabaja arduamente para salir adelante con su negocio de gimnasio y mejorar sus ingresos que tanta ayuda le ha dado a ella y sus hijos quienes están estudiando, Carmen Pastora quien también alquila cuartos con el crédito anterior logro realizarles mejora y acondiciono el gimnasio. Solicita nuevamente el apoyo de crédito para poder comprar maquinas de ejercicio como bicicleta, elíptica y una caminadora, esta inversión permitirá que a su clientela no le haga falta este tipo de maquinarias, garantizando así la economía familiar.

loans.use: Carmen Pastora solicita el crédito para invertirle a su negocio de gimnasio, de esta manera podrá obtener más ingresos para mantener la educación de sus hijos.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a 39-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and is blessed with four children; they are 18, 15, 13 and 10 years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer to make a better living. Aside from cultivating their farm, her husband also engaged in buying and selling pigs.

While Rosalita helps her husband financially by doing a hog-raising business. She has been successfully starts this business eight years ago. 

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and additional capital to buy pigs to sell. In the future, Rosalita wishes to improve their livelihood for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pigs

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.en:
My name is Maria Martina. I have a small business selling firewood which I have been operating for several years. It generates income to support my daily expenses since my husband and I have been on our own now that all of our children are married. With this business we can have an income to satisfy our needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Mi nombre el Maria Martina, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de leña en mi casa de habitación, activadad que realizo desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para mi sustento diario ya que mi esposo y yo ya nos quedamos solos todos nuestros hijos se han casado y con este negocio podemos obtner ingresos para satisfacer nuestras necesidades.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, corn and dairy products

loans.name: Danina

texts.en:
Danina is divorced and has one grown son. She and her son own a small precision glass-cutting and dicing workshop located in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Close proximity to busy train and bus stations makes this a very favorable location for business growth. Danina and her son use both thermal and score and break methods in their work to cut glass that is used in a variety of applications. They have about $4,000 of working capital in the business and their monthly gross revenue amounts to $1,000. Danina has been working in this business for 10 years. Originally, she started her entrepreneurial activity as a grocery retailer. However, later she joined her son in operating their glass-cutting and dicing workshop. Hard-work and tenacity have helped this family enterprise reach sustainability and success. Danina would like to get a loan for $1,200 to buy sheets of glass which are 3mm or less in thickness for her workshop. The extra supply of glass will help her and her son produce more material for architectural and design applications, as well as for tile, signage and lighting uses. Danina is hoping that increased sales activity will generate the necessary funds to sustain their business as well as to meet her family’s needs.

Даніна – розлучена, в неї є дорослий син. Вони з сином тримають майстерню з нарізки скла в центрі Івано-Франківська. Зовсім недалеко знаходиться залізниця та автовокзал, а це, в свою чергу, сприяє розвитку бізнесу. Даніна використовує різні методи обробки скла, яке потім використовується в різних сферах підприємствах. Зараз в них приблизно 4000 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісячний дохід складає 1000 доларів. Даніна займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Починала свою підприємницьку діяльність вона з торгівлі харчами. Однак, пізніше Даніна приєдналася до свого сина в його майстерні з нарізки скла. Наполеглива праця та цілеспрямованість допомогли цьому сімейному бізнесу стати стабільним та успішним. Даніна хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати скло товщиною не більше 3мм для роботи майстерні. Додаткові запаси скла допоможуть Даніні та сину виготовляти більше матеріалів для різних гілок підприємств. Даніна сподівається, що збільшення обсягів продажу допоможе їй отримати необхідні кошти для того, щоб розвивати бізнес та забезпечувати потреби власної родини.

loans.use: To purchase glass

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: I  Mrs. Josephine A. is a business woman, with the help of LAPO loan i can take care of my family. I have learned how to use capital to ensure the continuity of the business I run.  Also she is married with five (5) children. She is requesting for $350 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more plastic rubber for sale

loans.name: Delia Ana

texts.en: Deila, a young Juliaqueña, sells artesania she makes in order to support herself. She began as a little girl in her mothers store and from there learned various crafts including weaving. Now she has her own store in which she sells mainly woven goods but also a variety of other hand-crafted artesania. She hopes to save enough money within the next two years to enter the University of the Andes in Juliaca, where she wants to study accounting so that she can eventually work in a bank such as PRISMA helping other women who need microlaons. She is asking for a loan of $275 to buy a different type of loom to weave new types of material on. This would help her reach her goal of entering the university within two years.

loans.use: To purchase a new loom.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 34 years old, is married and the father of  children and lives in Bourj Barajneh in the suburbs of Beirut. He learned the skill of carpenter at the age of 16 and now owns a furniture repair shop in a high density population area. Ali is requesting a loan for the first time. He recently learned the existence of Al Majmoua and the availability of financing for his small business. He wants a loan of USD $1,000 to buy a stock of basic material he needs in his work such as wood, fabrics, and sponges to fill in chairs, as well as other accessories. Ali's dream is to save enough money to afford sending his three children to a good university in the future.

loans.use: Purchase wood, fabrics and accessories as working capital for his furniture repair business

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en: Koffi K. is 32 years old. He lives with his cohabitant in Attecoube, a populated township in North-West  Abidjan. Koffi sells frozen and fresh fish in the Attecoubé open market. He has been in this business for more than 5 years. Koffi stopped going to school in secondary school, but has since found his way forward with this business, in which he performs very well. Koffi joined the AE&I microcredit program in January 2005 and has been a good performer since then. With the increase in his revenue, he has moved to a better house. K. is a dynamic and hard worker and will use the loan to purchase cartons of frozen fish.

loans.use: Koffi Kouakou will use the loan to purchase cartons of frozen fish

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara A. runs a hair salon in Maili Majo, a busy rural town on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She established the business in 2005, and has already repaid one loan from SELFINA. Zahara has applied for a new loan to purchase additional equipment and stock, such as driers, curlers, shampoo, conditioner and hairpieces. Zahara is a 38-year-old widow with three children, Fatima, 20, Shekha, 18 and Said, 16. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase equipment and haircare products for Zahara Salon

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei has a successful business selling fruits and vegetables at a market in Beregovo, Ukraine. He started his business about six years ago after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy. Sergei purchases produce items at very low prices and is then able to resell them for a profit. Because he sells in bulk amounts, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Sergei rents a very good location at the market for his business and he has a small amount of competition. His profit for a typical month is around $600. 

Sergei has requested a loan of $1200 to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more produce to sell, enabling him to increase his profits and continue operating a profitable business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Ohunjon

texts.en: N. Ohunjon lives in the Asht region and he is married and has 4 children. Mr.N. is a teacher by the profession but the business that brings his family income is raising and selling livestock.  Now Mr.N. requests the loan of 2500 STJ to purchase a pedigreed milking cow.  This will permit him and his wife to manufacture milk-sour products and sell them to the local trade outlets.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Wanyange Lake F D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Edisa N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy a public pay phone. Edisa is 25 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 months to 12 years old and her children go to school. Each week, Edisa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house.

Edisa is joined in her small group by Juliet S., Mariam G. and Prossy K.. Juliet S. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to order more chicks. Mariam G. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to buy broiler mash (feed) and a fridge. Prossy K. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to add more stock.

loans.use: To start a public phone business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco Javier C. is 47 years old and he's been married to Mrs. Margarita Navarro for over 27 years. They live in their own home in a neighborhood that is far away from the city - about 12 kilometers. They have all household needs covered. It is also worthed to mention that they have three sons - two are enrolled in the neighborhood's public school and the oldest is married and has a family.

Francisco is the owner of a convenience store that has been in business for more than 4 years and it is located in his own home. His wife and children help run it. It should also be mentioned that Mr. Francisco work as a security guard for Proseguir. He has been with that company for more than 12 years and the income generated there is very important to cover family expenses.

This is a tight-knit family that struggle and support each other in order to pay all the family's expenses and cover the boys' ongoing school costs; therefore, they need help from their family.

The credit line requested will be used to expand his commercial location. Currently, it sits in his home and it is too small to comfortably accommodate customers and to adequately fit the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Francisco Javier C. de 47 años de edad está casado hace mas de de 27 años con la señora Margarita Navarro, ellos viven en casa propia en un barrio que esta retirado de la ciudad, aproximadamente 12 kilómetros, y cuentan con todas las necesidades básicas para el hogar. Cabe mencionar que tienen tres hijos de las cuales dos de ellos son menores de edad y van al colegio público de la zona y el mayor ya es casado y tiene su familia.

Francisco es propietario de una despensa que funciona hace más de 4 años y esta ubicado en su propio domicilio particular y que es atendida por su señora y por sus hijos. Cabe destacar que el Señor Francisco a parte trabaja como guardia de seguridad en la Empresa Prosegur con una antigüedad de 12 años y un ingreso mensual importante para los gastos del hogar.

Se trata de una familia muy unida y sacrificada que se ayudan mutuamente para así poder solventar todos los gastos de la casa y así poder pagar el estudio de sus dos hijos que están en etapa de colegio y necesitan el apoyo de la familia.

El crédito que solicita el cliente servirá para la ampliación del local comercial por que esta dentro de la casa y le resulta muy pequeño el espacio y quiere tener mejor comodidad para sus clientes y espacio para sus mercaderías.

loans.use: Expand business location.
